Name: Bodyweight Blast
Description: Bodyweight Blast is a high-intensity, 15-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout designed to maximize your fitness using just your bodyweight. Perfect for travel or home workouts, this session challenges your strength, cardio, and endurance with functional exercises like squats, push-ups, lunges, and burpees. Move quickly and with good form, aiming to complete as many rounds as possible in the time allotted. No equipment required—just your determination!
Flavor_Text: Bodyweight Blast – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Burpees, 10 Sit-ups, 15 Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Burpees, 20 Sit-ups, 30 Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Burpees, 20 Sit-ups, 30 Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Burpees, 20 Sit-ups, 30 Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 burpees, 20 sit-ups, 30 air squats.
Instructions_Clean: 10 burpees, 20 sit-ups, 30 air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Flavor_Text.from: Bodyweight Blast - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: Bodyweight Blast – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.

Name: The Seven
Description: The Seven is a high-intensity, time-based workout that challenges strength and endurance using a barbell and bodyweight movements. Athletes complete 7 rounds for time of 7 different exercises, each performed for 7 reps. Movements typically include handstand push-ups, thrusters, knees-to-elbows, deadlifts, burpees, kettlebell swings, and pull-ups. This WOD demands mental toughness and efficient pacing.
Flavor_Text: The Seven – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: Focus on quality movement and consistent pacing—avoid redlining early. Scale weights or reps as needed to maintain proper form, especially under fatigue. Manage transitions efficiently and stay disciplined on rest periods. Have your equipment and space set up in advance for smooth flow. Prioritize safety, especially on heavy lifts, and stay mindful of technique throughout all seven rounds.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 3 Handstand Push-ups, 3 Thrusters (30/22 kgs), 3 Knees-to-Elbows, 3 Deadlifts (55/37 kgs), 3 Burpees, 3 Kettlebell Swings (1pood/1.2pood), 3 Pull-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 7 Handstand Push-ups, 7 Thrusters (60/45 kgs), 7 Knees-to-Elbows, 7 Deadlifts (110/75 kgs), 7 Burpees, 7 Kettlebell Swings (2pood/1.5pood), 7 Pull-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 7 Handstand Push-ups, 7 Thrusters (60/45 kgs), 7 Knees-to-Elbows, 7 Deadlifts (110/75 kgs), 7 Burpees, 7 Kettlebell Swings (2pood/1.5pood), 7 Pull-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 7 Handstand Push-ups, 7 Thrusters (60/45 kgs), 7 Knees-to-Elbows, 7 Deadlifts (110/75 kgs), 7 Burpees, 7 Kettlebell Swings (2pood/1.5pood), 7 Pull-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 7 handstand push-ups, 7 thrusters (60/45 kgs), 7 knees-to-elbows, 7 deadlifts (110/75 kgs), 7 burpees, 7 kettlebell swings (2pood/1.5pood), 7 pull-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 7 handstand push-ups, 7 thrusters (60/45 kgs), 7 knees-to-elbows, 7 deadlifts (110/75 kgs), 7 burpees, 7 kettlebell swings (2pood/1.5pood), 7 pull-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Running EMOM
Description: EMOM stands for "Every Minute On the Minute." For this 20-minute running EMOM, begin a prescribed running distance or interval at the top of each minute. Complete the set as quickly as possible, then rest for the remainder of the minute. The cycle repeats every minute for 20 minutes. This format helps build speed and aerobic capacity through repeated, manageable bursts.
Flavor_Text: Running EMOM – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early—avoid sprinting the first few rounds. Aim for consistent times across intervals. Focus on efficient running form and controlled breathing. Use the rest period to recover, shake out your legs, and prep for the next interval. If you start missing work-rest windows, adjust the distance to maintain good quality throughout all 20 minutes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd Minutes: 7 Burpees. Even Minutes: 100m Run. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd Minutes: 15 Burpees. Even Minutes: 200m Run. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd Minutes: 15 Burpees. Even Minutes: 200m Run. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd Minutes: 15 Burpees. Even Minutes: 200m Run. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd minutes: 15 burpees. even minutes: 200m run.
Instructions_Clean: odd minutes: 15 burpees. even minutes: 200m run.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Weighted Isabel
Description: Weighted Isabel is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout performed for time. The athlete completes 30 snatches (ground to overhead in one motion) with a barbell at a prescribed or chosen weight, aiming to finish as quickly as possible. This high-intensity workout tests power, strength, speed, and technique.
Flavor_Text: Weighted Isabel – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on efficient barbell cycling and proper snatch mechanics—set your back, use your hips, and keep the bar close. Pace the first half to avoid burnout; singles are acceptable if needed. Prioritize safety: use a weight you can lift with good form, especially under fatigue. Warm up thoroughly and practice form with lighter weight before starting.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Complete 15 Snatches (30/22 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Complete 30 Snatches (60/45 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Complete 30 Snatches (60/45 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Complete 30 Snatches (60/45 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: complete 30 snatches (60/45 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: complete 30 snatches (60/45 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Thruster Ladder
Description: The Thruster Ladder workout is an AMRAP (As Many Rounds/Reps As Possible) performed in a 12-minute interval. Athletes perform thrusters with progressively increasing weights or reps, moving up the “ladder” as far as possible before time expires. Rest as needed between efforts, but maximize continuous movement.
Flavor_Text: Thruster Ladder – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on maintaining strong squat mechanics and a powerful overhead press throughout each thruster. Keep your core engaged and drive with your legs for maximum efficiency. Pace yourself early to avoid burnout; consistent movement is key. Prioritize quality reps over speed as the weight or reps increase. Scale load or reps to sustain good form throughout the workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Thrusters (22/15 kgs), 1 Pull-ups. Add 1 reps to each movement every round (3, 3; 4, 4; etc.) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 3 Thrusters (45/30 kgs), 3 Pull-ups. Add 3 reps to each movement every round (6, 6; 9, 9; etc.) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 3 Thrusters (45/30 kgs), 3 Pull-ups. Add 3 reps to each movement every round (6, 6; 9, 9; etc.) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 3 Thrusters (45/30 kgs), 3 Pull-ups. Add 3 reps to each movement every round (6, 6; 9, 9; etc.) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 3 thrusters (45/30 kgs), 3 pull-ups. add 3 reps to each movement every round (6, 6; 9, 9; etc.)
Instructions_Clean: 3 thrusters (45/30 kgs), 3 pull-ups. add 3 repetitions to each movement every round (6, 6; 9, 9; etc.)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Dumbbell Trio
Description: The Dumbbell Trio is a fast-paced, full-body workout using dumbbells or kettlebells. For time, complete three main compound movements in sequential rounds, targeting major muscle groups, building strength, endurance, and metabolic conditioning. This versatile workout can be scaled for any fitness level.
Flavor_Text: Dumbbell Trio – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Prioritize quality form over speed; maintain a neutral spine throughout movements.  
- Choose a weight you can move steadily without compromising technique.  
- Breathe consistently—exhale on the exertion phase of each rep.  
- Keep transitions between exercises quick to maintain intensity.  
- Scale reps or load as needed but push to finish strong.  
- Warm up thoroughly and cool down with stretching post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10 Dumbbell Snatches (12/7 kgs), 10 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (10 in), 10 V-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20 Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 20 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (20 in), 20 V-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 20 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (20 in), 20 V-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 20 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (20 in), 20 V-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20 dumbbell snatches (25/15 kgs), 20 dumbbell box step-overs (20 in), 20 v-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 20 dumbbell snatches (25/15 kgs), 20 dumbbell box step-overs (20 in), 20 v-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Benchmark B
Description: Benchmark B is a high-intensity monostructural cardio workout, completed for time. It features one continuous movement modality—such as running, rowing, cycling, or skiing—for a set distance or calories. The goal is to complete the prescribed workload as quickly as possible, promoting aerobic capacity, pacing, and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Benchmark B – An engine test; settle into a pace you can actually hold.
CoachNotes: Push your pace without sacrificing technique. Warm up thoroughly and plan a sustainable effort—start slightly slower than all-out and build speed in the latter half. Focus on consistent breathing and posture. Log your time for future comparison and to track progress in cardiovascular fitness.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Double Unders (1x reps: 50-40-30-20-10), Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Double Unders (2x reps: 100-80-60-40-20), Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Double Unders (2x reps: 100-80-60-40-20), Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Double Unders (2x reps: 100-80-60-40-20), Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: double unders (2x reps: 100-80-60-40-20), air squats.
Instructions_Clean: double unders (2x repetitions: 100-80-60-40-20), air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Core Destroyer
Description: Core Destroyer is a gymnastics-focused, for-time workout designed to challenge and develop maximal core strength and endurance. This circuit blends dynamic and static core movements—such as toes-to-bar, hanging knee raises, L-sit holds, and strict abmat sit-ups—to target all major abdominal muscle groups efficiently. Athletes complete all prescribed reps as quickly as possible while maintaining skillful movement and strict form.
Flavor_Text: Core Destroyer – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: Prioritize quality of movement, especially on hanging and strict core exercises—avoid swinging or kipping. Scale movements to athlete capacity (e.g., knee raises instead of toes-to-bar, bent-knee L-sit holds). Encourage consistent pacing to prevent early fatigue. Cue strong bracing of the midline on every rep. Remind athletes to breathe steadily during static holds and transition smoothly between movements. Reinforce the value of core control for overall athletic performance and injury prevention.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 GHD Sit-ups, 5 Toes-to-Bar, 7 Back Extensions. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 GHD Sit-ups, 10 Toes-to-Bar, 15 Back Extensions. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 GHD Sit-ups, 10 Toes-to-Bar, 15 Back Extensions. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 GHD Sit-ups, 10 Toes-to-Bar, 15 Back Extensions. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 ghd sit-ups, 10 toes-to-bar, 15 back extensions. for time
Instructions_Clean: 15 ghd sit-ups, 10 toes-to-bar, 15 back extensions. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

This circuit blends dynamic and static core movements—such as toes-to-bar, hanging knee raises, L-sit holds, and strict abmat sit-ups—to target all major abdominal muscle groups efficiently. Athletes complete all prescribed reps as quickly as possible while maintaining skillful movement and strict form.

CoachNotes.from:
Description:  
Core Destroyer is a gymnastics-focused, for-time workout designed to challenge and develop maximal core strength and endurance. This circuit blends dynamic and static core movements—such as toes-to-bar, hanging knee raises, L-sit holds, and strict abmat sit-ups—to target all major abdominal muscle groups efficiently. Athletes complete all prescribed reps as quickly as possible while maintaining skillful movement and strict form.

CoachNotes:  
Prioritize quality of movement, especially on hanging and strict core exercises—avoid swinging or kipping. Scale movements to athlete capacity (e.g., knee raises instead of toes-to-bar, bent-knee L-sit holds). Encourage consistent pacing to prevent early fatigue. Cue strong bracing of the midline on every rep. Remind athletes to breathe steadily during static holds and transition smoothly between movements. Reinforce the value of core control for overall athletic performance and injury prevention.
CoachNotes.to: Prioritize quality of movement, especially on hanging and strict core exercises—avoid swinging or kipping. Scale movements to athlete capacity (e.g., knee raises instead of toes-to-bar, bent-knee L-sit holds). Encourage consistent pacing to prevent early fatigue. Cue strong bracing of the midline on every rep. Remind athletes to breathe steadily during static holds and transition smoothly between movements. Reinforce the value of core control for overall athletic performance and injury prevention.

Flavor_Text.from: Core Destroyer - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Core Destroyer – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.

Name: Kettlebell Swing & Goblet
Description: This full-body workout alternates between Kettlebell Swings and Goblet Squats using a kettlebell or dumbbell. Complete as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) in 18 minutes, focusing on controlled movement and proper form throughout.
Flavor_Text: Kettlebell Swing & Goblet – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize technique over speed—maintain a flat back and strong core during swings and keep heels down in squats. Choose a weight you can control for all reps. Breathe rhythmically, hinge at the hips for swings, and squat to parallel. Rest as needed but keep moving for the duration.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg), 5 Goblet Squats (12/8 kg), 2 Strict Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 10 Goblet Squats (24/16 kg), 5 Strict Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 10 Goblet Squats (24/16 kg), 5 Strict Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 10 Goblet Squats (24/16 kg), 5 Strict Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), 10 goblet squats (24/16 kg), 5 strict push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 15 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), 10 goblet squats (24/16 kg), 5 strict push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Heavy Deadlifts
Description: Heavy Deadlifts utilize a barbell loaded with challenging weight, performed for a set number of repetitions as quickly as possible, prioritizing both strength and stamina. This compound movement targets the posterior chain—including glutes, hamstrings, and lower back—while also engaging forearms and core.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Deadlifts – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: Focus on maintaining a neutral spine and strong core bracing throughout each rep. Drive feet through the floor and keep the bar close to your body. Prioritize perfect form over speed; reset your grip and position between reps if needed. Scale weight as necessary to preserve safe, technically sound movement patterns, even under fatigue.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Deadlifts (62/42 kgs), 5 Hand Release Push-ups, 7 Box Jumps (12/10 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Deadlifts (125/85 kgs), 10 Hand Release Push-ups, 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Deadlifts (125/85 kgs), 10 Hand Release Push-ups, 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Deadlifts (125/85 kgs), 10 Hand Release Push-ups, 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 deadlifts (125/85 kgs), 10 hand release push-ups, 15 box jumps (24/20 in).
Instructions_Clean: 5 deadlifts (125/85 kgs), 10 hand release push-ups, 15 box jumps (24/20 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Running & Rowing
Description: This intense, time-based workout combines running and rowing for a powerful cardiovascular challenge. Participants alternate between running and rowing over set distances or intervals, emphasizing continuous effort and efficient pacing. Suitable for all fitness levels, it is designed to build aerobic capacity, enhance endurance, and improve overall conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Running & Rowing – Long, steady output; aim for a rhythm you could explain, not survive.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pacing—avoid starting too fast. Maintain strong posture during both running and rowing. On the rower, drive through the legs and keep strokes smooth. Monitor breathing to stay relaxed under fatigue. Adjust distances or rest as needed for beginners; push the pace for advanced athletes. Record total completion time for progress tracking.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Complete the distance on the Rower, then run the same distance. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Complete the distance on the Rower, then run the same distance. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Complete the distance on the Rower, then run the same distance. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Complete the distance on the Rower, then run the same distance. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: complete the distance on the rower, then run the same distance. for time
Instructions_Clean: complete the distance on the rower, then run the same distance. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Pressing Pyramid
Description: Pressing Pyramid (EMOM/Pacing, EMOM 15) is a structured 15-minute workout where athletes perform pressing movements (e.g., dumbbell or barbell shoulder press) every minute on the minute (EMOM). Repetitions typically increase (ascend) and then decrease (descend) to form a pyramid pattern, challenging both muscular endurance and pacing. Example: Minute 1—3 reps, Minute 2—5 reps, Minute 3—7 reps, then reverse back down.
Flavor_Text: Pressing Pyramid – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Choose a pressing weight that is challenging but allows unbroken sets and good form throughout.  
- Focus on maintaining consistent tempo and technique, especially as fatigue builds.  
- Use the rest of each minute to recover—avoid racing through reps.  
- Pay close attention to shoulder stability and core engagement to protect joints.  
- Scale weight or reps as needed for newer athletes. Push for full range of motion on each press.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd Minutes: Max effort Strict Press (22/15 kgs). Even Minutes: Max effort Pull-ups. Rest on the 7th minute. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd Minutes: Max effort Strict Press (45/30 kgs). Even Minutes: Max effort Pull-ups. Rest on the 15th minute. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd Minutes: Max effort Strict Press (45/30 kgs). Even Minutes: Max effort Pull-ups. Rest on the 15th minute. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd Minutes: Max effort Strict Press (45/30 kgs). Even Minutes: Max effort Pull-ups. Rest on the 15th minute. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd minutes: max effort strict press (45/30 kgs). even minutes: max effort pull-ups. rest on the 15th minute.
Instructions_Clean: odd minutes: max effort strict press (45/30 kgs). even minutes: max effort pull-ups. rest on the 15th minute.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Partner Thruster
Description: The Partner Thruster is a compound, full-body barbell movement performed with a partner, alternating repetitions. Each athlete performs a front squat immediately followed by an overhead press (thruster) before passing the barbell to the partner. The workout is scored for time, emphasizing teamwork, coordination, and endurance.
Flavor_Text: Partner Thruster – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Prioritize proper squat depth and a strong, explosive drive through the hips into the overhead press.  
- Sync up with your partner on transitions to maintain tempo and minimize downtime.  
- Choose a manageable weight to ensure consistent reps and good form.  
- Communicate! Alternate smoothly and watch for signs of fatigue to adjust pacing.  
- Warm up shoulders, hips, and legs thoroughly before starting.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Accumulate 50 Thrusters (22/15 kgs). Partner A works, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A breaks. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Accumulate 100 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Partner A works, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A breaks. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Accumulate 100 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Partner A works, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A breaks. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Accumulate 100 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Partner A works, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A breaks. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: accumulate 100 thrusters (45/30 kgs). partner a works, partner b holds a plank. switch when partner a breaks.
Instructions_Clean: accumulate 100 thrusters (45/30 kgs). partner a works, partner b holds a plank. switch when partner a breaks.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Bike & Burpee
Description: A high-intensity workout combining bike intervals and burpees. Complete as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) or specified repetitions within set time intervals. Alternate between bursts on the bike and sets of burpees. Challenge endurance, cardio, and full-body strength.
Flavor_Text: Bike & Burpee – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace your sprints to avoid burnout early. Focus on explosive power and good form during burpees—chest to floor, full extension at the top. Use the bike intervals to push your cardio threshold, but maintain a steady rhythm. Scale burpee reps or bike resistance as needed. Track rounds for progress and aim for consistent effort throughout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10/7 Calorie Bike, 5 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20/15 Calorie Bike, 10 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20/15 Calorie Bike, 10 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20/15 Calorie Bike, 10 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20/15 calorie bike, 10 burpee box jump overs.
Instructions_Clean: 20/15 calorie bike, 10 burpee box jump overs.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Chipper
Description: The Chipper is a grind and endurance workout performed “for time,” meaning you complete a long sequence of different movements and set reps—typically high volume—in order, finishing each exercise before moving to the next. The goal is to complete all reps and exercises as quickly as possible. Expect a demanding, total-body challenge that pushes your muscular and aerobic endurance.
Flavor_Text: The Chipper – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early; avoid the temptation to sprint through the first movements. Break large rep schemes into manageable sets with short rests. Focus on consistent form—fatigue will tempt you to compromise technique. Stay mentally tough, chip away at the reps, and keep progressing. Hydrate and breathe steadily throughout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 Box Jumps, 20 Wall Balls, 15 Kettlebell Swings, 10 Toes-to-Bar, 5 Overhead Squats (22/15 kgs). Must complete all reps of one exercise before moving to the next. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 Box Jumps, 40 Wall Balls, 30 Kettlebell Swings, 20 Toes-to-Bar, 10 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). Must complete all reps of one exercise before moving to the next. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 Box Jumps, 40 Wall Balls, 30 Kettlebell Swings, 20 Toes-to-Bar, 10 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). Must complete all reps of one exercise before moving to the next. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 Box Jumps, 40 Wall Balls, 30 Kettlebell Swings, 20 Toes-to-Bar, 10 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). Must complete all reps of one exercise before moving to the next. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 box jumps, 40 wall balls, 30 kettlebell swings, 20 toes-to-bar, 10 overhead squats (45/30 kgs). must complete all reps of one exercise before moving to the next.
Instructions_Clean: 50 box jumps, 40 wall balls, 30 kettlebell swings, 20 toes-to-bar, 10 overhead squats (45/30 kgs). must complete all repetitions of one exercise before moving to the next.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Dumbbell Devils
Description: The Dumbbell Devils workout is a 10-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) using a dumbbell or kettlebell. It typically involves the movement known as the "Devil’s Press"—which combines a burpee, a ground-to-overhead lift, and often a jump—using your chosen weight. The goal is to complete as many devil’s presses as possible in 10 minutes, maintaining good form throughout.
Flavor_Text: Dumbbell Devils – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Choose a weight you can move with proper technique for the full 10 minutes.  
- Maintain a steady, sustainable pace to avoid early burnout.  
- Keep your back neutral during the lift; avoid rounding.  
- Use your hips and legs to generate power, not just your arms.  
- Breathe consistently: inhale on the way down, exhale on the press.  
- Have your equipment and space ready before starting—safety first.  
- Scale reps or modify with step-backs as needed for ability level.  
- Record your rounds for tracking progress.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Devil's Press (12/7 kgs), 5 Alternating Pistol Squats (or weighted Lunges). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Devil's Press (25/15 kgs), 10 Alternating Pistol Squats (or weighted Lunges). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Devil's Press (25/15 kgs), 10 Alternating Pistol Squats (or weighted Lunges). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Devil's Press (25/15 kgs), 10 Alternating Pistol Squats (or weighted Lunges). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 devil's press (25/15 kgs), 10 alternating pistol squats (or weighted lunges).
Instructions_Clean: 5 devil's press (25/15 kgs), 10 alternating pistol squats (or weighted lunges).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Triple EMOM
Description: Triple EMOM is a 24-minute workout structured as three 8-minute EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) intervals. Each 8-minute segment focuses on a different exercise or movement combination. At the start of each minute, you perform the prescribed reps and use the rest of the minute to recover before beginning the next round. This format builds stamina, pacing, and consistency over a longer, sustained effort.
Flavor_Text: Triple EMOM – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Aim for steady, repeatable effort across all intervals. Choose rep schemes that challenge you but allow consistent completion within 35–45 seconds, leaving adequate rest. Focus on quality movement, maintaining good form even as fatigue sets in. Use your first few minutes to establish a sustainable pace—don’t sprint early. Prioritize breathing, shake out arms/legs between rounds, and prepare for a quick transition between segments.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Minute 1: 6/4 Calorie Row. Minute 1: 5 Burpees over the Rower. Minute 1: 5 GHD Sit-ups. Minute 2: Rest. (Repeat 3 times) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Minute 1: 12/9 Calorie Row. Minute 2: 10 Burpees over the Rower. Minute 3: 10 GHD Sit-ups. Minute 4: Rest. (Repeat 6 times) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Minute 1: 12/9 Calorie Row. Minute 2: 10 Burpees over the Rower. Minute 3: 10 GHD Sit-ups. Minute 4: Rest. (Repeat 6 times) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Minute 1: 12/9 Calorie Row. Minute 2: 10 Burpees over the Rower. Minute 3: 10 GHD Sit-ups. Minute 4: Rest. (Repeat 6 times) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: minute 1: 12/9 calorie row. minute 2: 10 burpees over the rower. minute 3: 10 ghd sit-ups. minute 4: rest. (repeat 6 times)
Instructions_Clean: minute 1: 12/9 calorie row. minute 2: 10 burpees over the rower. minute 3: 10 ghd sit-ups. minute 4: rest. (repeat 6 times)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Dumbbell AMRAP
Description: The Dumbbell AMRAP workout challenges you to complete as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) in 20 minutes. Using a pair of dumbbells, cycle through a set sequence of exercises repeatedly with minimal rest. This high-intensity format builds muscular endurance, strength, and cardiovascular fitness, making it great for burning calories and improving full-body conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Dumbbell AMRAP – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Choose a manageable dumbbell weight that allows good form throughout. Focus on steady pacing—avoid burnout in the first few minutes. Maintain quality reps over speed, especially as fatigue sets in. Track your round count for progress next session. Stay hydrated, and listen to your body for any signs of excessive fatigue or form breakdown.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Dumbbell Thrusters (10/5 kgs), 5 Dumbbell Facing Burpees, 5 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (10 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Dumbbell Thrusters (20/10 kgs), 10 Dumbbell Facing Burpees, 10 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Dumbbell Thrusters (20/10 kgs), 10 Dumbbell Facing Burpees, 10 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Dumbbell Thrusters (20/10 kgs), 10 Dumbbell Facing Burpees, 10 Dumbbell Box Step-overs (20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 dumbbell thrusters (20/10 kgs), 10 dumbbell facing burpees, 10 dumbbell box step-overs (20 in).
Instructions_Clean: 10 dumbbell thrusters (20/10 kgs), 10 dumbbell facing burpees, 10 dumbbell box step-overs (20 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Strict Gymnastics
Description: A focused gymnastics skill session structured as EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) for 16 minutes. Athletes will perform a prescribed gymnastics movement or progression at the top of each minute, practicing strict form with an emphasis on technique, control, and strength development.
Flavor_Text: Strict Gymnastics – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Prioritize perfect form over quantity; quality reps only.
- Modify movement difficulty to match each athlete's skill level (e.g., strict pull-ups, dips, handstand push-ups).
- Aim for 15-40 seconds of work per minute; leave rest for transition and recovery.
- Cue tension throughout the body, controlled movement, and full range of motion.
- Encourage strict tempo—no kipping or momentum.
- Track reps or hardest progression achieved for future benchmarks.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd Minutes: Max Strict Pull-ups. Even Minutes: Max Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd Minutes: Max Strict Pull-ups. Even Minutes: Max Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd Minutes: Max Strict Pull-ups. Even Minutes: Max Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd Minutes: Max Strict Pull-ups. Even Minutes: Max Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd minutes: max strict pull-ups. even minutes: max strict handstand push-ups. for time
Instructions_Clean: odd minutes: max strict pull-ups. even minutes: max strict handstand push-ups. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Running EMOM Deluxe
Description: Running EMOM Deluxe is a 30-minute interval workout structured as "Every Minute On the Minute" (EMOM). Athletes run a set distance or pace each minute, focusing on consistent tempo and controlled recovery. The goal is to maintain or slightly increase effort across all intervals, maximizing aerobic conditioning and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Running EMOM Deluxe – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize even pacing from the start—avoid sprinting early. Use the first few rounds to settle into your target pace, monitoring effort and breathing. Maintain upright posture and relaxed shoulders; focus on efficient stride mechanics. Recovery between runs is brief, so manage your energy output. Track your splits to ensure consistency. Adjust your speed as needed to sustain good form throughout all 30 minutes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Minute 1: 100m Run. Minute 1: 7 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). Minute 1: 5 Push-ups. (Repeat 5 times) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Minute 1: 200m Run. Minute 2: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Minute 3: 10 Push-ups. (Repeat 10 times) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Minute 1: 200m Run. Minute 2: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Minute 3: 10 Push-ups. (Repeat 10 times) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Minute 1: 200m Run. Minute 2: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Minute 3: 10 Push-ups. (Repeat 10 times) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: minute 1: 200m run. minute 2: 15 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). minute 3: 10 push-ups. (repeat 10 times)
Instructions_Clean: minute 1: 200m run. minute 2: 15 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). minute 3: 10 push-ups. (repeat 10 times)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Barbell & Bike AMRAP
Description: Barbell & Bike AMRAP is a high-intensity 14-minute workout alternating between barbell weightlifting movements and intervals on an exercise bike. The goal is to complete as many rounds and repetitions as possible, challenging both strength and cardiovascular endurance. This blend maximizes calorie burn, builds muscle, and improves conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Barbell & Bike AMRAP – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize smooth form on barbell movements—choose a weight that allows for unbroken sets but is still challenging. Push for consistent effort on the bike, keeping RPMs steady throughout. Focus on quick transitions and maintain steady breathing. Scale loading or bike intensity as needed to ensure full effort is sustained across all 14 minutes. Always warm up well and cool down with stretches post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 6 Deadlifts (42/30 kgs), 4 Hang Power Cleans (42/30 kgs), 5/4 Calorie Bike. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 12 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 8 Hang Power Cleans (85/60 kgs), 10/8 Calorie Bike. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 12 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 8 Hang Power Cleans (85/60 kgs), 10/8 Calorie Bike. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 12 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 8 Hang Power Cleans (85/60 kgs), 10/8 Calorie Bike. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 12 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 8 hang power cleans (85/60 kgs), 10/8 calorie bike.
Instructions_Clean: 12 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 8 hang power cleans (85/60 kgs), 10/8 calorie bike.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Bodyweight 30
Description:
Workout Title: Bodyweight 30 (Bodyweight/travel, AMRAP 30)

Description:  
Perform as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) in 30 minutes of a full-body bodyweight circuit designed for travel or home workouts. This workout requires no equipment and targets strength, endurance, and mobility. Move at a steady pace with minimal rest, focusing on quality movement. Ideal for all fitness levels and easily scalable by adjusting reps or exercise variations.
Flavor_Text: Bodyweight 30 – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Single Unders, 10 Sit-ups, 5 Walking Lunges (per leg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Single Unders, 20 Sit-ups, 10 Walking Lunges (per leg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Single Unders, 20 Sit-ups, 10 Walking Lunges (per leg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Single Unders, 20 Sit-ups, 10 Walking Lunges (per leg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 single unders, 20 sit-ups, 10 walking lunges (per leg). for time
Instructions_Clean: 100 single unders, 20 sit-ups, 10 walking lunges (per leg). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Push/pull EMOM
Description: The Push/Pull EMOM is a 20-minute "Every Minute on the Minute" workout alternating between gymnastics-based pushing and pulling movements. Each odd minute, perform a set of push-focused exercises (e.g., handstand push-ups or push-ups); each even minute, perform a pulling movement (e.g., pull-ups or ring rows). Focus on controlled, high-quality reps, scaling skill and volume as needed.
Flavor_Text: The Push/pull EMOM – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes: Prioritize technique over speed. Select progressions that challenge your current skill level without compromising form. Modify reps to maintain unbroken sets within 40 seconds each round, allowing sufficient rest and recovery. Use active hollow and arch positions. Warm up shoulders, wrists, and lats thoroughly. Maintain consistent pacing throughout all 20 rounds.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd Minutes: Max Ring Dips. Even Minutes: Max Toes-to-Bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd Minutes: Max Ring Dips. Even Minutes: Max Toes-to-Bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd Minutes: Max Ring Dips. Even Minutes: Max Toes-to-Bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd Minutes: Max Ring Dips. Even Minutes: Max Toes-to-Bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd minutes: max ring dips. even minutes: max toes-to-bar. for time
Instructions_Clean: odd minutes: max ring dips. even minutes: max toes-to-bar. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
Description:  
The Push/Pull EMOM is a 20-minute "Every Minute on the Minute" workout alternating between gymnastics-based pushing and pulling movements. Each odd minute, perform a set of push-focused exercises (e.g., handstand push-ups or push-ups); each even minute, perform a pulling movement (e.g., pull-ups or ring rows). Focus on controlled, high-quality reps, scaling skill and volume as needed.

CoachNotes:  
Prioritize technique over speed. Select progressions that challenge your current skill level without compromising form. Modify reps to maintain unbroken sets within 40 seconds each round, allowing sufficient rest and recovery. Use active hollow and arch positions. Warm up shoulders, wrists, and lats thoroughly. Maintain consistent pacing throughout all 20 rounds.

Name: Overhead Carry AMRAP
Description: The Overhead Carry AMRAP is a 16-minute workout where participants carry dumbbells or kettlebells locked out overhead for as many rounds as possible. Each round consists of walking a designated distance (e.g., 15–25 meters) while maintaining stable, extended arms and a strong core. Rest only as needed, focusing on maintaining proper form and overhead stability throughout.
Flavor_Text: Overhead Carry AMRAP – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize active shoulders by pressing weights fully overhead. Keep ribcage down and core engaged to avoid overextension. If grip or shoulder stability becomes a limiting factor, rest briefly and resume with correct form. Choose a load that challenges you but allows for unbroken carries. Maintain controlled breathing and steady footwork. Adjust distance as needed to ensure quality movement for the entire AMRAP.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (right arm, (12/7 kgs), 5 Burpees, 25 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (left arm), 5 Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (right arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 Burpees, 50 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (left arm), 10 Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (right arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 Burpees, 50 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (left arm), 10 Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (right arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 Burpees, 50 ft Single-Arm Overhead Dumbbell Carry (left arm), 10 Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 ft single-arm overhead dumbbell carry (right arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 burpees, 50 ft single-arm overhead dumbbell carry (left arm), 10 sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 50 ft single-arm overhead dumbbell carry (right arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 burpees, 50 ft single-arm overhead dumbbell carry (left arm), 10 sit-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: EMOM Of Thrusters
Description: EMOM 10 of Thrusters: Every minute on the minute for 10 minutes, perform a prescribed number of thrusters (e.g., 8–10 reps). Use a moderate load that allows for consistent unbroken sets. Rest for the remainder of each minute.
Flavor_Text: EMOM Of Thrusters – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on smooth, efficient movement—drive through your heels, keep the chest tall, and lock out overhead each rep. Aim to complete all reps in 30–40 seconds, leaving ample rest to maintain pacing and quality. Scale weight or reps as needed to finish each round strong and maintain consistent technique throughout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Complete 3 Thrusters (22/15 kgs). Rest with any remaining time. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Complete 6 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Rest with any remaining time. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Complete 6 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Rest with any remaining time. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Complete 6 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Rest with any remaining time. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: complete 6 thrusters (45/30 kgs). rest with any remaining time.
Instructions_Clean: complete 6 thrusters (45/30 kgs). rest with any remaining time.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Rowing Pyramid AMRAP
Description: Rowing Pyramid AMRAP is a 17-minute workout where you alternate rowing intervals with increasing and then decreasing effort levels, aiming for maximum rounds and repetitions. The structure typically moves from short to longer efforts (e.g., 100m, 200m, 300m), then back down, with minimal rest between each.
Flavor_Text: Rowing Pyramid AMRAP – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pace and quality strokes as the interval distances change. Avoid sprinting early; manage your effort to sustain intensity through the entire 17 minutes. Prioritize technique, maintain strong posture, and monitor your splits for optimal performance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Pull-ups, 5 Push-ups, 7 Squats. After each round, row 50m before starting the next round. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Pull-ups, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. After each round, row 100m before starting the next round. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Pull-ups, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. After each round, row 100m before starting the next round. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Pull-ups, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. After each round, row 100m before starting the next round. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 pull-ups, 10 push-ups, 15 squats. after each round, row 100m before starting the next round.
Instructions_Clean: 5 pull-ups, 10 push-ups, 15 squats. after each round, row 100m before starting the next round.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Snatch Cycle AMRAP
Description: The Snatch Cycle AMRAP is a 12-minute, as-many-reps-as-possible workout using a barbell. Athletes perform repeated snatch movements—pulling the barbell from ground to overhead in one motion. This workout challenges strength, power, and endurance.
Flavor_Text: Snatch Cycle AMRAP – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on flawless technique—set your back, use your hips, and drive explosively. Prioritize consistency over speed; fatigue can degrade form. Scale weight as needed for unbroken sets and safety. Pace yourself to maintain quality reps throughout the 12 minutes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 3 Power Snatches (17/12 kgs), 6 Box Jumps (12/10 in), 9 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 6 Power Snatches (35/25 kgs), 12 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 18 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 6 Power Snatches (35/25 kgs), 12 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 18 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 6 Power Snatches (35/25 kgs), 12 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 18 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 6 power snatches (35/25 kgs), 12 box jumps (24/20 in), 18 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
Instructions_Clean: 6 power snatches (35/25 kgs), 12 box jumps (24/20 in), 18 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Partner AMRAP (alt Rounds)
Description: Partner AMRAP (Alternating Rounds) is a 24-minute workout where you and a partner alternate completing full rounds of a circuit. While one partner works through the round as quickly as possible, the other rests. The goal is to complete as many total rounds as possible in 24 minutes, switching after each full round.
Flavor_Text: Partner AMRAP (alt Rounds) – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Focus on high effort during work periods—push yourself, then recover while your partner works.
- Communicate and encourage your partner throughout for maximum intensity.
- Transition quickly between rounds to minimize downtime.
- Select weights and movements you can sustain for the full 24 minutes.
- Track total rounds for team benchmarking and motivation.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Partner A completes a full round of: 7 Wall Balls, 5 Calorie Row. Partner B rests. Partners alternate rounds. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Partner A completes a full round of: 15 Wall Balls, 10 Calorie Row. Partner B rests. Partners alternate rounds. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Partner A completes a full round of: 15 Wall Balls, 10 Calorie Row. Partner B rests. Partners alternate rounds. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Partner A completes a full round of: 15 Wall Balls, 10 Calorie Row. Partner B rests. Partners alternate rounds. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: partner a completes a full round of: 15 wall balls, 10 calorie row. partner b rests. partners alternate rounds.
Instructions_Clean: partner a completes a full round of: 15 wall balls, 10 calorie row. partner b rests. partners alternate rounds.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Heavy Dumbbell EMOM
Description: Heavy Dumbbell EMOM is a 15-minute “Every Minute On the Minute” workout using a single dumbbell or kettlebell. At the start of each minute, perform a prescribed number of heavy repetitions (e.g., cleans, snatches, or thrusters), then rest for the remainder of the minute. Repeat for 15 rounds. This format builds strength, endurance, and power while encouraging consistent pace and form.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Dumbbell EMOM – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes:
**  
Choose a weight that is challenging but allows you to maintain good technique throughout all 15 minutes. Focus on explosive yet controlled movements, emphasizing full range of motion. Manage your pace to ensure sufficient rest each round. If form breaks down, reduce reps or weight. This EMOM is designed to push your strength under fatigue while minimizing risk of injury.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Minutes 1-2: 2 Dumbbell Cleans (15/12 kgs). Minutes 3-5: 2 Dumbbell Shoulder-to-Overhead. Minutes 5-7: 2 Dumbbell Squats (holding DBs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Minutes 1-5: 5 Dumbbell Cleans (30/25 kgs). Minutes 6-10: 5 Dumbbell Shoulder-to-Overhead. Minutes 11-15: 5 Dumbbell Squats (holding DBs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Minutes 1-5: 5 Dumbbell Cleans (30/25 kgs). Minutes 6-10: 5 Dumbbell Shoulder-to-Overhead. Minutes 11-15: 5 Dumbbell Squats (holding DBs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Minutes 1-5: 5 Dumbbell Cleans (30/25 kgs). Minutes 6-10: 5 Dumbbell Shoulder-to-Overhead. Minutes 11-15: 5 Dumbbell Squats (holding DBs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: minutes 1-5: 5 dumbbell cleans (30/25 kgs). minutes 6-10: 5 dumbbell shoulder-to-overhead. minutes 11-15: 5 dumbbell squats (holding dbs).

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Gymnastics Chipper AMRAP
Description: A Gymnastics Chipper AMRAP is a 15-minute workout where you aim to complete as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) of a sequence of bodyweight gymnastics movements. Each round typically includes multiple movements (such as pull-ups, push-ups, toes-to-bar, and handstand push-ups), challenging your muscular endurance and gymnastic skills.
Flavor_Text: Gymnastics Chipper AMRAP – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Prioritize consistent pacing; avoid burning out early.  
- Break up large sets before reaching failure to preserve form and intensity.  
- Focus on quality reps—maintain proper technique, especially under fatigue.  
- Tailor movements (scale) based on your current ability level to ensure safety and continuous movement.  
- Use transitions between movements as built-in recovery.  
- Track rounds and reps for motivation and measurable progress.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 7 Hand Release Push-ups, 10 AbMat Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 15 Hand Release Push-ups, 20 AbMat Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 15 Hand Release Push-ups, 20 AbMat Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 15 Hand Release Push-ups, 20 AbMat Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 chest-to-bar pull-ups, 15 hand release push-ups, 20 abmat sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 10 chest-to-bar pull-ups, 15 hand release push-ups, 20 abmat sit-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Each round typically includes multiple movements (such as pull-ups, push-ups, toes-to-bar, and handstand push-ups), challenging your muscular endurance and gymnastic skills.

CoachNotes.from:
**Description:**  
A Gymnastics Chipper AMRAP is a 15-minute workout where you aim to complete as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) of a sequence of bodyweight gymnastics movements. Each round typically includes multiple movements (such as pull-ups, push-ups, toes-to-bar, and handstand push-ups), challenging your muscular endurance and gymnastic skills.

**CoachNotes:**  
- Prioritize consistent pacing; avoid burning out early.  
- Break up large sets before reaching failure to preserve form and intensity.  
- Focus on quality reps—maintain proper technique, especially under fatigue.  
- Tailor movements (scale) based on your current ability level to ensure safety and continuous movement.  
- Use transitions between movements as built-in recovery.  
- Track rounds and reps for motivation and measurable progress.

Name: Double-under EMOM
Description: EMOM 18: Every minute on the minute for 18 minutes, perform a set number of double-unders. Choose a sustainable target (example: 20-50 reps each minute), aiming for consistent unbroken sets. Rest for the remainder of each minute.
Flavor_Text: Double-under EMOM – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on relaxed, efficient cycling and steady breathing. Prioritize wrist speed over big jumps. If form breaks down, reduce reps to maintain quality. Use the early rounds to establish rhythm and preserve shoulders/calves. Scale to single-unders or attempt double-under practice for beginners. Aim for at least 15-20 seconds rest each round.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Minute 1: 25 Double-Unders. Minute 1: 5 V-Ups. Minute 1: 2 Clean & Jerks (30/22 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Minute 1: 50 Double-Unders. Minute 2: 10 V-Ups. Minute 3: 5 Clean & Jerks (60/45 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Minute 1: 50 Double-Unders. Minute 2: 10 V-Ups. Minute 3: 5 Clean & Jerks (60/45 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Minute 1: 50 Double-Unders. Minute 2: 10 V-Ups. Minute 3: 5 Clean & Jerks (60/45 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: minute 1: 50 double-unders. minute 2: 10 v-ups. minute 3: 5 clean & jerks (60/45 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: minute 1: 50 double-unders. minute 2: 10 v-ups. minute 3: 5 clean & jerks (60/45 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: 3 Rounds Of AMRAP
Description: Complete as many rounds and repetitions as possible (AMRAP) within 4 minutes. After each 4-minute work interval, rest for 1 minute. Repeat for a total of 3 rounds. Record total reps each round and aim to maintain consistent quality and intensity throughout.
Flavor_Text: 3 Rounds Of AMRAP – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Warm up joints and activate core before starting.  
- Pace yourself in the first round; focus on steady, controlled movement rather than sprinting out fast.  
- Track reps or rounds completed in each AMRAP to monitor performance.  
- Use the 1-minute rest to recover with slow breathing and gentle movement.  
- Prioritize form over speed to prevent fatigue-induced errors.  
- Challenge yourself to match or beat your rep count each round.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Push Press (22/15 kgs), 5 Toes-to-Bar. Score is total reps across all 1 working rounds. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Push Press (45/30 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar. Score is total reps across all 3 working rounds. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Push Press (45/30 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar. Score is total reps across all 3 working rounds. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Push Press (45/30 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar. Score is total reps across all 3 working rounds. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 push press (45/30 kgs), 10 toes-to-bar. score is total reps across all 3 working rounds.
Instructions_Clean: 10 push press (45/30 kgs), 10 toes-to-bar. score is total repetitions across all 3 working rounds.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Bike & Box EMOM
Description: Bike & Box EMOM is a 16-minute workout alternating between cardio and plyometrics. Every minute on the minute (EMOM), you'll switch between calorie bike sprints and box jumps or step-overs. Odd minutes: Perform a set number of calories on the bike. Even minutes: Complete a set number of box jumps/step-overs. Pace yourself to stay consistent across all rounds.
Flavor_Text: Bike & Box EMOM – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on quick transitions and steady pacing—avoid going all-out early. Use efficient movement on both the bike and the box. Choose rep/calorie targets that are challenging but allow at least 15 seconds of rest each minute. Maintain upright posture on the bike and controlled landings on the box. Scale as needed and prioritize quality over speed.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd Minutes: 6/4 Calorie Bike. Even Minutes: 4 Box Jumps (15/12 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd Minutes: 12/9 Calorie Bike. Even Minutes: 8 Box Jumps (30/24 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd Minutes: 12/9 Calorie Bike. Even Minutes: 8 Box Jumps (30/24 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd Minutes: 12/9 Calorie Bike. Even Minutes: 8 Box Jumps (30/24 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd minutes: 12/9 calorie bike. even minutes: 8 box jumps (30/24 in).
Instructions_Clean: odd minutes: 12/9 calorie bike. even minutes: 8 box jumps (30/24 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Kettlebell Swing AMRAP
Description: The Kettlebell Swing AMRAP is a 10-minute workout where you complete as many reps as possible (AMRAP) of kettlebell or dumbbell swings. This full-body movement targets your hips, glutes, core, and shoulders, focusing on explosive hip drive and proper hinge mechanics.
Flavor_Text: Kettlebell Swing AMRAP – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Keep your core braced and back flat throughout each rep. Drive the kettlebell with your hips, not your arms, and let your glutes snap the weight up. Avoid rounding your back or using your shoulders to lift. Pace yourself—find a steady rhythm to maximize reps while maintaining great form across all 10 minutes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Russian Kettlebell Swings (16/12 kg), 5 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Russian Kettlebell Swings (32/24 kg), 10 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Russian Kettlebell Swings (32/24 kg), 10 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Russian Kettlebell Swings (32/24 kg), 10 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 russian kettlebell swings (32/24 kg), 10 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 10 russian kettlebell swings (32/24 kg), 10 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Bodyweight Intervals
Description: Bodyweight Intervals (Bodyweight/Travel, AMRAP 3) is a high-intensity workout using only your bodyweight, ideal for travel or minimal-equipment settings. Perform as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) of selected bodyweight exercises within a 3-minute interval, focusing on form and intensity. This workout boosts cardiovascular endurance, burns calories, and builds functional strength—all without any equipment.
Flavor_Text: Bodyweight Intervals – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Burpees, 5 Push-ups, 7 Squats. Score is total rounds/reps completed. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Burpees, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. Score is total rounds/reps completed. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Burpees, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. Score is total rounds/reps completed. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Burpees, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. Score is total rounds/reps completed. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 burpees, 10 push-ups, 15 squats. score is total rounds/reps completed.
Instructions_Clean: 5 burpees, 10 push-ups, 15 squats. score is total rounds/repetitions completed.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.
