Name: Rope Climb & Kettlebell
Description: This workout combines rope climbs and kettlebell movements to develop upper body and grip strength, coordination, and cardiovascular endurance. For time, athletes will alternate between rope climbs—using full body pulling technique—and kettlebell exercises such as swings or cleans. Efficiency and technique are emphasized for both skill and stamina.
Flavor_Text: Rope Climb & Kettlebell – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Prioritize strong rope climbing mechanics: high knees, efficient foot locks, and pulling with back and arms.  
- Scale rope climbs by reducing height, using rope pulls, or practicing footwork if needed.  
- For kettlebells, ensure safe back alignment—chest up, core braced, drive through the hips.  
- Manage grip fatigue by pacing transitions and reserving strength for later rounds.  
- Encourage consistent movement quality over rushed reps to prevent form breakdown.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Rope Climbs (7 ft), 10 Kettlebell Snatches (12/8 kg, alternating). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 3 Rope Climbs (15 ft), 21 Kettlebell Snatches (24/16 kg, alternating). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 3 Rope Climbs (15 ft), 21 Kettlebell Snatches (24/16 kg, alternating). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 3 Rope Climbs (15 ft), 21 Kettlebell Snatches (24/16 kg, alternating). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 3 rope climbs (15 ft), 21 kettlebell snatches (24/16 kg, alternating).
Instructions_Clean: 3 rope climbs (15 ft), 21 kettlebell snatches (24/16 kg, alternating).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: The Half Chipper
Description: The Half Chipper is a grind and endurance-focused workout performed for time. Athletes complete a sequence of high-rep movements—typically hitting half the volume of a full chipper—with the goal of finishing as quickly as possible. This format challenges both cardiovascular stamina and muscular endurance across multiple functional exercises.
Flavor_Text: The Half Chipper – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early to avoid burnout. Break reps into manageable sets and focus on consistent, quality movement. Prioritize efficient transitions between movements. Keep breathing steady and monitor form under fatigue to minimize risk of injury. Aim for steady progress rather than sprinting, especially through larger sets.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 Thrusters (17/12 kgs), 25 Toes-to-Bar, 25 GHD Sit-ups, 25 Double Unders. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 Thrusters (35/25 kgs), 50 Toes-to-Bar, 50 GHD Sit-ups, 50 Double Unders. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 Thrusters (35/25 kgs), 50 Toes-to-Bar, 50 GHD Sit-ups, 50 Double Unders. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 Thrusters (35/25 kgs), 50 Toes-to-Bar, 50 GHD Sit-ups, 50 Double Unders. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

EquipmentNeeded: Barbell, Pull-up Bar, GHD, Jump Rope
Instructions: 50 thrusters (35/25 kgs), 50 toes-to-bar, 50 ghd sit-ups, 50 double unders.
Instructions_Clean: 50 thrusters (35/25 kgs), 50 toes-to-bar, 50 ghd sit-ups, 50 double unders.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Tempo Squat EMOM
Description: Tempo Squat EMOM is a 12-minute workout where you perform a set number of squats at a controlled tempo at the start of every minute. For each rep, maintain a prescribed tempo (e.g., 3 seconds down, 1 second pause, 2 seconds up) to focus on muscle control, strength, and form under consistent pacing.
Flavor_Text: Tempo Squat EMOM – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize quality over speed—maintain strict tempo for each squat. Keep core engaged and track your breathing with each phase of the lift. Choose a load that allows you to maintain perfect form for all reps throughout the 12 minutes. The goal is technique refinement and building strength endurance. Rest for the remainder of each minute, but be ready to begin promptly at the next interval.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Back Squats (30/22 kgs) with a 1-second descent (Tempo 15X1). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Back Squats (60/45 kgs) with a 3-second descent (Tempo 30X0). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Back Squats (60/45 kgs) with a 3-second descent (Tempo 30X0). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Back Squats (60/45 kgs) with a 3-second descent (Tempo 30X0). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 back squats (60/45 kgs) with a 3-second descent (tempo 30x0).
Instructions_Clean: 5 back squats (60/45 kgs) with a 3-second descent (tempo 30x0).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Dumbbell & Run
Description: Dumbbell & Run is a full-body, high-intensity AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed in 17 minutes. Athletes alternate between dumbbell or kettlebell strength movements—such as cleans, snatches, or thrusters—and running intervals (e.g., 200-400m). The goal is to complete as many rounds and reps as possible within the time cap, pushing both muscle endurance and cardiovascular capacity.
Flavor_Text: Dumbbell & Run – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Choose a dumbbell or kettlebell weight that allows you to maintain good form without excessive rest.   
- Pace the runs to keep transitions smooth—avoid an all-out sprint that may spike your heart rate too early.  
- Focus on quality reps: maintain a neutral spine and controlled tempo during lifts.  
- Break up reps proactively to avoid burnout, especially in later rounds.  
- Stay consistent—steady effort beats starting too fast and fading.  
- Prioritize safe movement patterns and listen to your body.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 200m Run, 5 Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (12/7 kgs), alternating legs), 5 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 400m Run, 10 Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (25/15 kgs), alternating legs), 10 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 400m Run, 10 Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (25/15 kgs), alternating legs), 10 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 400m Run, 10 Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (25/15 kgs), alternating legs), 10 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 400m run, 10 dumbbell overhead lunges (25/15 kgs), alternating legs), 10 dumbbell hang power cleans.
Instructions_Clean: 400m run, 10 dumbbell overhead lunges (25/15 kgs), alternating legs), 10 dumbbell hang power cleans.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Heavy Clean & Front Squat
Description: The Heavy Clean & Front Squat workout combines Olympic weightlifting and strength training for a challenging, full-body session. Athletes perform barbell cleans from the floor to the front rack position, immediately followed by controlled front squats. Performing for time increases intensity and builds power, explosiveness, and functional leg strength.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Clean & Front Squat – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: Maintain a straight back and engaged core throughout. Drive powerfully with your hips on the clean, catching the bar in a strong rack position. For the front squat, keep elbows high, chest upright, and squat below parallel. Use weights that challenge you but allow good form on every rep. Ensure full range of motion and avoid rushing at the expense of technique. Rest strategically to maintain quality movement under fatigue.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Squat Cleans (42/30 kgs), 5 Front Squats (42/30 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Squat Cleans (85/60 kgs), 10 Front Squats (85/60 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Squat Cleans (85/60 kgs), 10 Front Squats (85/60 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Squat Cleans (85/60 kgs), 10 Front Squats (85/60 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 squat cleans (85/60 kgs), 10 front squats (85/60 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 5 squat cleans (85/60 kgs), 10 front squats (85/60 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Flavor_Text.to: Heavy Clean & Front Squat – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.

Name: Hotel Hell
Description: Hotel Hell is a high-intensity, bodyweight-only workout designed for travel or minimal-equipment settings like hotels. Complete all prescribed rounds for time, striving to finish as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form. Expect a challenging, full-body routine that targets strength, endurance, and cardio fitness using functional movements such as squats, push-ups, lunges, and burpees. Suitable for all fitness levels—just scale the movements or pace as needed.
Flavor_Text: Hotel Hell – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Push-ups, 5 Sit-ups, 5 Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Push-ups, 10 Sit-ups, 10 Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Push-ups, 10 Sit-ups, 10 Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Push-ups, 10 Sit-ups, 10 Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 push-ups, 10 sit-ups, 10 air squats.
Instructions_Clean: 10 push-ups, 10 sit-ups, 10 air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Airport AMRAP
Description: Airport AMRAP is a 25-minute, bodyweight-only workout designed for travelers or anyone without access to equipment. Perform “As Many Rounds As Possible” (AMRAP) of a series of functional movements—such as air squats, push-ups, lunges, and burpees—focusing on consistency and good form. This efficient, space-friendly routine boosts heart rate, burns calories, and helps maintain strength while on the go.
Flavor_Text: Airport AMRAP – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Burpees, 5 V-Ups, 7 Box Jumps (or Step-ups onto bench/sturdy chair). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Burpees, 10 V-Ups, 15 Box Jumps (or Step-ups onto bench/sturdy chair). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Burpees, 10 V-Ups, 15 Box Jumps (or Step-ups onto bench/sturdy chair). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Burpees, 10 V-Ups, 15 Box Jumps (or Step-ups onto bench/sturdy chair). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 burpees, 10 v-ups, 15 box jumps (or step-ups onto bench/sturdy chair).
Instructions_Clean: 5 burpees, 10 v-ups, 15 box jumps (or step-ups onto bench/sturdy chair).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Jump Rope Grinder
Description: The Jump Rope Grinder is a high-intensity, bodyweight workout designed for travel or home settings. You'll perform repeated rounds of jump rope, interspersed with functional bodyweight movements like squats, push-ups, and sit-ups in an "AMRAP" (as many rounds as possible) or "for time" format. This workout boosts cardiovascular endurance, coordination, and muscular stamina without equipment—just bring your jump rope and energy. Suitable for all fitness levels, it's easily scalable by adjusting reps or rounds.
Flavor_Text: Jump Rope Grinder – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 150 Single Unders (or 50 Double Unders), 25 Walking Lunges, 12 Hand Release Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 300 Single Unders (or 100 Double Unders), 50 Walking Lunges, 25 Hand Release Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 300 Single Unders (or 100 Double Unders), 50 Walking Lunges, 25 Hand Release Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 300 Single Unders (or 100 Double Unders), 50 Walking Lunges, 25 Hand Release Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 300 single unders (or 100 double unders), 50 walking lunges, 25 hand release push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 300 single unders (or 100 double unders), 50 walking lunges, 25 hand release push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: One Dumbbell Travel
Description: One Dumbbell Travel is a minimalist, full-body workout: every minute on the minute (EMOM) for 15 minutes, perform a set of movements using a single dumbbell or kettlebell. This travel-friendly session maximizes training with minimal equipment, targeting strength, power, and endurance.
Flavor_Text: One Dumbbell Travel – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on quality movement rather than speed. If possible, alternate arms each round for balanced development. Choose a weight that’s challenging but allows you to maintain good form throughout. Prioritize core engagement, especially during unilateral movements. Adapt reps as needed to complete the work with 10–20 seconds of rest each minute. Ideal for limited space or on-the-go workouts.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd Minutes: 5 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (2 per arm). Even Minutes: 5 Dumbbell Goblet Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd Minutes: 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (5 per arm). Even Minutes: 10 Dumbbell Goblet Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd Minutes: 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (5 per arm). Even Minutes: 10 Dumbbell Goblet Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd Minutes: 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (5 per arm). Even Minutes: 10 Dumbbell Goblet Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd minutes: 10 single-arm dumbbell snatches (5 per arm). even minutes: 10 dumbbell goblet squats.
Instructions_Clean: odd minutes: 10 single-arm dumbbell snatches (5 per arm). even minutes: 10 dumbbell goblet squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Staircase Sprint
Description: Staircase Sprint is a high-intensity cardio workout ideal for travel and small spaces. Using any accessible staircase, sprint up the steps as fast as possible, then walk or jog back down for recovery. Repeat for the prescribed number of rounds or a set time. This bodyweight exercise rapidly elevates heart rate, challenges lower body strength and power, enhances coordination, and torches calories, making it efficient for building speed, endurance, and overall cardiovascular fitness without equipment. Always use caution, maintain clear footing, and ensure the stairs are safe for running.
Flavor_Text: Staircase Sprint – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Sprint up two flights of stairs, 7 Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Sprint up two flights of stairs, 15 Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Sprint up two flights of stairs, 15 Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Sprint up two flights of stairs, 15 Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: sprint up two flights of stairs, 15 push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: sprint up two flights of stairs, 15 push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Cindy's Cousin
Description: Cindy’s Cousin is a 20-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) bodyweight workout ideal for travel or training anywhere. The workout cycles through three functional movements: 5 push-ups, 10 sit-ups, and 15 air squats per round. Aim to complete as many rounds as possible within the time limit, maintaining steady pacing and proper form throughout. Great for building muscular endurance, cardiovascular fitness, and core strength with no equipment required.
Flavor_Text: Cindy's Cousin – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Pike Push-ups, 5 Alternating Pistol Squats (or Assisted), 7 Box Dips (on sturdy surface). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Pike Push-ups, 10 Alternating Pistol Squats (or Assisted), 15 Box Dips (on sturdy surface). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Pike Push-ups, 10 Alternating Pistol Squats (or Assisted), 15 Box Dips (on sturdy surface). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Pike Push-ups, 10 Alternating Pistol Squats (or Assisted), 15 Box Dips (on sturdy surface). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 pike push-ups, 10 alternating pistol squats (or assisted), 15 box dips (on sturdy surface).
Instructions_Clean: 5 pike push-ups, 10 alternating pistol squats (or assisted), 15 box dips (on sturdy surface).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Travel Chipper
Description: Travel Chipper is a bodyweight workout designed for completion anywhere, without equipment. Tackle each movement for the prescribed repetitions before advancing. This “chipper” format encourages consistency and endurance, challenging all major muscle groups for an efficient, total-body sweat. Set your best time and beat it each trip!
Flavor_Text: Travel Chipper – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Burpees, Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Burpees, Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Burpees, Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Burpees, Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: burpees, air squats. for time
Instructions_Clean: burpees, air squats. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Kettlebell Kitchen
Description: Kettlebell Kitchen is a fast-paced, full-body workout completed for time using a dumbbell or kettlebell. The routine typically combines dynamic movements such as swings, goblet squats, and presses to challenge muscle endurance and cardiovascular fitness. Expect a blend of strength and conditioning that targets all major muscle groups while also improving core stability and grip strength.
Flavor_Text: Kettlebell Kitchen – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Select a moderate weight that allows proper form throughout the workout. Focus on controlled, explosive movements — keep your core braced and back flat, especially during swings and squats. Pace yourself to avoid early burnout, but maintain consistent intensity. Prioritize quality repetitions over speed. Rest briefly as needed, but push to complete each round efficiently. Warm up thoroughly and cool down with mobility work post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10 Kettlebell Swings (medium weight), 7 Kettlebell Thrusters, 5 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20 Kettlebell Swings (medium weight), 15 Kettlebell Thrusters, 10 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Kettlebell Swings (medium weight), 15 Kettlebell Thrusters, 10 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Kettlebell Swings (medium weight), 15 Kettlebell Thrusters, 10 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20 kettlebell swings (medium weight), 15 kettlebell thrusters, 10 kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls.
Instructions_Clean: 20 kettlebell swings (medium weight), 15 kettlebell thrusters, 10 kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: EMOM Of Abs
Description: EMOM of Abs (Every Minute On the Minute, 18 minutes) is a high-intensity core workout where you perform a set of abdominal exercises at the start of each minute, then rest for the remainder of that minute. Rotate through different ab movements to target all sections of the core, maintaining steady pacing to maximize both strength and endurance.
Flavor_Text: EMOM Of Abs – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Choose a rep range that challenges you but allows completion within 40-45 seconds each round. Focus on quality reps and core control. Rotate exercises such as sit-ups, Russian twists, bicycle crunches, and planks. Adjust intensity by increasing reps or adding weight. Stay consistent, maintain good form, and use rest time to prepare for the next set.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Minute 1: 10 AbMat Sit-ups. Minute 1: 7 Second Plank Hold. Minute 1: 5 Toes-to-Bar (or Straight Leg Raises). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Minute 1: 20 AbMat Sit-ups. Minute 2: 15 Second Plank Hold. Minute 3: 10 Toes-to-Bar (or Straight Leg Raises). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Minute 1: 20 AbMat Sit-ups. Minute 2: 15 Second Plank Hold. Minute 3: 10 Toes-to-Bar (or Straight Leg Raises). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Minute 1: 20 AbMat Sit-ups. Minute 2: 15 Second Plank Hold. Minute 3: 10 Toes-to-Bar (or Straight Leg Raises). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: minute 1: 20 abmat sit-ups. minute 2: 15 second plank hold. minute 3: 10 toes-to-bar (or straight leg raises). for time
Instructions_Clean: minute 1: 20 abmat sit-ups. minute 2: 15 second plank hold. minute 3: 10 toes-to-bar (or straight leg raises). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Skill Builder
Description: The Skill Builder workout focuses on developing gymnastic proficiency and bodyweight control. During a 10-minute AMRAP (as many rounds as possible), athletes cycle through skill-based movements such as pull-ups, handstand holds, toes-to-bar, or dips. The emphasis is on quality reps, proper form, and gradually increasing volume or complexity based on the athlete's ability.
Flavor_Text: The Skill Builder – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize movement quality over speed. Scale movements to maintain strong positions and technique throughout. Encourage athletes to break up reps early to avoid excessive fatigue. Offer progressions or regressions to ensure every athlete is challenged appropriately. Remind athletes to warm up shoulders and wrists thoroughly before starting. The goal is skill development, not just maximum rounds—keep mechanics clean!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Wall Walks, 5 Strict Press (17/12 kgs), 7 V-Ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Wall Walks, 10 Strict Press (35/25 kgs), 15 V-Ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Wall Walks, 10 Strict Press (35/25 kgs), 15 V-Ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Wall Walks, 10 Strict Press (35/25 kgs), 15 V-Ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 wall walks, 10 strict press (35/25 kgs), 15 v-ups. for time
Instructions_Clean: 5 wall walks, 10 strict press (35/25 kgs), 15 v-ups. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
**  
The Skill Builder workout focuses on developing gymnastic proficiency and bodyweight control. During a 10-minute AMRAP (as many rounds as possible), athletes cycle through skill-based movements such as pull-ups, handstand holds, toes-to-bar, or dips. The emphasis is on quality reps, proper form, and gradually increasing volume or complexity based on the athlete's ability.

**

CoachNotes.from:

The Skill Builder workout focuses on developing gymnastic proficiency and bodyweight control. During a 10-minute AMRAP (as many rounds as possible), athletes cycle through skill-based movements such as pull-ups, handstand holds, toes-to-bar, or dips. The emphasis is on quality reps, proper form, and gradually increasing volume or complexity based on the athlete's ability.

**CoachNotes:**  
Prioritize movement quality over speed. Scale movements to maintain strong positions and technique throughout. Encourage athletes to break up reps early to avoid excessive fatigue. Offer progressions or regressions to ensure every athlete is challenged appropriately. Remind athletes to warm up shoulders and wrists thoroughly before starting. The goal is skill development, not just maximum rounds—keep mechanics clean!

Flavor_Text.from: The Skill Builder - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: The Skill Builder – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.

Name: Double Under Challenge
Description: The Double Under Challenge is a timed workout designed to test your jump rope skills, cardiovascular endurance, and coordination. Participants must complete a designated number of double unders—where the rope passes under your feet twice per jump—as quickly as possible. This challenge may also be paired with barbell or weightlifting elements to further increase intensity and improve full-body conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Double Under Challenge – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Focus on maintaining a consistent rhythm and wrist speed during double unders to reduce tripping and conserve energy.  
- Keep your core engaged and land softly on the balls of your feet to minimize impact on your joints.  
- If pairing with weightlifting, manage your breathing and transition smoothly between exercises.  
- Scale by performing single unders or reducing reps if necessary.  
- Warm up thoroughly, especially ankles, calves, shoulders, and wrists, to prevent injury.  
- Track your time to monitor progress and set goals for improvement.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Squat Cleans (22/15 kgs), 50 Double Unders. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Squat Cleans (45/30 kgs), 100 Double Unders. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Squat Cleans (45/30 kgs), 100 Double Unders. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Squat Cleans (45/30 kgs), 100 Double Unders. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 squat cleans (45/30 kgs), 100 double unders.
Instructions_Clean: 10 squat cleans (45/30 kgs), 100 double unders.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Partner Run
Description: Partner Run is a cardio-focused workout where two athletes complete a set distance or time running together. Partners can run side-by-side or alternate intervals, promoting motivation and teamwork throughout the session while improving aerobic capacity.
Flavor_Text: Partner Run – Long, steady output; aim for a rhythm you could explain, not survive.
CoachNotes:
**  
Emphasize consistent pacing and clear communication between partners. Encourage athletes to support each other, especially if one struggles with the pace. Remind them to maintain proper running form, focus on breathing, and warm up/cool down appropriately.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Accumulate 2K Run. Partner A runs, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A returns. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Accumulate 5K Run. Partner A runs, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A returns. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Accumulate 5K Run. Partner A runs, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A returns. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Accumulate 5K Run. Partner A runs, Partner B holds a Plank. Switch when Partner A returns. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: accumulate 5k run. partner a runs, partner b holds a plank. switch when partner a returns.
Instructions_Clean: accumulate 5k run. partner a runs, partner b holds a plank. switch when partner a returns.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Heavy Finisher
Description: A Heavy Finisher is a high-intensity barbell or weightlifting workout designed to be completed "For Time." Athletes perform a challenging series of heavy compound lifts in rapid succession at the end of a session, pushing strength, endurance, and mental toughness. The primary goal is to complete all prescribed reps as quickly and safely as possible.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Finisher – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on form and technique, especially under fatigue; prioritize safety over speed. Choose weights that are heavy but allow for good mechanics. Pace the early rounds and manage rest breaks to avoid burnout. Stay mentally engaged, and be prepared for a final test of strength and grit. Cool down and mobilize thoroughly post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Deadlifts (40% 1RM), 5 Handstand Push-ups (or Pike Push-ups). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Deadlifts (80% 1RM), 10 Handstand Push-ups (or Pike Push-ups). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Deadlifts (80% 1RM), 10 Handstand Push-ups (or Pike Push-ups). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Deadlifts (80% 1RM), 10 Handstand Push-ups (or Pike Push-ups). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 deadlifts (80% 1rm), 10 handstand push-ups (or pike push-ups).
Instructions_Clean: 5 deadlifts (80% 1rm), 10 handstand push-ups (or pike push-ups).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Rower/bike Ladder
Description: The Rower/Bike Ladder is a cardiovascular workout performed for time. Athletes complete ascending (or descending) intervals of calories or distance on a rower and/or assault bike, progressing through increasing (or decreasing) targets each round. This monostructural workout challenges aerobic endurance, stamina, and pacing ability.
Flavor_Text: Rower/bike Ladder – Simple on paper, brutal if you disrespect the distance.
CoachNotes:
**  
Maintain consistent pacing on both machines to avoid early fatigue. Focus on strong, smooth pulls (rower) and steady leg cadence (bike). Emphasize efficient transitions if switching equipment. Monitor heart rate and breathing; adjust effort to sustain output through every interval. Scale calories/distance as needed to match athlete’s fitness level.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg), with 5/4 Calorie Row or Bike after each set. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), with 10/8 Calorie Row or Bike after each set. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), with 10/8 Calorie Row or Bike after each set. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), with 10/8 Calorie Row or Bike after each set. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), with 10/8 calorie row or bike after each set.
Instructions_Clean: kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), with 10/8 calorie row or bike after each set.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: The Ghost
Description: The Ghost is a high-intensity interval workout inspired by fight sports. It consists of 6 rounds, each lasting 3 minutes, divided into three 1-minute stations: rowing (calories), burpees, and double-unders (or single-unders). Complete as many reps/calories as possible at each station. Rest 1 minute between rounds. Score is total reps/calories accumulated.
Flavor_Text: The Ghost – Focused skill work that turns good positions into great habits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early so you can maintain intensity across all rounds. Focus on powerful pulls during rowing. For burpees, find a sustainable rhythm—keep moving without burning out. Aim for unbroken sets on double-unders; if needed, switch to singles for consistency. Use the rest to control your breathing and prepare mentally for the next round. Track your reps each station to stay motivated and push for consistency or improvement every round.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Row (Calories), Burpees, Double Unders. 1m 0s rest between rounds. Score is total reps/calories. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Row (Calories), Burpees, Double Unders. 1m 0s rest between rounds. Score is total reps/calories. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Row (Calories), Burpees, Double Unders. 1m 0s rest between rounds. Score is total reps/calories. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Row (Calories), Burpees, Double Unders. 1m 0s rest between rounds. Score is total reps/calories. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: row (calories), burpees, double unders. 1m 0s rest between rounds. score is total reps/calories.
Instructions_Clean: row (calories), burpees, double unders. 1m 0s rest between rounds. score is total repetitions/calories.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Gymnastic Endurance
Description: A Gymnastic Endurance workout focuses on completing a high volume of bodyweight movements (such as pull-ups, push-ups, dips, or handstand holds) within a set time or as quickly as possible. The goal is to sustain technical form while performing repetitive gymnastic skills under moderate to high fatigue.
Flavor_Text: Gymnastic Endurance – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize movement quality over speed, especially as fatigue sets in. Encourage athletes to break reps into manageable sets to preserve technique and reduce injury risk. Remind them to maintain a strong core and stable body lines throughout all movements. Scale movements appropriately, considering each athlete's current skill and strength level. Emphasize steady pacing and consistent breathing.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Ring Dips, Toes-to-Bar, GHD Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Ring Dips, Toes-to-Bar, GHD Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Ring Dips, Toes-to-Bar, GHD Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Ring Dips, Toes-to-Bar, GHD Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: ring dips, toes-to-bar, ghd sit-ups. for time
Instructions_Clean: ring dips, toes-to-bar, ghd sit-ups. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Unilateral Thruster
Description: The Unilateral Thruster is a full-body exercise performed using a single dumbbell or kettlebell. Start standing with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the weight at shoulder level with one hand. Lower into a squat, keeping the chest upright, then explosively stand up while pressing the weight overhead. Alternate arms each round or as needed. Aim to complete as many reps as possible in 16 minutes (AMRAP 16).
Flavor_Text: Unilateral Thruster – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on maintaining a strong core and upright torso throughout the squat and press. Press the weight directly overhead, fully extending your arm. Switch hands as needed to ensure balanced strength development. Keep reps smooth and consistent—avoid rushing, but minimize rest. Engage your glutes and drive through your heels on each rep for optimal power and stability.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Single-Arm Dumbbell Thrusters (2 per arm, (12/7 kgs), 5 Box Step-overs, 5 Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Thrusters (5 per arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 Box Step-overs, 10 Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Thrusters (5 per arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 Box Step-overs, 10 Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Thrusters (5 per arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 Box Step-overs, 10 Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 single-arm dumbbell thrusters (5 per arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 box step-overs, 10 push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 10 single-arm dumbbell thrusters (5 per arm, (25/15 kgs), 10 box step-overs, 10 push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Engage your glutes and drive through your heels on each rep for optimal power and stability.
CoachNotes.to:
**  
Focus on maintaining a strong core and upright torso throughout the squat and press. Press the weight directly overhead, fully extending your arm. Switch hands as needed to ensure balanced strength development. Keep reps smooth and consistent—avoid rushing, but minimize rest. Engage your glutes and drive through your heels on each rep for optimal power and stability.

Flavor_Text.from: Unilateral Thruster - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: Unilateral Thruster – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.

Name: Barbell 100
Description: Barbell 100 is a weightlifting workout performed "for time." Complete 100 repetitions of a chosen barbell movement—commonly back squat, deadlift, or power clean—using a prescribed or scaled weight. The aim is to finish all reps as quickly as possible, maintaining good form throughout.
Flavor_Text: Barbell 100 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize solid technique over speed, especially as fatigue sets in. Break reps into manageable sets with short rest periods—avoid going to failure early. Maintain a steady pace and focus on breathing. Warm up thoroughly before starting, and choose a weight that allows you to complete at least 10 reps unbroken when fresh. If necessary, scale weight to preserve movement quality. Cool down and stretch after completion to aid recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Hang Power Cleans, 5 Front Squats (Repeat 2 times at (30/22 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Hang Power Cleans, 10 Front Squats (Repeat 5 times at (60/45 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Hang Power Cleans, 10 Front Squats (Repeat 5 times at (60/45 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Hang Power Cleans, 10 Front Squats (Repeat 5 times at (60/45 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 hang power cleans, 10 front squats (repeat 5 times at (60/45 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 10 hang power cleans, 10 front squats (repeat 5 times at (60/45 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Centurion
Description: The Centurion is a challenging, bodyweight-only workout designed for travel or limited equipment environments. Complete 100 reps each of squats, push-ups, sit-ups, and lunges (50 per leg) as fast as possible. Focus on high intensity, minimizing rest, and maintaining good form. This full-body routine builds muscular endurance and cardiovascular fitness, making it ideal for all fitness levels. Time yourself and aim to improve!
Flavor_Text: The Centurion – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Burpees, 5 Walking Lunges (per leg), 5 Air Squats, 5 Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Burpees, 10 Walking Lunges (per leg), 10 Air Squats, 10 Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Burpees, 10 Walking Lunges (per leg), 10 Air Squats, 10 Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Burpees, 10 Walking Lunges (per leg), 10 Air Squats, 10 Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 burpees, 10 walking lunges (per leg), 10 air squats, 10 sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 10 burpees, 10 walking lunges (per leg), 10 air squats, 10 sit-ups.
TrainingGoals: Mental Toughness, Final Test of Will
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Annie
Description:
**Annie** (Benchmark Girl WOD, For Time)  
**Description:**  
Annie is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout designed to test and improve your speed, coordination, and endurance. The workout alternates between double-unders (jump rope) and abmat sit-ups in a descending rep scheme: 50-40-30-20-10 reps of each movement. The clock runs continuously until all repetitions are complete. This simple but challenging workout highlights core strength and cardiovascular fitness.
Flavor_Text: Annie – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: Break early into small sets; breathe rhythmically; avoid deep fatigue spikes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Complete 25-20-15-10-5 reps of Double Unders and Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Complete 50-40-30-20-10 reps of Double Unders and Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Complete 50-40-30-20-10 reps of Double Unders and Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Complete 50-40-30-20-10 reps of Double Unders and Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

TargetStimulus: High-intensity sprint with pulling and barbell cycling.
Instructions: complete 50-40-30-20-10 reps of double unders and sit-ups. for time
Instructions_Clean: complete 50-40-30-20-10 repetitions of double unders and sit-ups. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Diane
Description: Diane is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout (often called a “Girl” WOD) performed for time. The workout consists of 21-15-9 reps of deadlifts and handstand push-ups (HSPU). This means you complete 21 deadlifts, 21 HSPUs, then 15 of each, then 9 of each, as quickly as possible. Typically, men use 225 lbs (102 kg) and women use 155 lbs (70 kg) for deadlifts. Diane tests strength, gymnastic skill, and metabolic conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Diane – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: Break early into small sets; breathe rhythmically; avoid deep fatigue spikes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Deadlifts (50/35 kgs) and Handstand Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Deadlifts (100/70 kgs) and Handstand Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Deadlifts (100/70 kgs) and Handstand Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Deadlifts (100/70 kgs) and Handstand Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

TargetStimulus: High-intensity sprint with pulling and barbell cycling.
Instructions: deadlifts (100/70 kgs) and handstand push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: deadlifts (100/70 kgs) and handstand push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Elizabeth
Description: Elizabeth is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout (girl WOD) performed for time. The workout consists of 21-15-9 repetitions of cleans and ring dips completed as quickly as possible. This test measures strength, power, and gymnastic skill. Standard prescribed weights are 135 lbs (61 kg) for men and 95 lbs (43 kg) for women on the clean, typically performed as squat cleans unless otherwise specified.
Flavor_Text: Elizabeth – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: Break early into small sets; breathe rhythmically; avoid deep fatigue spikes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Cleans (30/22 kgs) and Ring Dips. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Cleans (60/45 kgs) and Ring Dips. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Cleans (60/45 kgs) and Ring Dips. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Cleans (60/45 kgs) and Ring Dips. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

TargetStimulus: High-intensity sprint with pulling and barbell cycling.
Instructions: cleans (60/45 kgs) and ring dips.
Instructions_Clean: cleans (60/45 kgs) and ring dips.
TrainingGoals: Power, Explosive Strength, Upper Body Endurance
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Filthy 50
Description: The Filthy 50 is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout ("Girl WOD"), performed for time. It challenges full-body fitness and stamina with 10 exercises, each completed for 50 reps before moving to the next. The sequence includes: box jumps (24"), jumping pull-ups, kettlebell swings (35 lbs), walking lunges, knees-to-elbows, push presses (45 lbs), back extensions, wall balls (20 lbs), burpees, and double-unders. The Filthy 50 tests endurance, coordination, and mental toughness, making it a popular choice for athletes seeking a comprehensive, high-intensity workout.
Flavor_Text: Filthy 50 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: Break early into small sets; breathe rhythmically; avoid deep fatigue spikes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 Box Jumps (12/10 in), 25 Jumping Pull-ups, 25 Kettlebell Swings (7/5 kgs), 25 Walking Lunges (per leg), 25 Knees-to-Elbows, 25 Push Presses (10/7 kgs), 25 Back Extensions, 25 Wall Balls (5/2 kgs), 25 Burpees, 25 Double Unders. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 50 Jumping Pull-ups, 50 Kettlebell Swings (15/10 kgs), 50 Walking Lunges (per leg), 50 Knees-to-Elbows, 50 Push Presses (20/15 kgs), 50 Back Extensions, 50 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 50 Burpees, 50 Double Unders. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 50 Jumping Pull-ups, 50 Kettlebell Swings (15/10 kgs), 50 Walking Lunges (per leg), 50 Knees-to-Elbows, 50 Push Presses (20/15 kgs), 50 Back Extensions, 50 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 50 Burpees, 50 Double Unders. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 50 Jumping Pull-ups, 50 Kettlebell Swings (15/10 kgs), 50 Walking Lunges (per leg), 50 Knees-to-Elbows, 50 Push Presses (20/15 kgs), 50 Back Extensions, 50 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 50 Burpees, 50 Double Unders. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

TargetStimulus: High-intensity sprint with pulling and barbell cycling.
Instructions: 50 box jumps (24/20 in), 50 jumping pull-ups, 50 kettlebell swings (15/10 kgs), 50 walking lunges (per leg), 50 knees-to-elbows, 50 push presses (20/15 kgs), 50 back extensions, 50 wall balls (10/5 kgs), 50 burpees, 50 double unders.
Instructions_Clean: 50 box jumps (24/20 in), 50 jumping pull-ups, 50 kettlebell swings (15/10 kgs), 50 walking lunges (per leg), 50 knees-to-elbows, 50 push presses (20/15 kgs), 50 back extensions, 50 wall balls (10/5 kgs), 50 burpees, 50 double unders.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Severin
Description: Severin is a Hero WOD performed for time, honoring U.S. Army Sergeant First Class Severin W. Roman. The workout consists of a 1.6 km (1 mile) run, followed by 100 pull-ups, 200 push-ups, 300 air squats, and finishes with another 1.6 km (1 mile) run. The workout is typically performed with a weighted vest (20/14 lbs). Partition the pull-ups, push-ups, and air squats as needed.
Flavor_Text: Severin – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Severin is a challenging test of endurance and mental grit. Pace your initial run to conserve energy for the high-volume bodyweight movements. Break reps into manageable sets with short rests to avoid muscle fatigue. Maintain good form, especially as fatigue sets in. Wearing a vest increases difficulty—scale as needed based on experience. Hydrate and be consistent with pacing for the final run. Prioritize steady effort and honor the intent of the Hero WOD.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Rounds of: 25 Air Squats, 20 Sit-ups, 15 Double Unders, 10 Pull-ups, 5 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (12/7 kgs), 2 per arm). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Rounds of: 50 Air Squats, 40 Sit-ups, 30 Double Unders, 20 Pull-ups, 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 5 per arm). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Rounds of: 50 Air Squats, 40 Sit-ups, 30 Double Unders, 20 Pull-ups, 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 5 per arm). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Rounds of: 50 Air Squats, 40 Sit-ups, 30 Double Unders, 20 Pull-ups, 10 Single-Arm Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 5 per arm). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 rounds of: 50 air squats, 40 sit-ups, 30 double unders, 20 pull-ups, 10 single-arm dumbbell snatches (25/15 kgs), 5 per arm).
Instructions_Clean: 5 rounds of: 50 air squats, 40 sit-ups, 30 double unders, 20 pull-ups, 10 single-arm dumbbell snatches (25/15 kgs), 5 per arm).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Chad
Description: Chad is a Hero WOD (Workout of the Day) honoring Chad Wilkinson. The workout is simple but mentally demanding: 1,000 box step-ups (20-inch box) for time, performed with a rucksack (45/35 lb recommended). The challenge tests endurance, grit, and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Chad – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself from the start—break into manageable sets with short, planned rest. Focus on upright posture, stable box placement, and full hip extension at the top of each rep. Wear supportive footwear, and use a weight that's challenging but allows for proper form throughout. Stay hydrated, and be prepared for a high-rep, endurance-driven grind. This is more about determination than speed.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 500 Box Step-ups (10 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1000 Box Step-ups (20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1000 Box Step-ups (20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1000 Box Step-ups (20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1000 box step-ups (20 in). for time
Instructions_Clean: 1000 box step-ups (20 in). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Danny
Description: "Danny" is a CrossFit Hero WOD honoring NYC firefighter Danny P. This workout includes as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) in 20 minutes of: 30 box jumps (24/20 in), 20 push presses (115/75 lbs), and 30 pull-ups. This high-volume WOD tests stamina, strength, and mental fortitude.
Flavor_Text: Danny – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: Pace yourself early; break reps into manageable sets to avoid burnout. Focus on explosive hip drive for box jumps, maintain strong core and overhead stability for push presses, and use efficient kipping or butterfly technique for pull-ups. Prioritize consistent, quality movement and smart rest intervals.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 30 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 20 Push Presses (50/35 kgs), 30 GHD Sit-ups, 20 Pull-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 30 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 20 Push Presses (50/35 kgs), 30 GHD Sit-ups, 20 Pull-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 30 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 20 Push Presses (50/35 kgs), 30 GHD Sit-ups, 20 Pull-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

EquipmentNeeded: Box, Barbell, GHD Machine, Pull-up Bar
Instructions: 30 box jumps (24/20 in), 20 push presses (50/35 kgs), 30 ghd sit-ups, 20 pull-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 30 box jumps (24/20 in), 20 push presses (50/35 kgs), 30 ghd sit-ups, 20 pull-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).

Description.from:
Description:  
"Danny" is a CrossFit Hero WOD honoring NYC firefighter Danny P. This workout includes as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) in 20 minutes of: 30 box jumps (24/20 in), 20 push presses (115/75 lbs), and 30 pull-ups. This high-volume WOD tests stamina, strength, and mental fortitude.

CoachNotes:  
Pace yourself early; break reps into manageable sets to avoid burnout. Focus on explosive hip drive for box jumps, maintain strong core and overhead stability for push presses, and use efficient kipping or butterfly technique for pull-ups. Prioritize consistent, quality movement and smart rest intervals.

Name: Randy
Description: Randy is a CrossFit Hero WOD performed for time, consisting of 75 power snatches at 75 lbs (34 kg) for men and 55 lbs (25 kg) for women. The workout is designed to honor Randy Simmons, a fallen LAPD SWAT officer. It’s a fast-paced, full-body challenge emphasizing explosive movement and stamina.
Flavor_Text: Randy – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Maintain consistent sets and focus on efficient barbell cycling to minimize rest. Use a hook grip, keep the bar close, and prioritize proper form to avoid early fatigue. Scale the weight as needed to ensure steady movement throughout. Warm up thoroughly, and manage your breathing for sustained effort. Aim to complete the workout in under 10 minutes with unbroken or strategically planned small sets.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 37 Power Snatches (17/12 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 75 Power Snatches (35/25 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 75 Power Snatches (35/25 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 75 Power Snatches (35/25 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 75 power snatches (35/25 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 75 power snatches (35/25 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Abbate
Description: "Abbate" is a Hero WOD done for time. The workout consists of a 1-mile run, followed by 21 clean & jerks (155/105 lb), then another 1-mile run, and finishing with 21 more clean & jerks (155/105 lb). It's designed to honor U.S. Marine Sergeant Mathew T. Abbate and is a challenging mix of endurance and strength.
Flavor_Text: Abbate – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself through the runs; save energy for the barbell work. Use a weight you can cycle clean & jerks in small, manageable sets with good form throughout. Focus on powerful hips for each lift. Plan transitions wisely to minimize rest. Scale distance and load as needed to maintain intensity and safety.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Run 1 Mile, 10 Clean and Jerks (35/25 kgs), Run 400m, 10 Clean and Jerks (35/25 kgs), Run 200m, 10 Clean and Jerks (35/25 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Run 1 Mile, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs), Run 800m, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs), Run 400m, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Run 1 Mile, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs), Run 800m, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs), Run 400m, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Run 1 Mile, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs), Run 800m, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs), Run 400m, 21 Clean and Jerks (70/50 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: run 1 mile, 21 clean and jerks (70/50 kgs), run 800m, 21 clean and jerks (70/50 kgs), run 400m, 21 clean and jerks (70/50 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: run 1 mile, 21 clean and jerks (70/50 kgs), run 800m, 21 clean and jerks (70/50 kgs), run 400m, 21 clean and jerks (70/50 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Wittman
Description: Wittman is a Hero WOD performed for time, honoring U.S. Army Sergeant Jeremiah Wittman. The workout consists of 7 rounds of: 15 kettlebell swings (53/35 lb), 15 power cleans (95/65 lb), and 15 box jumps (24/20 in). The combination of moderate load, high reps, and multiple rounds demands stamina, functional strength, and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Wittman – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Manage your pace early; unbroken sets in the first rounds may lead to fatigue later. Use hip drive for kettlebell swings and focus on powerful, efficient cleans. Scale loads and box height as needed to maintain safe form. Prioritize consistent movement over speed, especially on box jumps, to reduce tripping risk. Stay disciplined with transitions to minimize rest without compromising safety.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg), 7 Power Cleans (22/15 kgs), 7 Box Jumps (12/10 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 15 Power Cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 15 Power Cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 15 Power Cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), 15 power cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 box jumps (24/20 in).
Instructions_Clean: 15 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), 15 power cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 box jumps (24/20 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Holleyman
Description: Holleyman is a Hero CrossFit WOD performed for time, consisting of 30 rounds, each round including 5 wall balls (20/14 lbs), 3 handstand push-ups, and 1 power clean (225/155 lbs). This high-volume workout honors U.S. Army Staff Sgt. Aaron N. Holleyman, demanding strength, stamina, and perseverance through sustained, varied movements.
Flavor_Text: Holleyman – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself from the start—30 rounds is a marathon, not a sprint. Break wall balls and handstand push-ups into manageable sets to avoid burnout. Use singles for heavy power cleans to preserve form and safety. Focus on smooth, consistent transitions rather than speed early on. Scale movements and loads to maintain quality reps throughout. Stay mentally tough and remember the Hero WOD purpose!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Wall Balls (5/2 kgs), 1 Handstand Push-ups, 1 Power Clean (50/35 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 3 Handstand Push-ups, 1 Power Clean (100/70 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 3 Handstand Push-ups, 1 Power Clean (100/70 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 3 Handstand Push-ups, 1 Power Clean (100/70 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 wall balls (10/5 kgs), 3 handstand push-ups, 1 power clean (100/70 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 5 wall balls (10/5 kgs), 3 handstand push-ups, 1 power clean (100/70 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: J.T.
Description:
**"J.T." Hero WOD (For Time)**  
"J.T." is a classic CrossFit Hero workout honoring Petty Officer 1st Class Jeff Taylor, SEAL, who died in Afghanistan in 2005. This challenging bodyweight benchmark demands strict upper body and triceps strength through three gymnastic movements. The workout consists of 21-15-9 reps, for time, of Handstand Push-Ups, Ring Dips, and Push-Ups, performed in that order. "J.T." tests muscular endurance, shoulder stability, and pushing capacity, delivering a tough tribute and a quick but potent upper body blast. Scale movements as needed to maintain proper form and intensity.
Flavor_Text: J.T. – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: Elite gymnastics hero workout honoring J.T. - focus on strict technique and break strategically
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10-7-4 Reps of: Handstand Push-ups, Ring Dips, Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 21-15-9 Reps of: Handstand Push-ups, Ring Dips, Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 21-15-9 Reps of: Handstand Push-ups, Ring Dips, Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 21-15-9 Reps of: Handstand Push-ups, Ring Dips, Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 21-15-9 reps of: handstand push-ups, ring dips, push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 21-15-9 repetitions of: handstand push-ups, ring dips, push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Luce
Description: Luce is a Hero CrossFit WOD performed for time: 3 rounds of a 1,000 meter run, 10 muscle-ups, and 100 squats. The workout honors Captain Ronald G. Luce, and is typically performed wearing a weighted vest (20/14 lbs).
Flavor_Text: Luce – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: Pace your runs to conserve energy for muscle-ups and squats. Break muscle-ups into small sets to maintain form—use transitions or ring progressions if needed. Focus on full range-of-motion for all squats. If needed, scale muscle-ups to pull-up/dip combinations. Hydrate and listen to your body; this is a lengthy WOD demanding both strength and cardiovascular endurance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Kettlebell Turkish Get-up (10/5 kgs), 2 per arm), 5 Squat Cleans (30/22 kgs), 7 Two-Pood Kettlebell Swings (1pood/1.2pood). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1 Kettlebell Turkish Get-up (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 10 Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs), 15 Two-Pood Kettlebell Swings (2pood/1.5pood). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1 Kettlebell Turkish Get-up (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 10 Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs), 15 Two-Pood Kettlebell Swings (2pood/1.5pood). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1 Kettlebell Turkish Get-up (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 10 Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs), 15 Two-Pood Kettlebell Swings (2pood/1.5pood). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1 kettlebell turkish get-up (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 10 squat cleans (60/45 kgs), 15 two-pood kettlebell swings (2pood/1.5pood).
Instructions_Clean: 1 kettlebell turkish get-up (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 10 squat cleans (60/45 kgs), 15 two-pood kettlebell swings (2pood/1.5pood).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.
