Name: The Lyon
Description: The Lyon is a Hero WOD composed of 7 rounds, each round including 7 Squat Cleans (165/115 lb), 7 Shoulder-to-Overheads, and 7 Burpee Chest-to-Bar Pull-Ups. Each round is separated by a 2-minute rest. This challenging, high-intensity workout honors Capt. David Lyon and tests full-body strength, stamina, and mental grit.
Flavor_Text: The Lyon – Strength first, ego second; smooth bar paths beat ugly PR attempts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize controlled technique on the squat cleans and shoulder-to-overhead reps—break sets if needed to maintain form. Pace the burpee chest-to-bar pull-ups for consistent performance across all rounds. Use the 2-minute rest intervals for effective recovery, managing heart rate and breathing. Adjust weights as needed for good movement quality and safety.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Deadlifts (50/35 kgs), 5 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or regular), 5 Toes-to-Bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Deadlifts (100/70 kgs), 10 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or regular), 10 Toes-to-Bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Deadlifts (100/70 kgs), 10 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or regular), 10 Toes-to-Bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Deadlifts (100/70 kgs), 10 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or regular), 10 Toes-to-Bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 deadlifts (100/70 kgs), 10 strict handstand push-ups (or regular), 10 toes-to-bar.
Instructions_Clean: 10 deadlifts (100/70 kgs), 10 strict handstand push-ups (or regular), 10 toes-to-bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Description.from:
**  
The Lyon is a Hero WOD composed of 7 rounds, each round including 7 Squat Cleans (165/115 lb), 7 Shoulder-to-Overheads, and 7 Burpee Chest-to-Bar Pull-Ups. Each round is separated by a 2-minute rest. This challenging, high-intensity workout honors Capt. David Lyon and tests full-body strength, stamina, and mental grit.

**CoachNotes:**  
Prioritize controlled technique on the squat cleans and shoulder-to-overhead reps—break sets if needed to maintain form. Pace the burpee chest-to-bar pull-ups for consistent performance across all rounds. Use the 2-minute rest intervals for effective recovery, managing heart rate and breathing. Adjust weights as needed for good movement quality and safety.

Flavor_Text.to: The Lyon – Strength first, ego second; smooth bar paths beat ugly PR attempts.

Name: T.J.
Description: The T.J. Hero WOD is a demanding, chipper-style CrossFit workout performed for time, honoring SSgt Timothy P. Johnson. This WOD involves a high volume of barbell, gymnastic, and bodyweight movements with a focus on endurance, strength, and resilience under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: T.J. – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself from the start—break reps before you hit failure, especially on push-ups and pull-ups. Manage grip fatigue by setting specific rep schemes. Use steady, controlled form, particularly during barbell movements. Prioritize quality reps over speed and scale as needed; this workout is a marathon, not a sprint. Honor the hero—push hard, but listen to your body.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Deadlifts (42/30 kgs), 5 Box Jumps (12/10 in), 5 Barbell Lunges (42/30 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 10 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 10 Barbell Lunges (85/60 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 10 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 10 Barbell Lunges (85/60 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 10 Box Jumps (24/20 in), 10 Barbell Lunges (85/60 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 10 box jumps (24/20 in), 10 barbell lunges (85/60 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 10 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 10 box jumps (24/20 in), 10 barbell lunges (85/60 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Bull
Description: Bull is a grueling Hero WOD performed for time. Athletes complete 2 rounds of: 200 double-unders, 50 overhead barbell squats (135/95 lbs), 50 pull-ups, and a 1-mile run per round. This high-volume workout honors U.S. Army Captain Brandon "Bull" Barrett.
Flavor_Text: Bull – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself—consistency is key. Scale double-unders or use a lighter bar for overhead squats if needed. Break large sets early and maintain steady effort on the run. Prioritize good form for overhead squats and protect shoulders. Hydrate and mentally prepare for a long, challenging grind.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 100 Double Unders, 25 Overhead Squats (30/22 kgs), 25 Pull-ups, 1 Mile Run. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 200 Double Unders, 50 Overhead Squats (60/45 kgs), 50 Pull-ups, 1 Mile Run. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 200 Double Unders, 50 Overhead Squats (60/45 kgs), 50 Pull-ups, 1 Mile Run. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 200 Double Unders, 50 Overhead Squats (60/45 kgs), 50 Pull-ups, 1 Mile Run. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 200 double unders, 50 overhead squats (60/45 kgs), 50 pull-ups, 1 mile run.
Instructions_Clean: 200 double unders, 50 overhead squats (60/45 kgs), 50 pull-ups, 1 mile run.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Capoot
Description:
Capoot is a Hero WOD honoring Officer James Capoot, consisting of a challenging chipper performed for time:  
- 100 push-ups  
- 800m run  
- 75 push-ups  
- 1200m run  
- 50 push-ups  
- 1600m run  
- 25 push-ups  
This bodyweight and running workout tests muscular endurance, aerobic capacity, and mental grit.
Flavor_Text: Capoot – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace your push-ups strategically—avoid redlining early. Break reps into manageable sets with short rests. Use runs to flush out upper body fatigue, but maintain a consistent, steady effort. Focus on efficient running mechanics and proper push-up form throughout. This WOD is a true mental battle, so embrace the grind and dig deep, honoring the sacrifice of Officer Capoot. Suitable for scaling as needed.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Box Jump Overs (12/10 in), 25 Dumbbell Push Press (10/7 kgs), 50 Jump Rope Double Unders (100 Singles). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Box Jump Overs (24/20 in), 50 Dumbbell Push Press (20/15 kgs), 100 Jump Rope Double Unders (200 Singles). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Box Jump Overs (24/20 in), 50 Dumbbell Push Press (20/15 kgs), 100 Jump Rope Double Unders (200 Singles). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Box Jump Overs (24/20 in), 50 Dumbbell Push Press (20/15 kgs), 100 Jump Rope Double Unders (200 Singles). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 box jump overs (24/20 in), 50 dumbbell push press (20/15 kgs), 100 jump rope double unders (200 singles).
Instructions_Clean: 100 box jump overs (24/20 in), 50 dumbbell push press (20/15 kgs), 100 jump rope double unders (200 singles).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Dillon
Description: Dillon is a Hero WOD (Workout of the Day) performed for time, honoring a fallen hero. It typically includes a mix of high-intensity functional movements such as running, bodyweight exercises, weightlifting, and cardio elements, designed to challenge mental and physical endurance.
Flavor_Text: Dillon – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize form and steady pacing—this is a grueling chipper-style workout. Break reps into manageable sets, especially on high-volume sections. Focus on consistent breathing and efficient transitions between movements. Remember, Hero WODs are about honoring someone’s sacrifice; give your best effort while scaling weights and reps as needed to maintain intensity and safety.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Strict Pull-ups, 2 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or Pike), 4 Toes-to-Bar, 4 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 4 Strict Pull-ups, 4 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or Pike), 8 Toes-to-Bar, 8 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 4 Strict Pull-ups, 4 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or Pike), 8 Toes-to-Bar, 8 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 4 Strict Pull-ups, 4 Strict Handstand Push-ups (or Pike), 8 Toes-to-Bar, 8 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 4 strict pull-ups, 4 strict handstand push-ups (or pike), 8 toes-to-bar, 8 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
Instructions_Clean: 4 strict pull-ups, 4 strict handstand push-ups (or pike), 8 toes-to-bar, 8 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Jack
Description: "Jack" is a classic CrossFit Hero WOD. It is a 20-minute AMRAP (as many rounds as possible) workout consisting of 10 Push Presses (95/65 lbs), 10 Kettlebell Swings (53/35 lbs), and 10 Box Jumps (24/20 inches). The workout is named in honor of U.S. Army Staff Sergeant Jack M. Martin III.
Flavor_Text: Jack – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Maintain a strong, stable core on push presses to protect your lower back. For kettlebell swings, use hip drive—not just arm strength—while keeping your shoulders relaxed. Land softly on box jumps and fully extend your hips at the top. Pace yourself early; this is a long, sustained effort. Focus on smooth, controlled transitions and breathing to maximize rounds. Scale weights and heights if needed to ensure continuous movement.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Push Presses (25/17 kgs), 5 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg), 5 Box Jumps (12/10 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Push Presses (50/35 kgs), 10 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 10 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Push Presses (50/35 kgs), 10 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 10 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Push Presses (50/35 kgs), 10 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), 10 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 push presses (50/35 kgs), 10 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), 10 box jumps (24/20 in).
Instructions_Clean: 10 push presses (50/35 kgs), 10 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), 10 box jumps (24/20 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Mccoy
Description: McCoy is a Hero WOD (Workout of the Day) that challenges mental grit and full-body endurance. Athletes complete the prescribed sequence for time, honoring fallen service member Staff Sgt. Michael McCoy. This workout typically includes a blend of running, pull-ups, power cleans, and kettlebell swings.
Flavor_Text: Mccoy – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself from the start—this is a grind, not a sprint. Break up reps early to avoid burnout. Focus on consistent form, especially on cleans and swings. Scale pull-ups and weights as needed to maintain safe, steady movement. Remember the purpose: honor and dig deep.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 400m Run, 15 Push-ups, 15 Overhead Squats (22/15 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 800m Run, 30 Push-ups, 30 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 800m Run, 30 Push-ups, 30 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 800m Run, 30 Push-ups, 30 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 800m run, 30 push-ups, 30 overhead squats (45/30 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 800m run, 30 push-ups, 30 overhead squats (45/30 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Raskin
Description: Raskin is a Hero WOD performed for time, honoring fallen hero U.S. Army Sgt. Zachary Raskin. This demanding workout typically involves several rounds of functional movements, such as bodyweight exercises and weightlifting, performed at high intensity. The challenge emphasizes stamina, functional strength, and mental resilience.
Flavor_Text: Raskin – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: Pace yourself early—consistent movement is key. Break reps into manageable sets to avoid burnout. Stay hydrated, prioritize steady breathing, and remember the spirit of the Hero WOD: give your best effort in honor of sacrifice.

The challenge emphasizes stamina, functional strength, and mental resilience.

CoachNotes:  
Pace yourself early—consistent movement is key. Break reps into manageable sets to avoid burnout. Focus on form, especially under fatigue, and scale movements or loads as needed for your ability level. Stay hydrated, prioritize steady breathing, and remember the spirit of the Hero WOD: give your best effort in honor of sacrifice.
Description.to: Raskin is a Hero WOD performed for time, honoring fallen hero U.S. Army Sgt. Zachary Raskin. This demanding workout typically involves several rounds of functional movements, such as bodyweight exercises and weightlifting, performed at high intensity. The challenge emphasizes stamina, functional strength, and mental resilience.

Name: Handstand Skill AMRAP
Description: Handstand Skill AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible in 10 minutes): Cycle through handstand-focused movements—such as wall holds, shoulder taps, kick-ups, or freestanding attempts—at your current skill level. Rest briefly as needed while accumulating the highest possible quality practice volume within 10 minutes.
Flavor_Text: Handstand Skill AMRAP – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize form and control over speed to reinforce proper mechanics. Maintain active shoulders and engage your core throughout all movements. Adjust drills to your capacity—use wall support if needed, or progress to freestanding holds/taps as you advance. Focus on consistent breathing and come down before excessive fatigue to prevent poor reps or injury.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 ft Handstand Walk (or 1 Wall Walks), 5 Pistol Squats (alternating), 7 Box Jumps (12/10 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 ft Handstand Walk (or 2 Wall Walks), 10 Pistol Squats (alternating), 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 ft Handstand Walk (or 2 Wall Walks), 10 Pistol Squats (alternating), 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 ft Handstand Walk (or 2 Wall Walks), 10 Pistol Squats (alternating), 15 Box Jumps (24/20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 ft handstand walk (or 2 wall walks), 10 pistol squats (alternating), 15 box jumps (24/20 in).
Instructions_Clean: 50 ft handstand walk (or 2 wall walks), 10 pistol squats (alternating), 15 box jumps (24/20 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Tabata Thrusters
Description: Tabata Thrusters is a high-intensity interval workout combining a front squat with an overhead press. In an 8-round Tabata (20 seconds on, 10 seconds rest, 4 minutes total), perform as many thrusters as possible each work period. This exercise builds full-body strength and power while boosting cardiovascular endurance. Use dumbbells, a barbell, or just bodyweight based on your fitness level. Focus on maintaining proper form and pace for maximum effectiveness.
Flavor_Text: Tabata Thrusters – Strength first, ego second; smooth bar paths beat ugly PR attempts.
CoachNotes: For Tabata Thrusters: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 4 Rounds of: 10 seconds work, 5 seconds rest. Max reps of Thrusters (17/12 kgs). Score is total reps. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 8 Rounds of: 20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest. Max reps of Thrusters (35/25 kgs). Score is total reps. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 8 Rounds of: 20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest. Max reps of Thrusters (35/25 kgs). Score is total reps. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 8 Rounds of: 20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest. Max reps of Thrusters (35/25 kgs). Score is total reps. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 8 rounds of: 20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest. max reps of thrusters (35/25 kgs). score is total reps.
Instructions_Clean: 8 rounds of: 20 seconds work, 10 seconds rest. max repetitions of thrusters (35/25 kgs). score is total repetitions.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Ring Muscle-up Focus
Description: A skill-focused EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) session targeting the ring muscle-up, designed to build technique, strength, and body control. Each minute, perform a set number of ring muscle-ups (or progressions), emphasizing quality reps. Rest for the remainder of the minute, repeating for 15 minutes. Suitable for athletes aiming to improve ring muscle-up proficiency and gymnastic capacity.
Flavor_Text: Ring Muscle-up Focus – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes: For Ring Muscle-up Focus: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: 1-1 Ring Muscle-Ups. Even: 5/4 Calorie Row (for penalty if MUs failed). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: 1-3 Ring Muscle-Ups. Even: 10/8 Calorie Row (for penalty if MUs failed). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: 1-3 Ring Muscle-Ups. Even: 10/8 Calorie Row (for penalty if MUs failed). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: 1-3 Ring Muscle-Ups. Even: 10/8 Calorie Row (for penalty if MUs failed). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: 1-3 ring muscle-ups. even: 10/8 calorie row (for penalty if mus failed).
Instructions_Clean: odd: 1-3 ring muscle-ups. even: 10/8 calorie row (for penalty if mus failed).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Bike Sprint EMOM
Description: This workout is structured as a 20-minute EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) bike sprint session. At the start of each minute, perform a high-intensity sprint on the bike for a set duration (e.g., 15–20 seconds), then use the remaining time in the minute to recover at an easy pace. This format promotes interval training, boosts aerobic and anaerobic capacity, and encourages consistent pacing for sustained effort throughout the session.
Flavor_Text: Bike Sprint EMOM – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes: For Bike Sprint EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: Max Distance Bike in 15 seconds. Even: 5 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: Max Distance Bike in 30 seconds. Even: 10 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: Max Distance Bike in 30 seconds. Even: 10 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: Max Distance Bike in 30 seconds. Even: 10 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: max distance bike in 30 seconds. even: 10 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: odd: max distance bike in 30 seconds. even: 10 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Overhead Lunge & Snatch
Description: The Overhead Lunge & Snatch (using a dumbbell or kettlebell) is a full-body workout performed for time. Start by performing a single-arm snatch, lifting the weight explosively from the floor to an overhead position. Once overhead, stabilize and step forward into a lunge, lowering your back knee toward the floor while keeping your arm fully extended. Return to standing, lower the weight safely, and repeat, alternating arms as prescribed. This exercise builds power, shoulder stability, core strength, and lower body endurance.
Flavor_Text: Overhead Lunge & Snatch – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Overhead Lunge & Snatch: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10 Dual Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (10/5 kgs), 5 Dumbbell Power Snatches (2 per arm). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20 Dual Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (20/10 kgs), 10 Dumbbell Power Snatches (5 per arm). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Dual Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (20/10 kgs), 10 Dumbbell Power Snatches (5 per arm). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Dual Dumbbell Overhead Lunges (20/10 kgs), 10 Dumbbell Power Snatches (5 per arm). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20 dual dumbbell overhead lunges (20/10 kgs), 10 dumbbell power snatches (5 per arm).
Instructions_Clean: 20 dual dumbbell overhead lunges (20/10 kgs), 10 dumbbell power snatches (5 per arm).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: 5-minute Burner
Description: 5-Minute Burner is a high-intensity, AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) interval workout. In just 5 minutes, push yourself to complete as many rounds of a specific circuit as you can. This format boosts cardiovascular endurance, burns calories, and builds strength in a short time, making it ideal for quick, effective sessions. Suitable for all fitness levels—just adjust the intensity or modify movements as needed. Perfect for busy days or as a finisher to any workout!
Flavor_Text: 5-minute Burner – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes: For 5-minute Burner: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Hang Power Cleans (30/22 kgs), 5 Toes-to-Bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Hang Power Cleans (60/45 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Hang Power Cleans (60/45 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Hang Power Cleans (60/45 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 hang power cleans (60/45 kgs), 10 toes-to-bar.
Instructions_Clean: 5 hang power cleans (60/45 kgs), 10 toes-to-bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Heavy Back Squat EMOM
Description: Heavy Back Squat EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) is a strength-focused barbell workout. For 12 minutes, you’ll perform a set number (commonly 1–3 reps) of heavy back squats at the start of each minute, then rest for the remainder of the minute. This method trains strength, power, and work capacity, while reinforcing squat technique under fatigue. Adjust the weight so it’s challenging but maintain proper form throughout all sets.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Back Squat EMOM – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Back Squat EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Back Squats (35% 1RM). Focus on excellent form and speed. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 3 Back Squats (70% 1RM). Focus on excellent form and speed. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 3 Back Squats (70% 1RM). Focus on excellent form and speed. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 3 Back Squats (70% 1RM). Focus on excellent form and speed. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 3 back squats (70% 1rm). focus on excellent form and speed.
Instructions_Clean: 3 back squats (70% 1rm). focus on excellent form and speed.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Row/burpee Ladder
Description: This workout is structured as a ladder where you alternate between rowing and burpees, increasing the rep count (or calories/distance) each round. It is a fast-paced, monostructural and cardio-intensive session designed to improve full-body endurance, explosive power, and cardiovascular capacity. Complete all assigned reps or distances on the rower, then perform the burpees, progressing up the ladder as quickly as possible until the workout is finished. Record your total time for an added challenge.
Flavor_Text: Row/burpee Ladder – Simple on paper, brutal if you disrespect the distance.
CoachNotes: For Row/burpee Ladder: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Burpees. Row 125m after each set. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Burpees. Row 250m after each set. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Burpees. Row 250m after each set. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Burpees. Row 250m after each set. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: burpees. row 250m after each set.
Instructions_Clean: burpees. row 250m after each set.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Strict Press & DL Cycle
Description:
**Strict Press & Deadlift (DL) Cycle Workout (For Time)**

**Description:**  
This workout combines the barbell strict press—a shoulder strength move performed without leg drive—and the deadlift cycle, where multiple deadlift reps are completed in sequence. Complete prescribed rounds or total reps in the shortest time possible while maintaining strict form and safety. This routine targets upper body pressing strength, posterior chain endurance, and overall metabolic conditioning. Adjust weight to ensure strict technique throughout.
Flavor_Text: Strict Press & DL Cycle – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Strict Press & DL Cycle: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Strict Press (22/15 kgs), 5 Deadlifts (42/30 kgs), 7 V-Ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Strict Press (45/30 kgs), 10 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 15 V-Ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Strict Press (45/30 kgs), 10 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 15 V-Ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Strict Press (45/30 kgs), 10 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 15 V-Ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 strict press (45/30 kgs), 10 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 15 v-ups. for time
Instructions_Clean: 5 strict press (45/30 kgs), 10 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 15 v-ups. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: The Kettlebell Triplet
Description: The Kettlebell Triplet is a high-intensity, full-body AMRAP (as many rounds as possible) workout lasting 16 minutes. Using either a kettlebell or dumbbell, you'll cycle through three exercises back-to-back, focusing on strength, power, and endurance. This efficient circuit elevates your heart rate, builds muscle, and improves conditioning, making it ideal for those seeking a time-effective, challenging routine.
Flavor_Text: The Kettlebell Triplet – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes: For The Kettlebell Triplet: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Goblet Reverse Lunges (24/16 kg, 5 per leg), 10 American Kettlebell Swings, 10 Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Goblet Reverse Lunges (24/16 kg, 5 per leg), 10 American Kettlebell Swings, 10 Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Goblet Reverse Lunges (24/16 kg, 5 per leg), 10 American Kettlebell Swings, 10 Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Description.from:
Description:  
The Kettlebell Triplet is a high-intensity, full-body AMRAP (as many rounds as possible) workout lasting 16 minutes. Using either a kettlebell or dumbbell, you'll cycle through three exercises back-to-back, focusing on strength, power, and endurance. This efficient circuit elevates your heart rate, builds muscle, and improves conditioning, making it ideal for those seeking a time-effective, challenging routine.
Description.to: The Kettlebell Triplet is a high-intensity, full-body AMRAP (as many rounds as possible) workout lasting 16 minutes. Using either a kettlebell or dumbbell, you'll cycle through three exercises back-to-back, focusing on strength, power, and endurance. This efficient circuit elevates your heart rate, builds muscle, and improves conditioning, making it ideal for those seeking a time-effective, challenging routine.

Flavor_Text.from: The Kettlebell Triplet - A aerobic/mixed (long amrap) challenge that demands focus and grit.
Flavor_Text.to: The Kettlebell Triplet – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.

Name: Pistol & Strict Pull-up
Description: This workout combines pistol squats (single-leg squats) and strict pull-ups to build lower body strength, balance, and upper body pulling power. In the pistol, you perform a full squat on one leg, alternating sides for balanced development. Strict pull-ups are executed with controlled form, using no momentum, to maximize back and arm muscle engagement. The workout is for time, challenging your muscular endurance and stamina while promoting gymnastic skill proficiency. Focus on clean technique and full range of motion for each movement.
Flavor_Text: Pistol & Strict Pull-up – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Pistol & Strict Pull-up: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Strict Pull-ups, 5 Alternating Pistol Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Strict Pull-ups, 10 Alternating Pistol Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Strict Pull-ups, 10 Alternating Pistol Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Strict Pull-ups, 10 Alternating Pistol Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 strict pull-ups, 10 alternating pistol squats.
Instructions_Clean: 5 strict pull-ups, 10 alternating pistol squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Burpee Box Jump EMOM
Description: The Burpee Box Jump EMOM is a high-intensity interval workout performed every minute on the minute (EMOM) for 12 minutes. At the start of each minute, complete a set number of burpee box jumps, then rest for the remainder of the minute. This workout challenges cardiovascular endurance, explosive power, and full-body strength while training pacing and consistent work output.
Flavor_Text: Burpee Box Jump EMOM – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes: For Burpee Box Jump EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 6 Burpee Box Jump Overs (24/20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 6 Burpee Box Jump Overs (24/20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 6 Burpee Box Jump Overs (24/20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 6 burpee box jump overs (24/20 in).
Instructions_Clean: 6 burpee box jump overs (24/20 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Ski & Toes-to-bar
Description: This workout combines monostructural cardio (ski erg) with toes-to-bar, performed for time. Athletes alternate between intense ski intervals and challenging core-focused toes-to-bar repetitions. The objective is to complete all prescribed rounds as fast as possible, efficiently transitioning between ski cardio efforts and gymnastic movements. This pairing elevates heart rate and builds endurance, grip, and midline strength.
Flavor_Text: Ski & Toes-to-bar – Build aerobic grit with honest pacing and controlled breathing.
CoachNotes: For Ski & Toes-to-bar: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5/3 Calorie Ski, 3 Toes-to-Bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10/7 Calorie Ski, 7 Toes-to-Bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10/7 Calorie Ski, 7 Toes-to-Bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10/7 Calorie Ski, 7 Toes-to-Bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10/7 calorie ski, 7 toes-to-bar. for time
Instructions_Clean: 10/7 calorie ski, 7 toes-to-bar. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: High-rep Thruster AMRAP
Description: The High-rep Thruster AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible in 10 minutes) is a demanding barbell workout combining a front squat and overhead press into one fluid movement. Using moderate weight, perform as many thrusters as possible in ten minutes. This high-intensity, full-body exercise targets legs, shoulders, and core, boosting muscular endurance, cardiovascular fitness, and total-body conditioning. Suitable for intermediate to advanced lifters.
Flavor_Text: High-rep Thruster AMRAP – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes: For High-rep Thruster AMRAP: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Thrusters (35/25 kgs), 10 Burpees over Bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Thrusters (35/25 kgs), 10 Burpees over Bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Thrusters (35/25 kgs), 10 Burpees over Bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 thrusters (35/25 kgs), 10 burpees over bar.
Instructions_Clean: 10 thrusters (35/25 kgs), 10 burpees over bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Wall Walk & Air Bike
Description:
**Wall Walk & Air Bike (Gymnastics/Skill, For Time) – Description:**

A high-intensity combination workout targeting upper body strength, core stability, and cardiovascular endurance. Athletes perform wall walks—starting in a prone position facing the floor, pressing up, and walking feet and hands up a wall to achieve a stacked handstand position—focusing on shoulder strength and gymnastics skill. The Air Bike portion challenges metabolic capacity, pushing for maximum calories or distance in minimal time. This workout builds practical body control and aerobic power, suitable for all fitness levels with modifications.
Flavor_Text: Wall Walk & Air Bike – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Wall Walk & Air Bike: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Wall Walks, 7/6 Calorie Bike. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 3 Wall Walks, 15/12 Calorie Bike. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 3 Wall Walks, 15/12 Calorie Bike. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 3 Wall Walks, 15/12 Calorie Bike. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 3 wall walks, 15/12 calorie bike.
Instructions_Clean: 3 wall walks, 15/12 calorie bike.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: 30 Second Sprint EMOM
Description: A 15-minute EMOM ("Every Minute on the Minute") workout where you perform a 30-second all-out sprint at the start of each minute, followed by 30 seconds of rest or active recovery. Focus on maintaining consistent pacing and maximum effort during each sprint. This interval format enhances cardiovascular endurance, speed, and explosive power while promoting metabolic conditioning. Suitable for runners, cyclists, rowers, or any cardio machine.
Flavor_Text: 30 Second Sprint EMOM – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes: For 30 Second Sprint EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: Max Reps Double Unders in 30 seconds. Even: Max Reps Hand Release Push-ups in 30 seconds. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: Max Reps Double Unders in 30 seconds. Even: Max Reps Hand Release Push-ups in 30 seconds. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: Max Reps Double Unders in 30 seconds. Even: Max Reps Hand Release Push-ups in 30 seconds. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: max reps double unders in 30 seconds. even: max reps hand release push-ups in 30 seconds.
Instructions_Clean: odd: max repetitions double unders in 30 seconds. even: max repetitions hand release push-ups in 30 seconds.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Weighted Vest Run & Pull
Description: The Weighted Vest Run & Pull workout is a grind/endurance challenge performed for time. Athletes wear a weighted vest to increase resistance, enhancing strength and cardiovascular conditioning. The typical structure involves alternating intervals of running and pull-ups. This workout builds muscular endurance, grip strength, upper body power, and aerobic capacity, making it effective for functional fitness and overall performance improvement. The "for time" element emphasizes pacing and stamina, pushing athletes to complete all prescribed rounds as quickly as possible while maintaining good form.
Flavor_Text: Weighted Vest Run & Pull – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Weighted Vest Run & Pull: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 400m Run (with 20/6.4 kg Vest), 15 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 400m Run (with 20/6.4 kg Vest), 15 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 400m Run (with 20/6.4 kg Vest), 15 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 400m run (with 20/6.4 kg vest), 15 chest-to-bar pull-ups.

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Power Clean Pyramid
Description: The Power Clean Pyramid workout is a barbell-based, weightlifting routine structured in a pyramid rep scheme, performed for time. Athletes complete increasing, then decreasing, repetitions of power cleans, lifting the barbell from the floor to the shoulders in one explosive movement. The workout tests strength, speed, and conditioning, challenging both muscular endurance and cardiovascular capacity. Aim to finish as quickly as possible while maintaining proper technique throughout each set.
Flavor_Text: Power Clean Pyramid – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Power Clean Pyramid: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Power Cleans (60/45 kgs), 5 Strict Pull-ups (after each set). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Power Cleans (60/45 kgs), 5 Strict Pull-ups (after each set). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Name: Carry & Air Squat
Description: This workout combines weighted carries and air squats in a 17-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) format. Using a dumbbell or kettlebell, you'll carry the weight over a set distance or time, followed by a sequence of bodyweight air squats. The goal is to complete as many rounds of the carry and air squat as possible within 17 minutes, focusing on functional strength, endurance, and lower-body conditioning. Maintain proper form throughout, and choose a weight that is challenging but allows you to keep moving with minimal rest.
Flavor_Text: Carry & Air Squat – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes: For Carry & Air Squat: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 ft Dual Kettlebell Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 20 Air Squats, 10 Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 ft Dual Kettlebell Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 20 Air Squats, 10 Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 ft Dual Kettlebell Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 20 Air Squats, 10 Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 ft dual kettlebell farmer's carry (heavy), 20 air squats, 10 push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 50 ft dual kettlebell farmer's carry (heavy), 20 air squats, 10 push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Travel Burpee Challenge
Description: The Travel Burpee Challenge is a bodyweight workout designed for maximum efficiency while on the go. Complete a set number of burpees as quickly as possible, focusing on maintaining proper form and consistent pacing. This full-body exercise increases cardiovascular endurance, builds strength, and requires no equipment, making it ideal for travel or when gym access is limited. The "for time" format adds a competitive edge, encouraging you to push your limits and track personal progress.
Flavor_Text: Travel Burpee Challenge – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Burpees. Perform 2 Air Squats Every Minute on the Minute (starting at 1:1). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Burpees. Perform 5 Air Squats Every Minute on the Minute (starting at 0m 0s). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Burpees. Perform 5 Air Squats Every Minute on the Minute (starting at 0m 0s). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Burpees. Perform 5 Air Squats Every Minute on the Minute (starting at 0m 0s). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 burpees. perform 5 air squats every minute on the minute (starting at 0m 0s).
Instructions_Clean: 100 burpees. perform 5 air squats every minute on the minute (starting at 0m 0s).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
Description:  
The Travel Burpee Challenge is a bodyweight workout designed for maximum efficiency while on the go. Complete a set number of burpees as quickly as possible, focusing on maintaining proper form and consistent pacing. This full-body exercise increases cardiovascular endurance, builds strength, and requires no equipment, making it ideal for travel or when gym access is limited. The "for time" format adds a competitive edge, encouraging you to push your limits and track personal progress.
Description.to: The Travel Burpee Challenge is a bodyweight workout designed for maximum efficiency while on the go. This full-body exercise increases cardiovascular endurance, builds strength, and requires no equipment, making it ideal for travel or when gym access is limited. The "for time" format adds a competitive edge, encouraging you to push your limits and track personal progress.

Flavor_Text.from: Travel Burpee Challenge - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Travel Burpee Challenge – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.

Name: The Long Row
Description: The Long Row is a monostructural cardio workout focused on improving endurance, stamina, and cardiovascular fitness. Athletes complete a set row distance (such as 2K, 5K, or 10K meters) on a rowing machine as quickly as possible. The objective is to maintain a steady pace while efficiently managing energy output, making it a mental and physical challenge. This classic "for time" workout is ideal for benchmarking aerobic capacity and pacing strategy.
Flavor_Text: The Long Row – Simple on paper, brutal if you disrespect the distance.
CoachNotes: For The Long Row: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2500m Row. Every 500m, perform 10 GHD Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5000m Row. Every 1000m, perform 20 GHD Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5000m Row. Every 1000m, perform 20 GHD Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5000m Row. Every 1000m, perform 20 GHD Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5000m row. every 1000m, perform 20 ghd sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 5000m row. every 1000m, perform 20 ghd sit-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Barbell Thruster EMOM
Description: The Barbell Thruster EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) is a high-intensity interval workout performed for 10 minutes. At the start of each minute, complete a prescribed number of barbell thrusters, then rest for the remainder of the minute. This workout develops power, strength, cardiovascular endurance, and pacing skills. The focus is on maintaining consistent form and effort across all intervals while managing fatigue. Ideal for improving metabolic conditioning and full-body strength.
Flavor_Text: Barbell Thruster EMOM – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes: For Barbell Thruster EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 4 Thrusters (22/15 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 8 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 8 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 8 Thrusters (45/30 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 8 thrusters (45/30 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 8 thrusters (45/30 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Squat Snatch & Burpee
Description: The Squat Snatch & Burpee workout combines the explosive, full-body lift of a barbell squat snatch with high-intensity burpees, performed consecutively in a race against the clock ("For Time"). This workout challenges total-body strength, power, coordination, and cardiovascular fitness. Athletes complete a prescribed number of squat snatches—lifting the barbell from ground to overhead in one fluid motion while descending into a squat—followed by burpees, which add a plyometric and aerobic challenge. The aim is to finish all repetitions as quickly as possible, promoting endurance and work output under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: Squat Snatch & Burpee – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Squat Snatch & Burpee: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Squat Snatches (25/17 kgs), 2 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 3 Squat Snatches (50/35 kgs), 5 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 3 Squat Snatches (50/35 kgs), 5 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 3 Squat Snatches (50/35 kgs), 5 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 3 squat snatches (50/35 kgs), 5 burpee box jump overs.
Instructions_Clean: 3 squat snatches (50/35 kgs), 5 burpee box jump overs.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Heavy Deadlift & HSPU
Description: This high-intensity workout combines heavy barbell deadlifts with handstand push-ups (HSPUs), targeting both lower and upper body strength. Athletes alternate between lifts and gymnastics movements, challenging muscle endurance, explosive power, and core stability. Complete the prescribed repetitions of both exercises as quickly as possible for time, focusing on proper form and full range of motion throughout. This WOD encourages progressive overload with heavy weights and demands shoulder stability and balance during HSPUs, delivering a potent total-body strength session.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Deadlift & HSPU – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Deadlift & HSPU: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Deadlifts (72/50 kgs), 5 Handstand Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Deadlifts (145/100 kgs), 10 Handstand Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Deadlifts (145/100 kgs), 10 Handstand Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Deadlifts (145/100 kgs), 10 Handstand Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 deadlifts (145/100 kgs), 10 handstand push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 10 deadlifts (145/100 kgs), 10 handstand push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: The 30-minute Grind
Description: "The 30-Minute Grind" is a high-intensity AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout designed to build endurance, mental grit, and all-around fitness. Over 30 minutes, athletes cycle through challenging functional movements at a steady pace, aiming for consistent effort and minimal rest. This workout tests your stamina, pacing, and determination—perfect for those seeking to push their aerobic and muscular endurance. Stay focused, manage your energy, and grind through as many quality rounds as possible within the time cap.
Flavor_Text: The 30-minute Grind – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes: For The 30-minute Grind: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Wall Balls (5/2 kgs), 5 Clean and Jerks (30/22 kgs), 25 Double Unders. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 10 Clean and Jerks (60/45 kgs), 50 Double Unders. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 10 Clean and Jerks (60/45 kgs), 50 Double Unders. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs), 10 Clean and Jerks (60/45 kgs), 50 Double Unders. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 wall balls (10/5 kgs), 10 clean and jerks (60/45 kgs), 50 double unders.
Instructions_Clean: 15 wall balls (10/5 kgs), 10 clean and jerks (60/45 kgs), 50 double unders.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Pyramid Down
Description: Pyramid Down is a high-intensity workout format where you perform a sequence of exercises, starting with a higher number of repetitions or longer intervals and decreasing (descending) with each round—think 10, 8, 6, 4, 2 reps or minutes. The workout can use an AMRAP (as many rounds/reps as possible) or "For Time" approach, motivating you to maintain pace and power throughout. Pyramid Down builds strength, endurance, and mental toughness as you push through progressively lighter but still demanding sets.
Flavor_Text: Pyramid Down – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Pyramid Down: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Barbell Thrusters (22/15 kgs). Perform 5 Burpees after each set. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Barbell Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Perform 10 Burpees after each set. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Barbell Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Perform 10 Burpees after each set. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Barbell Thrusters (45/30 kgs). Perform 10 Burpees after each set. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: barbell thrusters (45/30 kgs). perform 10 burpees after each set.
Instructions_Clean: barbell thrusters (45/30 kgs). perform 10 burpees after each set.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Heavy Dumbbell Endurance
Description: The Heavy Dumbbell Endurance workout is a high-intensity session designed to improve muscular endurance and cardiovascular fitness using heavy dumbbells or kettlebells. Perform a sequence of functional movements (e.g., squats, presses, lunges, cleans) with challenging weights, aiming to complete the workout as quickly as possible (for time). This training method builds strength, stamina, and mental toughness. Suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes, it requires proper technique and prior experience with free weights. Always warm up thoroughly, use safe form, and adjust weights as needed for your ability level.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Dumbbell Endurance – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Dumbbell Endurance: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Dumbbell Hang Clean & Jerks (Heavy), 200m Run. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Dumbbell Hang Clean & Jerks (Heavy), 400m Run. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Dumbbell Hang Clean & Jerks (Heavy), 400m Run. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Dumbbell Hang Clean & Jerks (Heavy), 400m Run. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 dumbbell hang clean & jerks (heavy), 400m run.
Instructions_Clean: 15 dumbbell hang clean & jerks (heavy), 400m run.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Row/run/bike Relay
Description: The Row/Run/Bike Relay is a high-intensity, team-based cardio workout where participants alternate between rowing, running, and biking in a relay format. The objective is to complete a designated total distance or number of calories as quickly as possible, with team members taking turns on each modality. This workout promotes cardiovascular endurance, speed, teamwork, and efficient transitions, making it both challenging and fun for all fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Row/run/bike Relay – Long, steady output; aim for a rhythm you could explain, not survive.
CoachNotes: For Row/run/bike Relay: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 250m Row, 400m Run, 20 Calorie Bike. Must complete all three stations before starting the next round. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 500m Row, 800m Run, 40 Calorie Bike. Must complete all three stations before starting the next round. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 500m Row, 800m Run, 40 Calorie Bike. Must complete all three stations before starting the next round. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 500m Row, 800m Run, 40 Calorie Bike. Must complete all three stations before starting the next round. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 500m row, 800m run, 40 calorie bike. must complete all three stations before starting the next round.
Instructions_Clean: 500m row, 800m run, 40 calorie bike. must complete all three stations before starting the next round.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Death By Wall Ball
Description: The "Death By Wall Ball" workout follows an EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) format with increasing reps. Begin with 1 wall ball shot in the first minute. Each subsequent minute, add 1 rep (Minute 2: 2 wall balls, Minute 3: 3 wall balls, etc.). Continue until you can no longer complete the required reps within the minute. Focus on consistent pacing and efficient transitions to maximize rounds. This workout tests muscular endurance, cardiovascular fitness, and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Death By Wall Ball – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes: For Death By Wall Ball: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Minute 1: 2 Wall Balls (5/2 kgs). Minute 1: 3 Wall Balls. Minute 1: 3 Wall Balls... Continue until unable to complete the required reps in the minute. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Minute 1: 5 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs). Minute 2: 6 Wall Balls. Minute 3: 7 Wall Balls... Continue until unable to complete the required reps in the minute. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Minute 1: 5 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs). Minute 2: 6 Wall Balls. Minute 3: 7 Wall Balls... Continue until unable to complete the required reps in the minute. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Minute 1: 5 Wall Balls (10/5 kgs). Minute 2: 6 Wall Balls. Minute 3: 7 Wall Balls... Continue until unable to complete the required reps in the minute. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: minute 1: 5 wall balls (10/5 kgs). minute 2: 6 wall balls. minute 3: 7 wall balls... continue until unable to complete the required reps in the minute. for time

Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Description.from:
Description:  
The "Death By Wall Ball" workout follows an EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) format with increasing reps. Begin with 1 wall ball shot in the first minute. Each subsequent minute, add 1 rep (Minute 2: 2 wall balls, Minute 3: 3 wall balls, etc.). Continue until you can no longer complete the required reps within the minute. Focus on consistent pacing and efficient transitions to maximize rounds. This workout tests muscular endurance, cardiovascular fitness, and mental toughness.
Description.to: The "Death By Wall Ball" workout follows an EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) format with increasing reps. Begin with 1 wall ball shot in the first minute. Each subsequent minute, add 1 rep (Minute 2: 2 wall balls, Minute 3: 3 wall balls, etc.). Continue until you can no longer complete the required reps within the minute. Focus on consistent pacing and efficient transitions to maximize rounds. This workout tests muscular endurance, cardiovascular fitness, and mental toughness.

Flavor_Text.from: Death By Wall Ball - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Death By Wall Ball – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.

Name: Gymnastic Couple
Description: Gymnastic Couple is a timed partner workout focusing on gymnastics skills, coordination, and teamwork. Pairs complete synchronized and alternating gymnastic movements—such as handstand holds, synchronized pull-ups, and partner-assisted movements—as quickly as possible. Communication and technique are prioritized to complete all prescribed elements for the fastest time. This workout enhances body control, strength, and partner synergy.
Flavor_Text: Gymnastic Couple – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Gymnastic Couple: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 5 Ring Dips, 5 Pistols (alternating). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 10 Ring Dips, 10 Pistols (alternating). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 10 Ring Dips, 10 Pistols (alternating). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups, 10 Ring Dips, 10 Pistols (alternating). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 chest-to-bar pull-ups, 10 ring dips, 10 pistols (alternating).
Instructions_Clean: 10 chest-to-bar pull-ups, 10 ring dips, 10 pistols (alternating).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.
