Name: Dumbbell Sprint
Description:
**Workout Name:** Dumbbell Sprint (AMRAP 10)

**Description:**  
Perform as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) in 10 minutes of the following sequence:  
- Sprint 100 meters  
- 10 dumbbell snatches (alternating arms, moderate weight)

Repeat for 10 minutes. Move quickly and consistently, focusing on explosive sprints and safe, controlled dumbbell movements. Keep track of total rounds completed to measure progress. This high-intensity interval workout targets cardiovascular endurance, power, and full-body conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Dumbbell Sprint – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes: For Dumbbell Sprint: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Dumbbell Push Press (12/7 kgs), 5 Toes-to-Bar, 5 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Dumbbell Push Press (25/15 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar, 10 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Dumbbell Push Press (25/15 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar, 10 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Dumbbell Push Press (25/15 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar, 10 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 dumbbell push press (25/15 kgs), 10 toes-to-bar, 10 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
Instructions_Clean: 10 dumbbell push press (25/15 kgs), 10 toes-to-bar, 10 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Overhead Carry Grinder
Description: The Overhead Carry Grinder is a challenging endurance workout designed to build full-body stability, grip strength, and core endurance. Athletes move a loaded object (such as a barbell, dumbbell, or kettlebell) overhead and carry it for a set distance or duration, maintaining proper posture and locked-out arms. This grind-style workout emphasizes controlled, steady effort and mental toughness as you push through fatigue to complete the task for time.
Flavor_Text: Overhead Carry Grinder – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Overhead Carry Grinder: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Overhead Squats (30/22 kgs), with 50 ft Single Arm Farmer's Carry (Heavy KB) after each set. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Overhead Squats (60/45 kgs), with 100 ft Single Arm Farmer's Carry (Heavy KB) after each set. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Overhead Squats (60/45 kgs), with 100 ft Single Arm Farmer's Carry (Heavy KB) after each set. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Overhead Squats (60/45 kgs), with 100 ft Single Arm Farmer's Carry (Heavy KB) after each set. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: overhead squats (60/45 kgs), with 100 ft single arm farmer's carry (heavy kettlebell) after each set.
Instructions_Clean: overhead squats (60/45 kgs), with 100 ft single arm farmer's carry (heavy kettlebell) after each set.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Running Clock
Description: The Running Clock is a monostructural cardio EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) workout lasting 30 minutes. Each minute, perform a set distance or calorie target on a single cardio machine (such as a rower, bike, ski erg, or treadmill). Once the required work is completed, rest for the remainder of the minute. Repeat for 30 minutes. Focus on maintaining consistent output and pacing while targeting aerobic endurance and stamina. This format challenges cardiovascular capacity and encourages efficient recovery within short work-rest intervals.
Flavor_Text: The Running Clock – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes: For The Running Clock: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: 7/6 Calorie Bike. Even: 200m Run. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: 15/12 Calorie Bike. Even: 400m Run. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: 15/12 Calorie Bike. Even: 400m Run. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: 15/12 Calorie Bike. Even: 400m Run. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: 15/12 calorie bike. even: 400m run.
Instructions_Clean: odd: 15/12 calorie bike. even: 400m run.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Heavy Deadlift Hold
Description: The Heavy Deadlift Hold is a strength and grip endurance exercise. Using a loaded barbell, the lifter deadlifts the weight to a standing position and holds it at the top for a set duration or as long as possible. This workout challenges the forearms, back, and core, improving overall grip strength and stability under heavy loads. Maintain a firm grip, locked hips and knees, and a braced core throughout.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Deadlift Hold – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Deadlift Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Deadlifts (42% 1RM), 1m 0s Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Deadlifts (85% 1RM), 1m 0s Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Deadlifts (85% 1RM), 1m 0s Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Deadlifts (85% 1RM), 1m 0s Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 deadlifts (85% 1rm), 1m 0s plank hold (weighted optional). for time
Instructions_Clean: 5 deadlifts (85% 1rm), 1m 0s plank hold (weighted optional). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Bodyweight Max Rep
Description: Bodyweight Max Rep is a high-intensity, for-time workout using only your body weight, ideal for travel or at-home training. Complete as many repetitions as possible of basic bodyweight movements—such as push-ups, air squats, and sit-ups—in a set period or until fatigue, focusing on endurance, strength, and maximizing effort. No equipment required; scalable for all fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Bodyweight Max Rep – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1m 0s Max Rep Push-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Sit-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Air Squats. 1m 0s rest between rounds. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1m 0s Max Rep Push-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Sit-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Air Squats. 1m 0s rest between rounds. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1m 0s Max Rep Push-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Sit-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Air Squats. 1m 0s rest between rounds. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1m 0s Max Rep Push-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Sit-ups, 1m 0s Max Rep Air Squats. 1m 0s rest between rounds. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1m 0s max rep push-ups, 1m 0s max rep sit-ups, 1m 0s max rep air squats. 1m 0s rest between rounds.
Instructions_Clean: 1m 0s max rep push-ups, 1m 0s max rep sit-ups, 1m 0s max rep air squats. 1m 0s rest between rounds.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Snatch & OHS Endurance
Description: This workout focuses on building endurance through barbell Snatch and Overhead Squat (OHS) movements performed for time. Athletes complete multiple rounds or set repetitions, emphasizing consistent technique and unbroken sets. The aim is to improve muscular stamina, overhead stability, and full-body coordination, making it ideal for lifters seeking both strength and cardiovascular adaptation.
Flavor_Text: Snatch & OHS Endurance – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Snatch & OHS Endurance: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Squat Snatches (22/15 kgs), 2 Overhead Squats (22/15 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 3 Squat Snatches (45/30 kgs), 5 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 3 Squat Snatches (45/30 kgs), 5 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 3 Squat Snatches (45/30 kgs), 5 Overhead Squats (45/30 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 3 squat snatches (45/30 kgs), 5 overhead squats (45/30 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 3 squat snatches (45/30 kgs), 5 overhead squats (45/30 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The 40-minute Endurance
Description: The 40-minute Endurance (Grind/endurance, For Time) is a challenging workout focused on building cardiovascular stamina and muscular endurance. This session involves sustained, continuous movement using moderate-intensity, full-body exercises performed for time. The objective is to maintain consistent effort and pace throughout the 40 minutes, testing mental toughness and aerobic capacity. Ideal for athletes seeking to enhance overall conditioning, this workout encourages strategic pacing, efficient technique, and steady breathing for best results.
Flavor_Text: The 40-minute Endurance – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For The 40-minute Endurance: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 20 Calorie Row, 20 Wall Balls, 20 GHD Sit-ups, 20 Burpees, 20 Pull-ups, 20 Ring Dips. (Complete in order). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 40 Calorie Row, 40 Wall Balls, 40 GHD Sit-ups, 40 Burpees, 40 Pull-ups, 40 Ring Dips. (Complete in order). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 40 Calorie Row, 40 Wall Balls, 40 GHD Sit-ups, 40 Burpees, 40 Pull-ups, 40 Ring Dips. (Complete in order). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 40 Calorie Row, 40 Wall Balls, 40 GHD Sit-ups, 40 Burpees, 40 Pull-ups, 40 Ring Dips. (Complete in order). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 40 calorie row, 40 wall balls, 40 ghd sit-ups, 40 burpees, 40 pull-ups, 40 ring dips. (complete in order).
Instructions_Clean: 40 calorie row, 40 wall balls, 40 ghd sit-ups, 40 burpees, 40 pull-ups, 40 ring dips. (complete in order).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Travel Cardio Triplet
Description: The Travel Cardio Triplet is a bodyweight-only workout designed for maximum efficiency while traveling or when equipment is unavailable. Set a timer for 20 minutes and complete as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) of a dynamic three-exercise circuit. This high-intensity workout targets cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, and total-body conditioning. All movements use just your bodyweight, making it perfect for hotel rooms or small spaces. The Travel Cardio Triplet keeps your heart rate elevated, burns calories, and boosts stamina—no equipment required. Adjust pace and intensity as needed for your current fitness level.
Flavor_Text: Travel Cardio Triplet – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Burpees, 5 Box Jumps (or Step-ups), 25 Double Unders. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Burpees, 10 Box Jumps (or Step-ups), 50 Double Unders. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Burpees, 10 Box Jumps (or Step-ups), 50 Double Unders. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Burpees, 10 Box Jumps (or Step-ups), 50 Double Unders. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 burpees, 10 box jumps (or step-ups), 50 double unders.
Instructions_Clean: 5 burpees, 10 box jumps (or step-ups), 50 double unders.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Clean & Jerk EMOM
Description: Clean & Jerk EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) is a strength and conditioning workout where you perform a specified number of clean & jerk reps at the top of each minute for 12 minutes. Focus on efficient technique, consistent pacing, and controlled breathing. The goal is to maintain form and intensity throughout all rounds, building strength, power, and cardiovascular endurance. Suitable for all levels with scalable weights.
Flavor_Text: Clean & Jerk EMOM – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes: For Clean & Jerk EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Clean & Jerks (35/25 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 2 Clean & Jerks (70/50 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 2 Clean & Jerks (70/50 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.

Description.from:
**Description:**  
Clean & Jerk EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) is a strength and conditioning workout where you perform a specified number of clean & jerk reps at the top of each minute for 12 minutes. Focus on efficient technique, consistent pacing, and controlled breathing. The goal is to maintain form and intensity throughout all rounds, building strength, power, and cardiovascular endurance. Suitable for all levels with scalable weights.
Description.to: Clean & Jerk EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) is a strength and conditioning workout where you perform a specified number of clean & jerk reps at the top of each minute for 12 minutes. Focus on efficient technique, consistent pacing, and controlled breathing. The goal is to maintain form and intensity throughout all rounds, building strength, power, and cardiovascular endurance. Suitable for all levels with scalable weights.

Flavor_Text.from: Clean & Jerk EMOM - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: Clean & Jerk EMOM – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.

Name: Rope Climb Repeater
Description: The Rope Climb Repeater is a gymnastics-based workout focused on strength, coordination, and endurance. Athletes ascend a suspended rope multiple times as quickly as possible, targeting upper body, core, and grip strength. Proper technique and controlled foot locks are emphasized for safety and efficiency. Ideal for developing functional pulling power and climbing skill under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: Rope Climb Repeater – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Rope Climb Repeater: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Rope Climbs (Legless optional), 7 Dumbbell Thrusters (10/5 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 3 Rope Climbs (Legless optional), 15 Dumbbell Thrusters (20/10 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 3 Rope Climbs (Legless optional), 15 Dumbbell Thrusters (20/10 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 3 Rope Climbs (Legless optional), 15 Dumbbell Thrusters (20/10 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 3 rope climbs (legless optional), 15 dumbbell thrusters (20/10 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 3 rope climbs (legless optional), 15 dumbbell thrusters (20/10 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Kettlebell Swing Pyramid
Description: The Kettlebell Swing Pyramid is a full-body, cardio-intensive workout that utilizes a dumbbell or kettlebell. Complete an ascending and descending sequence of kettlebell swings for time, progressively increasing and then decreasing reps each round. This routine targets the glutes, hamstrings, core, shoulders, and improves explosive power and endurance. Suitable for all fitness levels; adjust weight as needed for form and safety.
Flavor_Text: Kettlebell Swing Pyramid – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Kettlebell Swing Pyramid: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: American Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg), with 2 Strict Push-ups after each set. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: American Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), with 5 Strict Push-ups after each set. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: American Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), with 5 Strict Push-ups after each set. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: American Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg), with 5 Strict Push-ups after each set. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: american kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), with 5 strict push-ups after each set.
Instructions_Clean: american kettlebell swings (24/16 kg), with 5 strict push-ups after each set.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Half Marathon Prep
Description: This Half Marathon Prep workout is a monostructural, cardio-based session focused on building endurance, pacing, and mental stamina for long-distance running. Athletes complete a set distance—13.1 miles or scale accordingly—for time, emphasizing consistent effort and strategic pacing to simulate race conditions and improve aerobic capacity.
Flavor_Text: Half Marathon Prep – An engine test; settle into a pace you can actually hold.
CoachNotes: For Half Marathon Prep: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5,1m Row (or 2500m Ski-Erg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10,000m Row (or 5000m Ski-Erg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10,000m Row (or 5000m Ski-Erg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10,000m Row (or 5000m Ski-Erg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10,000m row (or 5000m ski-erg).
Instructions_Clean: 10,000m row (or 5000m ski-erg).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Heavy Power Clean Ladder
Description: The Heavy Power Clean Ladder is a barbell weightlifting workout performed for time. Athletes complete ascending (or descending) repetitions of power cleans with increasing weight at each stage (“rung”) of the ladder. The goal is to move efficiently through prescribed weights, emphasizing strength, explosive power, and technique under fatigue. This format challenges muscular endurance and lifting capacity, making it ideal for advanced lifters seeking to test max effort under timed conditions. Rest is allowed between attempts, but the clock runs continuously—finish all lifts as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Power Clean Ladder – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Power Clean Ladder: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Power Cleans (42/30 kgs). Perform 2 Burpees Over Bar after each set. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Power Cleans (85/60 kgs). Perform 5 Burpees Over Bar after each set. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Power Cleans (85/60 kgs). Perform 5 Burpees Over Bar after each set. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Power Cleans (85/60 kgs). Perform 5 Burpees Over Bar after each set. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: power cleans (85/60 kgs). perform 5 burpees over bar after each set.
Instructions_Clean: power cleans (85/60 kgs). perform 5 burpees over bar after each set.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Push/pull Interval
Description: This push/pull interval workout alternates upper body push and pull movements for maximal effort. Complete as many quality repetitions as possible (AMRAP) during each 5-minute work interval. After each work round, take a 1-minute rest before the next round. Aim to maintain intensity and good form throughout all three rounds. This workout is time-efficient and ideal for building strength, muscular endurance, and cardiovascular fitness. Suitable for all levels—adjust exercises and intensity as needed.
Flavor_Text: Push/pull Interval – Barbell-centric grind; control the setup, own every rep.
CoachNotes: For Push/pull Interval: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Handstand Push-ups, 5 Pull-ups, 7 Wall Balls. Score is total rounds/reps. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Handstand Push-ups, 10 Pull-ups, 15 Wall Balls. Score is total rounds/reps. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Handstand Push-ups, 10 Pull-ups, 15 Wall Balls. Score is total rounds/reps. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Handstand Push-ups, 10 Pull-ups, 15 Wall Balls. Score is total rounds/reps. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 handstand push-ups, 10 pull-ups, 15 wall balls. score is total rounds/reps.
Instructions_Clean: 5 handstand push-ups, 10 pull-ups, 15 wall balls. score is total rounds/repetitions.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Ring Row & Lunge
Description: This bodyweight circuit combines Ring Rows and Lunges for a balanced, full-body workout—ideal for travel or home sessions. During the AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) 18-minute format, alternate between pulling (Ring Rows) to build upper body and core strength, and Lunges to enhance lower body endurance and balance. Focus on form over speed, ensuring controlled movements and full range of motion. Suitable for all fitness levels; adjust intensity by manipulating rep schemes or rest intervals. No equipment needed except a suspension trainer or sturdy rings for the rows.
Flavor_Text: Ring Row & Lunge – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Ring Rows (or Towel Rows), 10 Walking Lunges (per leg), 5 Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Ring Rows (or Towel Rows), 20 Walking Lunges (per leg), 10 Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Ring Rows (or Towel Rows), 20 Walking Lunges (per leg), 10 Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Ring Rows (or Towel Rows), 20 Walking Lunges (per leg), 10 Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 ring rows (or towel rows), 20 walking lunges (per leg), 10 sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 10 ring rows (or towel rows), 20 walking lunges (per leg), 10 sit-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Overhead Carry EMOM
Description: Perform an Overhead Carry EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) for 16 minutes. At the start of each minute, lift a weight (dumbbells, kettlebells, or a barbell) overhead and walk a set distance or for a set time, maintaining a strong, stable core and locked-out elbows. Rest for the remainder of the minute. Focus on controlled breathing, upright posture, and active shoulder engagement to improve overhead stability, core strength, and endurance throughout the workout. Adjust weight or distance to maintain quality movement and pacing each round.
Flavor_Text: Overhead Carry EMOM – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes: For Overhead Carry EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: 100 ft Overhead Barbell Walk (light/medium weight). Even: 10 Bar Facing Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: 100 ft Overhead Barbell Walk (light/medium weight). Even: 10 Bar Facing Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: 100 ft Overhead Barbell Walk (light/medium weight). Even: 10 Bar Facing Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: 100 ft overhead barbell walk (light/medium weight). even: 10 bar facing burpees.

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Endurance Chipper
Description: The Endurance Chipper is a grind-style workout focused on building cardiovascular endurance and mental toughness. Athletes complete a long sequence of varied functional movements—often high repetitions of bodyweight exercises, cardio bursts, and light weights—performed in order, for time. The goal is steady, consistent pacing and continuous movement until all reps are finished, testing both stamina and determination.
Flavor_Text: The Endurance Chipper – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For The Endurance Chipper: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Double Unders, 100 Air Squats, 100 Sit-ups, 100 Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Double Unders, 100 Air Squats, 100 Sit-ups, 100 Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 double unders, 100 air squats, 100 sit-ups, 100 push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 100 double unders, 100 air squats, 100 sit-ups, 100 push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The 40-minute Partner
Description: The 40-minute Partner Grind is a high-intensity endurance workout performed in pairs. For 40 minutes, partners alternate work and rest, completing as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) of a challenging sequence of functional movements. This workout emphasizes teamwork, communication, and sustained effort, targeting muscular endurance, cardiovascular capacity, and mental toughness. Perfect for building camaraderie while pushing physical limits.
Flavor_Text: The 40-minute Partner – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes: For The 40-minute Partner: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Partner A runs 400m while Partner B completes max reps of: 5 Pull-ups, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. Score is total rounds/reps. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Partner A runs 400m while Partner B completes max reps of: 5 Pull-ups, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. Score is total rounds/reps. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Partner A runs 400m while Partner B completes max reps of: 5 Pull-ups, 10 Push-ups, 15 Squats. Score is total rounds/reps. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).

Name: The Skill Switch
Description: "The Skill Switch" is a gymnastics-focused EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 15 minutes. Each minute introduces a different gymnastics skill or progression, switching movements every minute to challenge coordination and develop well-rounded gymnastic ability. This workout is ideal for practicing technique, building strength, and improving body control with frequent skill variation and short, managed work intervals.
Flavor_Text: The Skill Switch – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes: For The Skill Switch: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Min 1: 2 Strict Handstand Push-ups. Min 1: 2 Ring Muscle-Ups. Min 1: 7 V-Ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Min 1: 5 Strict Handstand Push-ups. Min 2: 5 Ring Muscle-Ups. Min 3: 15 V-Ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Min 1: 5 Strict Handstand Push-ups. Min 2: 5 Ring Muscle-Ups. Min 3: 15 V-Ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Min 1: 5 Strict Handstand Push-ups. Min 2: 5 Ring Muscle-Ups. Min 3: 15 V-Ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: min 1: 5 strict handstand push-ups. min 2: 5 ring muscle-ups. min 3: 15 v-ups.
Instructions_Clean: min 1: 5 strict handstand push-ups. min 2: 5 ring muscle-ups. min 3: 15 v-ups.

Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
**Description:**  
"The Skill Switch" is a gymnastics-focused EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 15 minutes. Each minute introduces a different gymnastics skill or progression, switching movements every minute to challenge coordination and develop well-rounded gymnastic ability. This workout is ideal for practicing technique, building strength, and improving body control with frequent skill variation and short, managed work intervals.
Description.to: "The Skill Switch" is a gymnastics-focused EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 15 minutes. Each minute introduces a different gymnastics skill or progression, switching movements every minute to challenge coordination and develop well-rounded gymnastic ability. This workout is ideal for practicing technique, building strength, and improving body control with frequent skill variation and short, managed work intervals.

Flavor_Text.from: The Skill Switch - A interval power / strength-endurance challenge that demands focus and grit.
Flavor_Text.to: The Skill Switch – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.

Name: Row/clean Duet
Description: The Row/Clean Duet is a challenging for-time workout that alternates between barbell cleans and rowing. This high-intensity session improves overall strength, cardiovascular endurance, and explosive power. Athletes perform prescribed repetitions on the rowing machine, then immediately transition to a set number of barbell cleans, repeating for several rounds. The goal is to complete all rounds as quickly as possible with proper form. Suitable for intermediate to advanced lifters, this workout enhances functional fitness by combining dynamic lifting with sustained cardio effort.
Flavor_Text: Row/clean Duet – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Row/clean Duet: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10/7 Calorie Row, 5 Squat Cleans (30/22 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20/15 Calorie Row, 10 Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20/15 Calorie Row, 10 Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20/15 Calorie Row, 10 Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20/15 calorie row, 10 squat cleans (60/45 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 20/15 calorie row, 10 squat cleans (60/45 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Dumbbell Assault
Description: Dumbbell Assault is a high-intensity, 15-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout focused on building strength, endurance, and full-body conditioning. Using either dumbbells or kettlebells, athletes cycle through a set sequence of compound movements—such as goblet squats, push presses, alternating snatches, and renegade rows—completing as many repetitions and rounds as possible within 15 minutes. This challenging circuit targets all major muscle groups, boosts heart rate, and enhances muscular stamina, making it ideal for both intermediate and advanced fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Dumbbell Assault – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes: For Dumbbell Assault: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Dumbbell Thrusters (12/7 kgs), 7 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans, 10 Box Step-ups (no weight). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Dumbbell Thrusters (25/15 kgs), 15 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans, 20 Box Step-ups (no weight). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Dumbbell Thrusters (25/15 kgs), 15 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans, 20 Box Step-ups (no weight). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Dumbbell Thrusters (25/15 kgs), 15 Dumbbell Hang Power Cleans, 20 Box Step-ups (no weight). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 dumbbell thrusters (25/15 kgs), 15 dumbbell hang power cleans, 20 box step-ups (no weight).
Instructions_Clean: 10 dumbbell thrusters (25/15 kgs), 15 dumbbell hang power cleans, 20 box step-ups (no weight).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Metcon Madness
Description: Metcon Madness is a high-intensity, metabolic conditioning workout performed as an AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) in 20 minutes. Athletes cycle through a set series of functional movements—such as squats, push-ups, burpees, and kettlebell swings—completing as many rounds and reps as possible within the time cap. The focus is on maintaining steady effort, efficient movement, and pacing for maximal output. This session boosts cardiovascular endurance, strength, and muscular stamina, delivering an intense full-body challenge suitable for all fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Metcon Madness – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes: For Metcon Madness: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Wall Balls, 5 Burpees, 2 Deadlifts (50/35 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Wall Balls, 10 Burpees, 5 Deadlifts (100/70 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Wall Balls, 10 Burpees, 5 Deadlifts (100/70 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Wall Balls, 10 Burpees, 5 Deadlifts (100/70 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 wall balls, 10 burpees, 5 deadlifts (100/70 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 15 wall balls, 10 burpees, 5 deadlifts (100/70 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: The Long Machine
Description: The Long Machine is a cardio-intensive, monostructural workout performed for time. Using a single piece of equipment—commonly a rower, bike, or ski erg—you will push your aerobic and muscular endurance by maintaining steady effort over a long distance or duration. Pace management and consistent breathing are crucial to completing the workout quickly and efficiently, making this ideal for building stamina and testing mental fortitude.
Flavor_Text: The Long Machine – Let patience do the work; speed only matters once you’re halfway in.
CoachNotes: For The Long Machine: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1000m Row, 1000m Ski-Erg, 1000m Bike. Rest 1m 0s between machines. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 2000m Row, 2000m Ski-Erg, 2000m Bike. Rest 2m 0s between machines. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 2000m Row, 2000m Ski-Erg, 2000m Bike. Rest 2m 0s between machines. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 2000m Row, 2000m Ski-Erg, 2000m Bike. Rest 2m 0s between machines. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 2000m row, 2000m ski-erg, 2000m bike. rest 2m 0s between machines.
Instructions_Clean: 2000m row, 2000m ski-erg, 2000m bike. rest 2m 0s between machines.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Barbell Repeater
Description: Barbell Repeater (EMOM 16) is a high-intensity interval workout structured as "Every Minute On the Minute" for 16 minutes. Perform a set number of barbell reps at the start of each minute, using a challenging but manageable weight. Focus on consistent pacing, completing reps efficiently so you have rest before the next minute starts. This EMOM format builds muscular endurance, barbell proficiency, and aerobic capacity. Ideal for athletes looking to improve work capacity and barbell cycling technique.
Flavor_Text: Barbell Repeater – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes: For Barbell Repeater: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: 2 Power Snatches (25/17 kgs). Even: 5 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: 5 Power Snatches (50/35 kgs). Even: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: 5 Power Snatches (50/35 kgs). Even: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: 5 Power Snatches (50/35 kgs). Even: 10 Chest-to-Bar Pull-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: 5 power snatches (50/35 kgs). even: 10 chest-to-bar pull-ups.
Instructions_Clean: odd: 5 power snatches (50/35 kgs). even: 10 chest-to-bar pull-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Bodyweight Max Out
Description: Bodyweight Max Out is a high-intensity, travel-friendly workout designed to push your limits using only bodyweight exercises. Complete a challenging sequence of movements—such as push-ups, squats, burpees, and planks—as fast as possible for time. Perfect for building strength, endurance, and cardiovascular fitness without the need for equipment. Track your best time and aim to improve each session.
Flavor_Text: Bodyweight Max Out – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Burpees, 5 Push-ups, 5 Pull-ups (or Ring Rows), 5 Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Burpees, 10 Push-ups, 10 Pull-ups (or Ring Rows), 10 Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Burpees, 10 Push-ups, 10 Pull-ups (or Ring Rows), 10 Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Burpees, 10 Push-ups, 10 Pull-ups (or Ring Rows), 10 Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 burpees, 10 push-ups, 10 pull-ups (or ring rows), 10 air squats.
Instructions_Clean: 10 burpees, 10 push-ups, 10 pull-ups (or ring rows), 10 air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Kettlebell Skill Flow
Description: The Kettlebell Skill Flow is a dynamic, time-based workout designed to improve strength, coordination, and endurance using a dumbbell or kettlebell. Participants flow through a series of functional movements—such as swings, cleans, presses, and snatches—performed back-to-back with minimal rest. This workout challenges multiple muscle groups, enhances grip strength, and sharpens movement skills. Suitable for all fitness levels, it can be tailored by adjusting weight or movement complexity. Complete the prescribed flow as fast as possible while maintaining proper form.
Flavor_Text: Kettlebell Skill Flow – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Kettlebell Skill Flow: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Turkish Get-ups (10/5 kgs), 2 per arm), 10 American Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Turkish Get-ups (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 20 American Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Turkish Get-ups (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 20 American Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Turkish Get-ups (20/10 kgs), 5 per arm), 20 American Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Weighted Step-up Grind
Description: The Weighted Step-up Grind is a lower-body endurance workout focused on building strength, power, and cardiovascular stamina. Using a box or bench and holding dumbbells or a barbell, athletes alternate stepping up and down, maintaining steady pace and proper form, for a set duration or total repetitions. The added weight increases muscular challenge, targeting glutes, quads, and hamstrings, while ‘for time’ format encourages grit and pacing. Perfect for metabolic conditioning and functional leg development.
Flavor_Text: Weighted Step-up Grind – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Weighted Step-up Grind: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Weighted Box Step-ups (50/15.9 kg DBs). Every time you break, perform 10 Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Weighted Box Step-ups (50/15.9 kg DBs). Every time you break, perform 10 Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Weighted Box Step-ups (50/15.9 kg DBs). Every time you break, perform 10 Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 weighted box step-ups (50/15.9 kg dbs). every time you break, perform 10 sit-ups. for time

Name: HSPU & Pistols
Description: This workout focuses on advanced bodyweight movements: Handstand Push-Ups (HSPU) and Pistol Squats. HSPUs build upper body and core strength, challenging shoulder stability and balance. Pistols target leg strength, mobility, and unilateral coordination. Completing this workout “For Time” means you perform the prescribed set of reps as quickly and efficiently as possible, emphasizing skill, control, and intensity. Suitable for athletes with intermediate to advanced gymnastics proficiency.
Flavor_Text: HSPU & Pistols – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For HSPU & Pistols: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Handstand Push-ups, Alternating Pistol Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Handstand Push-ups, Alternating Pistol Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: handstand push-ups, alternating pistol squats. for time

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
**Description:**  
This workout focuses on advanced bodyweight movements: Handstand Push-Ups (HSPU) and Pistol Squats. HSPUs build upper body and core strength, challenging shoulder stability and balance. Pistols target leg strength, mobility, and unilateral coordination. Completing this workout “For Time” means you perform the prescribed set of reps as quickly and efficiently as possible, emphasizing skill, control, and intensity. Suitable for athletes with intermediate to advanced gymnastics proficiency.

HSPUs build upper body and core strength, challenging shoulder stability and balance. Pistols target leg strength, mobility, and unilateral coordination. Completing this workout “For Time” means you perform the prescribed set of reps as quickly and efficiently as possible, emphasizing skill, control, and intensity. Suitable for athletes with intermediate to advanced gymnastics proficiency.

Flavor_Text.from: HSPU & Pistols - A for time - high intensity pacing challenge that demands focus and grit.
Flavor_Text.to: HSPU & Pistols – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.

Name: High-rep Hang Cleans
Description: High-rep hang cleans with a barbell are a dynamic, full-body weightlifting exercise, commonly performed in AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workouts. Starting from a standing position, the barbell is held at thigh level ("hang" position). With a powerful hip hinge and explosive extension, the barbell is pulled upwards along the body, then caught in a front rack position with elbows high. This movement targets the posterior chain, shoulders, and core, while also enhancing power, coordination, and cardiovascular endurance when done for high repetitions. In an AMRAP 12 format, perform as many high-quality reps as possible in 12 minutes, prioritizing good form and safe mechanics.
Flavor_Text: High-rep Hang Cleans – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes: For High-rep Hang Cleans: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Hang Power Cleans (22/15 kgs), 7 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Hang Power Cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Hang Power Cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Hang Power Cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 hang power cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 15 hang power cleans (45/30 kgs), 15 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Strict Core EMOM
Description:
**Strict Core EMOM (EMOM 15) – Workout Enrichment**

**Description:**  
This 15-minute EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout targets the core with strict, controlled movements. Every minute, perform a specified core exercise for a set number of repetitions or time, aiming for perfect form and muscular engagement. After completing the reps, use the remaining time in the minute to rest before starting the next set at the top of the next minute. This pacing maximizes core activation, improves muscular endurance, and helps maintain consistent effort throughout the session. Ideal for athletes seeking to strengthen and stabilize the midline efficiently.
Flavor_Text: Strict Core EMOM – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes: For Strict Core EMOM: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold (min 7 seconds). Even: 7 GHD Sit-ups (or V-ups). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold (min 15 seconds). Even: 15 GHD Sit-ups (or V-ups). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold (min 15 seconds). Even: 15 GHD Sit-ups (or V-ups). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold (min 15 seconds). Even: 15 GHD Sit-ups (or V-ups). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: max l-sit hold (min 15 seconds). even: 15 ghd sit-ups (or v-ups). for time
Instructions_Clean: odd: max l-sit hold (min 15 seconds). even: 15 ghd sit-ups (or v-ups). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Long Chipper II
Description: The Long Chipper II is a challenging grind/endurance workout performed "for time." Athletes progress through a lengthy sequence of diverse exercises, performing high reps of each movement before advancing to the next. The objective is to complete all prescribed repetitions and movements in the shortest possible time, testing overall stamina, muscular endurance, and mental toughness. This chipper format demands steady pacing, consistent effort, and efficient transitions, making it ideal for building aerobic capacity and resilience.
Flavor_Text: The Long Chipper II – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For The Long Chipper II: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Wall Balls, 40 Dumbbell Snatches (12/7 kgs), 30 Box Jumps, 20 Ring Rows, 10 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Wall Balls, 80 Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 60 Box Jumps, 40 Ring Rows, 20 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Wall Balls, 80 Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 60 Box Jumps, 40 Ring Rows, 20 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Wall Balls, 80 Dumbbell Snatches (25/15 kgs), 60 Box Jumps, 40 Ring Rows, 20 Burpee Box Jump Overs. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 wall balls, 80 dumbbell snatches (25/15 kgs), 60 box jumps, 40 ring rows, 20 burpee box jump overs.
Instructions_Clean: 100 wall balls, 80 dumbbell snatches (25/15 kgs), 60 box jumps, 40 ring rows, 20 burpee box jump overs.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Thruster Penalty
Description: Thruster Penalty is an AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 15 minutes. Athletes cycle through a set sequence of functional movements, including thrusters and auxiliary exercises. Each time a prescribed element (such as unbroken thrusters) is not completed as required, a penalty—such as additional burpees or another movement—is immediately enforced before resuming the workout. The session challenges full-body strength, endurance, and mental grit while incorporating consequences for technical breakdowns or missed reps. This format drives consistency and intensity throughout the 15-minute interval.
Flavor_Text: Thruster Penalty – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes: For Thruster Penalty: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Thrusters (25/17 kgs). If you stop or break the set of 5, perform 2 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Thrusters (50/35 kgs). If you stop or break the set of 10, perform 5 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Thrusters (50/35 kgs). If you stop or break the set of 10, perform 5 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Thrusters (50/35 kgs). If you stop or break the set of 10, perform 5 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 thrusters (50/35 kgs). if you stop or break the set of 10, perform 5 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 10 thrusters (50/35 kgs). if you stop or break the set of 10, perform 5 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Double Kettlebell Squats
Description: Double Kettlebell Squats are a full-body exercise focusing on strength, stability, and endurance. Holding a kettlebell or dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height (front rack position), lower your body into a squat, keeping your chest upright and core engaged. Drive through your heels to return to standing. Repeat for the prescribed time or number of reps. This movement builds powerful legs, enhances core stability, and increases grip strength. Ideal for high-intensity or endurance workouts.
Flavor_Text: Double Kettlebell Squats – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Double Kettlebell Squats: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Dual Kettlebell Front Rack Squats (Heavy), 7 Toes-to-Bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Dual Kettlebell Front Rack Squats (Heavy), 15 Toes-to-Bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Dual Kettlebell Front Rack Squats (Heavy), 15 Toes-to-Bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Dual Kettlebell Front Rack Squats (Heavy), 15 Toes-to-Bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 dual kettlebell front rack squats (heavy), 15 toes-to-bar.
Instructions_Clean: 10 dual kettlebell front rack squats (heavy), 15 toes-to-bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Barbell & Run Intervals
Description: This high-intensity interval workout alternates barbell strength movements with running for a balanced cardio and resistance training session. Complete 6 rounds, working for 2 minutes followed by 1 minute of rest per round. Each work interval combines explosive barbell exercises (such as deadlifts, cleans, or squats) with a fast-paced run, challenging both muscular endurance and cardiovascular fitness. This workout boosts calorie burn, improves conditioning, and builds overall functional strength. Suitable for intermediate and advanced athletes; scale weights and running distances as needed.
Flavor_Text: Barbell & Run Intervals – Strength-focused work that rewards patience, bracing, and clean positions.
CoachNotes: For Barbell & Run Intervals: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Max Reps of: 2 Deadlifts (42/30 kgs), 2 Hang Power Cleans (30/22 kgs). Run 100m immediately after the 1m 0s. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Max Reps of: 5 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 5 Hang Power Cleans (60/45 kgs). Run 200m immediately after the 2m 0s. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Max Reps of: 5 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 5 Hang Power Cleans (60/45 kgs). Run 200m immediately after the 2m 0s. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Max Reps of: 5 Deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 5 Hang Power Cleans (60/45 kgs). Run 200m immediately after the 2m 0s. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: max reps of: 5 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 5 hang power cleans (60/45 kgs). run 200m immediately after the 2m 0s.
Instructions_Clean: max repetitions of: 5 deadlifts (85/60 kgs), 5 hang power cleans (60/45 kgs). run 200m immediately after the 2m 0s.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: 5-minute Max
Description: This 5-minute Max workout is an intense, time-based barbell session focused on maximizing your total repetitions within 5 minutes. Designed to boost strength, endurance, and power, you'll perform as many reps as possible (AMRAP) of a specified barbell lift (such as deadlifts, cleans, or thrusters) using proper form and a challenging but manageable weight. Track your total reps to gauge progress and push your limits every session. This short, high-effort workout is ideal for improving work capacity in minimal time.
Flavor_Text: 5-minute Max – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For 5-minute Max: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Squat Cleans (30/22 kgs). 2m 0s Time Cap. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs). 5m 0s Time Cap. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs). 5m 0s Time Cap. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Squat Cleans (60/45 kgs). 5m 0s Time Cap. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: squat cleans (60/45 kgs). 5m 0s time cap.

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Strict Complex
Description:
**The Strict Complex (Gymnastics/Skill, EMOM 10) Description:**  
A structured skill-focused gymnastics workout performed Every Minute On the Minute for 10 minutes (EMOM 10). Each minute begins with a set of strict movement patterns, such as strict pull-ups, strict dips, or strict handstand push-ups. This workout enhances body control, strict strength, and gymnastic proficiency by emphasizing form and controlled movement without momentum. Suitable for all levels with movement scaling as needed.
Flavor_Text: The Strict Complex – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes: For The Strict Complex: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: 1 Strict Pull-ups + 1 Strict Toes-to-Bar. Even: 1 Strict Dips + 1 Strict Press (22/15 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: 3 Strict Pull-ups + 3 Strict Toes-to-Bar. Even: 3 Strict Dips + 3 Strict Press (45/30 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: 3 Strict Pull-ups + 3 Strict Toes-to-Bar. Even: 3 Strict Dips + 3 Strict Press (45/30 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: 3 Strict Pull-ups + 3 Strict Toes-to-Bar. Even: 3 Strict Dips + 3 Strict Press (45/30 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: 3 strict pull-ups + 3 strict toes-to-bar. even: 3 strict dips + 3 strict press (45/30 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: odd: 3 strict pull-ups + 3 strict toes-to-bar. even: 3 strict dips + 3 strict press (45/30 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Triple Double-under
Description:
**Workout Name:** Triple Double-under (Bodyweight/travel, For Time)

**Description:**  
This cardio-intensive workout challenges your coordination and stamina by focusing on double-unders (jump ropes where the rope passes under your feet twice per jump). Complete three rounds, each for time, with prescribed reps of double-unders. Travel-friendly and requiring only a jump rope, this workout boosts cardiovascular fitness, foot speed, and endurance—no equipment beyond a rope needed. Adjust reps or substitute with jumping jacks if needed.
Flavor_Text: Triple Double-under – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Burpee Pull-ups (or Burpees), 1x Double Unders (i.e., 22-18-13). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Burpee Pull-ups (or Burpees), 3x Double Unders (i.e., 45-36-27). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Burpee Pull-ups (or Burpees), 3x Double Unders (i.e., 45-36-27). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Burpee Pull-ups (or Burpees), 3x Double Unders (i.e., 45-36-27). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: burpee pull-ups (or burpees), 3x double unders (i.e., 45-36-27).
Instructions_Clean: burpee pull-ups (or burpees), 3x double unders (i.e., 45-36-27).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.
