**Workout Name:** Triple Double-under (Bodyweight/travel, For Time)

**Description:**  
This cardio-intensive workout challenges your coordination and stamina by focusing on double-unders (jump ropes where the rope passes under your feet twice per jump). Complete three rounds, each for time, with prescribed reps of double-unders. Travel-friendly and requiring only a jump rope, this workout boosts cardiovascular fitness, foot speed, and endurance—no equipment beyond a rope needed. Adjust reps or substitute with jumping jacks if needed.

Flavor_Text.from: Triple Double-Under - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: Triple Double-under – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.

Name: Weighted Carry Repeater
Description: The Weighted Carry Repeater is a full-body strength and endurance workout. Using a dumbbell or kettlebell, continuously perform weighted carries (such as farmer’s carry or suitcase carry) for as many rounds as possible in 18 minutes (AMRAP 18). This exercise challenges grip strength, core stability, posture, and cardiovascular fitness. Switch carry variations, hands, or directions as needed to balance muscle engagement and maintain form.
Flavor_Text: Weighted Carry Repeater – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes: For Weighted Carry Repeater: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 ft Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 25 ft Overhead Carry (Medium), 5 Push Press (22/15 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 ft Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 50 ft Overhead Carry (Medium), 10 Push Press (45/30 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 ft Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 50 ft Overhead Carry (Medium), 10 Push Press (45/30 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 ft Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 50 ft Overhead Carry (Medium), 10 Push Press (45/30 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 ft farmer's carry (heavy), 50 ft overhead carry (medium), 10 push press (45/30 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 50 ft farmer's carry (heavy), 50 ft overhead carry (medium), 10 push press (45/30 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Bike/run/row Pyramid
Description: This pyramid workout involves performing a single cardio modality (bike, run, or row) at increasing and then decreasing distances or times. Start with a short interval, increase the distance/time in set increments up to a peak, then descend back down. Aim to complete the full pyramid as quickly as possible, pushing your pace but maintaining good technique throughout. This format builds aerobic endurance, challenges pacing, and improves cardiovascular capacity. Suitable for all fitness levels with appropriate scaling.
Flavor_Text: Bike/run/row Pyramid – Simple on paper, brutal if you disrespect the distance.
CoachNotes: For Bike/run/row Pyramid: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Bike (Cals), Row (Cals), Ski (Cals). Complete one machine fully before moving to the next. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Bike (Cals), Row (Cals), Ski (Cals). Complete one machine fully before moving to the next. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Bike (Cals), Row (Cals), Ski (Cals). Complete one machine fully before moving to the next. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Bike (Cals), Row (Cals), Ski (Cals). Complete one machine fully before moving to the next. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: bike (cals), row (cals), ski (cals). complete one machine fully before moving to the next. for time
Instructions_Clean: bike (cals), row (cals), ski (cals). complete one machine fully before moving to the next. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Partner Clock
Description:
**Workout Name:** The Partner Clock (EMOM/Pacing, EMOM 20)

**Description:**  
The Partner Clock is a 20-minute EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) partner workout designed to improve pacing, teamwork, and endurance. Partners alternate minute by minute: while one completes a specific set of reps or movement (e.g., 10 burpees, 15 wall balls), the other rests. Each partner works every other minute, aiming to maintain consistent output. The goal is to complete the assigned work efficiently and recover actively during rest intervals, building both cardiovascular and muscular stamina. Collaboration and pacing strategy are key to maximize performance throughout all 20 rounds.
Flavor_Text: The Partner Clock – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes: For The Partner Clock: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Partner A completes 5 Burpees. Partner B holds a Deadlift (42/30 kgs). Switch roles at the top of the next minute. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Partner A completes 10 Burpees. Partner B holds a Deadlift (85/60 kgs). Switch roles at the top of the next minute. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Partner A completes 10 Burpees. Partner B holds a Deadlift (85/60 kgs). Switch roles at the top of the next minute. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Partner A completes 10 Burpees. Partner B holds a Deadlift (85/60 kgs). Switch roles at the top of the next minute. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: partner a completes 10 burpees. partner b holds a deadlift (85/60 kgs). switch roles at the top of the next minute.
Instructions_Clean: partner a completes 10 burpees. partner b holds a deadlift (85/60 kgs). switch roles at the top of the next minute.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Strict Chipper
Description:
**Strict Chipper (Gymnastics/Skill, For Time) Description:**  
A strict chipper is a challenging workout where athletes complete a sequence of gymnastics or skill-based movements without any kipping, finishing each exercise before moving to the next. The goal is to complete the entire list “for time,” emphasizing strict form and muscle control. This workout tests upper-body strength, endurance, and technique through various strict movements like pull-ups, handstand push-ups, or dips.
Flavor_Text: Strict Chipper – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Strict Chipper: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 12 Strict Pull-ups, 25 Strict Push-ups, 37 Strict Sit-ups, 50 Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 25 Strict Pull-ups, 50 Strict Push-ups, 75 Strict Sit-ups, 100 Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 25 Strict Pull-ups, 50 Strict Push-ups, 75 Strict Sit-ups, 100 Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 25 Strict Pull-ups, 50 Strict Push-ups, 75 Strict Sit-ups, 100 Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 25 strict pull-ups, 50 strict push-ups, 75 strict sit-ups, 100 air squats.
Instructions_Clean: 25 strict pull-ups, 50 strict push-ups, 75 strict sit-ups, 100 air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: The Omega
Description:
**The Omega (Grind/Endurance, For Time):**  
The Omega is a challenging, high-volume endurance workout designed to test your physical and mental limits. This “for time” grinder demands sustained effort through a sequence of diverse movements, pushing your cardiovascular fitness, muscular endurance, and grit. The mission: complete all prescribed rounds or repetitions as quickly as possible, maintaining steady pacing and efficient technique throughout. Ideal for athletes seeking to build resilience, stamina, and embrace the grind.
Flavor_Text: The Omega – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For The Omega: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Rounds of: 5 Clean & Jerks (35/25 kgs), 10 Bar Muscle-Ups (or 15 C1B), 15 Alternating Pistol Squats. THEN: 1 Mile Run (with 10/3.2 kg Vest optional). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Rounds of: 10 Clean & Jerks (70/50 kgs), 20 Bar Muscle-Ups (or 30 C2B), 30 Alternating Pistol Squats. THEN: 1 Mile Run (with 20/6.4 kg Vest optional). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Rounds of: 10 Clean & Jerks (70/50 kgs), 20 Bar Muscle-Ups (or 30 C2B), 30 Alternating Pistol Squats. THEN: 1 Mile Run (with 20/6.4 kg Vest optional). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Rounds of: 10 Clean & Jerks (70/50 kgs), 20 Bar Muscle-Ups (or 30 C2B), 30 Alternating Pistol Squats. THEN: 1 Mile Run (with 20/6.4 kg Vest optional). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 rounds of: 10 clean & jerks (70/50 kgs), 20 bar muscle-ups (or 30 c2b), 30 alternating pistol squats. then: 1 mile run (with 20/6.4 kg vest optional).
Instructions_Clean: 5 rounds of: 10 clean & jerks (70/50 kgs), 20 bar muscle-ups (or 30 c2b), 30 alternating pistol squats. then: 1 mile run (with 20/6.4 kg vest optional).
TrainingGoals: Maximal Strength Endurance, High-Skill Volume, Mental Toughness
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Aerobic Beast
Description: The Aerobic Beast is a high-intensity, monostructural cardio workout performed for time. Designed to maximize cardiovascular endurance, it incorporates repetitive, rhythmic movements such as running, rowing, cycling, or jump rope. Athletes complete a specific distance or calorie goal as quickly as possible, challenging their aerobic capacity, stamina, and pacing strategies for improved overall conditioning.
Flavor_Text: The Aerobic Beast – Build aerobic grit with honest pacing and controlled breathing.
CoachNotes: For The Aerobic Beast: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 500m Row, 25 Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1000m Row, 50 Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1000m Row, 50 Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1000m Row, 50 Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1000m row, 50 air squats.
Instructions_Clean: 1000m row, 50 air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Long Cycle Grind
Description: The Long Cycle Grind is an endurance-focused workout performed as an AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) within 25 minutes. This session combines full-body movements—often including kettlebell clean and jerks or other compound exercises—targeting strength, cardiovascular capacity, and muscular endurance. Participants aim to maintain a steady, sustainable pace, emphasizing consistent technique and controlled breathing throughout the duration. Suitable for intermediate and advanced athletes seeking to improve work capacity and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Long Cycle Grind – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes: For Long Cycle Grind: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Burpee Box Jump Overs, 7 Wall Balls (10/3.2 kgs), 10 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Burpee Box Jump Overs, 15 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs), 20 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Burpee Box Jump Overs, 15 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs), 20 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Burpee Box Jump Overs, 15 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs), 20 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 burpee box jump overs, 15 wall balls (20/6.4 kgs), 20 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
Instructions_Clean: 10 burpee box jump overs, 15 wall balls (20/6.4 kgs), 20 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Bike/run Pyramid
Description: The Bike/Run Pyramid is a monostructural cardio workout structured in pyramid fashion. Participants alternate between biking and running for increasing and then decreasing intervals or distances. The goal is to complete each segment for time, building cardiovascular endurance, speed, and stamina. This workout challenges aerobic capacity and pacing strategy while providing an efficient full-body cardio session.
Flavor_Text: Bike/run Pyramid – Long, steady output; aim for a rhythm you could explain, not survive.
CoachNotes: For Bike/run Pyramid: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Calorie Bike, 100m Run; 10 Calorie Bike, 200m Run; 15 Calorie Bike, 300m Run. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Calorie Bike, 200m Run; 20 Calorie Bike, 400m Run; 30 Calorie Bike, 600m Run. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Calorie Bike, 200m Run; 20 Calorie Bike, 400m Run; 30 Calorie Bike, 600m Run. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Calorie Bike, 200m Run; 20 Calorie Bike, 400m Run; 30 Calorie Bike, 600m Run. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 calorie bike, 200m run; 20 calorie bike, 400m run; 30 calorie bike, 600m run.
Instructions_Clean: 10 calorie bike, 200m run; 20 calorie bike, 400m run; 30 calorie bike, 600m run.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The 10K Row Prep
Description: Prepare for a 10K rowing event with a focused interval workout targeting cardio endurance and rowing efficiency. This session involves 5 high-intensity rounds on the rower, alternating effort and rest to simulate race demands, build pace consistency, and improve overall stamina for longer distances. Suitable for all levels, the workout balances challenging work intervals with recovery periods to optimize cardiovascular conditioning and rowing technique.
Flavor_Text: The 10K Row Prep – A well-rounded test of fitness that punishes sloppiness, not just slowness.
CoachNotes: For The 10K Row Prep: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1000m Row. Rest 1:1 (rest duration equals your row time). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 2000m Row. Rest 1:1 (rest duration equals your row time). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 2000m Row. Rest 1:1 (rest duration equals your row time). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 2000m Row. Rest 1:1 (rest duration equals your row time). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 2000m row. rest 1:1 (rest duration equals your row time).
Instructions_Clean: 2000m row. rest 1:1 (rest duration equals your row time).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Burpee Tax Chipper
Description: The Burpee Tax Chipper is a challenging grind/endurance workout performed for time. Athletes move through a series of movements or exercises (the "chipper"), but each time they transition to a new exercise, they must first complete a set number of burpees—the “burpee tax.” This format tests aerobic capacity, muscular endurance, and mental tenacity as the burpees add cumulative fatigue, making each subsequent exercise more demanding. The goal is to complete the full sequence as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: Burpee Tax Chipper – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Burpee Tax Chipper: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 75 Push Press (37/12.4 kgs). Every 15 reps, stop and perform 7 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 150 Push Press (75/24.9 kgs). Every 30 reps, stop and perform 15 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 150 Push Press (75/24.9 kgs). Every 30 reps, stop and perform 15 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 150 Push Press (75/24.9 kgs). Every 30 reps, stop and perform 15 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 150 push press (75/24.9 kgs). every 30 reps, stop and perform 15 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 150 push press (75/24.9 kgs). every 30 repetitions, stop and perform 15 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
**Description:**  
The Burpee Tax Chipper is a challenging grind/endurance workout performed for time. Athletes move through a series of movements or exercises (the "chipper"), but each time they transition to a new exercise, they must first complete a set number of burpees—the “burpee tax.” This format tests aerobic capacity, muscular endurance, and mental tenacity as the burpees add cumulative fatigue, making each subsequent exercise more demanding. The goal is to complete the full sequence as quickly as possible.
Description.to: The Burpee Tax Chipper is a challenging grind/endurance workout performed for time. Athletes move through a series of movements or exercises (the "chipper"), but each time they transition to a new exercise, they must first complete a set number of burpees—the “burpee tax.” This format tests aerobic capacity, muscular endurance, and mental tenacity as the burpees add cumulative fatigue, making each subsequent exercise more demanding. The goal is to complete the full sequence as quickly as possible.

Flavor_Text.from: Burpee Tax Chipper - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Burpee Tax Chipper – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.

Name: Running EMOM Flow
Description: The Running EMOM Flow is a structured 30-minute interval workout that blends aerobic endurance with pacing discipline. Every minute on the minute (EMOM), you'll complete a set running distance or time at a prescribed intensity, then use any remaining time in that minute to rest. This format challenges your cardiovascular capacity, encourages consistent pacing, and sharpens focus. Ideal for building speed endurance and mental resilience while avoiding overexertion early in longer runs. Suitable for all fitness levels with scalable intensity.
Flavor_Text: Running EMOM Flow – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes: For Running EMOM Flow: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Min 1: 150m Run. Min 1: 10 Air Squats + 5 Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Min 1: 300m Run. Min 2: 20 Air Squats + 10 Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Min 1: 300m Run. Min 2: 20 Air Squats + 10 Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Min 1: 300m Run. Min 2: 20 Air Squats + 10 Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: min 1: 300m run. min 2: 20 air squats + 10 push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: min 1: 300m run. min 2: 20 air squats + 10 push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Double Under Stamina
Description: Double Under Stamina is a grind/endurance workout designed to test and improve your cardiovascular capacity and coordination. Athletes perform double unders—skipping rope where the rope passes under the feet twice per jump—over high volume or for a set time, aiming for maximum repetitions or a specified distance. This high-intensity workout builds aerobic endurance, quick-twitch responsiveness, and overall stamina. Suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes, focus on steady pacing and efficient jump rope technique to achieve your best time.
Flavor_Text: Double Under Stamina – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Double Under Stamina: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Burpees, 37 Double Unders. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Burpees, 75 Double Unders. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Burpees, 75 Double Unders. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Burpees, 75 Double Unders. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 burpees, 75 double unders.
Instructions_Clean: 15 burpees, 75 double unders.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Ski Erg / Clean
Description:
**Workout Name:** Ski Erg / Clean (Monostructural/Cardio, For Time)

**Description:**  
This intense, full-body workout combines high-rep Ski Erg intervals with barbell cleans for time. Athletes alternate between bursts on the Ski Erg—targeting aerobic endurance and upper body stamina—and powerful clean lifts, which build explosive strength in the posterior chain, core, and shoulders. Designed to challenge cardiovascular capacity and muscular endurance, this workout is ideal for improving conditioning, coordination, and strength under fatigue. Push for a fast finish time while maintaining strong, consistent form throughout each movement.
Flavor_Text: Ski Erg / Clean – Long, steady output; aim for a rhythm you could explain, not survive.
CoachNotes: For Ski Erg / Clean: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 6/4 Calorie Ski Erg, 4 Power Cleans (67/21.1 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 12/9 Calorie Ski Erg, 8 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 12/9 Calorie Ski Erg, 8 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 12/9 Calorie Ski Erg, 8 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 12/9 calorie ski erg, 8 power cleans (135/43.1 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 12/9 calorie ski erg, 8 power cleans (135/43.1 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: High Rep Thruster
Description: A high rep thruster workout combines front squats with overhead presses, performed repeatedly for a set number of reps or total time. This grind/endurance workout challenges muscular stamina and cardiovascular capacity, requiring you to maintain intensity and good form even under fatigue. Typically performed for time, it’s designed to improve total-body endurance, strength, and mental toughness. Key focus: continuous movement, efficient breathing, and pacing to complete all reps as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: High Rep Thruster – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For High Rep Thruster: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Thrusters (32/10.2 kgs). Every break, perform 2 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Thrusters (65/20.4 kgs). Every break, perform 5 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Thrusters (65/20.4 kgs). Every break, perform 5 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Thrusters (65/20.4 kgs). Every break, perform 5 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 thrusters (65/20.4 kgs). every break, perform 5 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 100 thrusters (65/20.4 kgs). every break, perform 5 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: The Marathon Man
Description: The Marathon Man is a monostructural cardio workout focused on endurance, stamina, and mental resilience. Designed as a "for time" challenge, participants complete a long-distance run, row, or bike at a steady, sustained pace. This workout tests cardiovascular capacity, pacing strategy, and the ability to push through prolonged discomfort, making it ideal for building aerobic fitness and preparing for endurance events. Suitable for all fitness levels with scalable distance options.
Flavor_Text: The Marathon Man – Build aerobic grit with honest pacing and controlled breathing.
CoachNotes: For The Marathon Man: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2500m Run (or 5,1m Bike). Every 5m 0s, stop and do 10 AbMat Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5000m Run (or 10,000m Bike). Every 10m 0s, stop and do 20 AbMat Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5000m Run (or 10,000m Bike). Every 10m 0s, stop and do 20 AbMat Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5000m Run (or 10,000m Bike). Every 10m 0s, stop and do 20 AbMat Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5000m run (or 10,000m bike). every 10m 0s, stop and do 20 abmat sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 5000m run (or 10,000m bike). every 10m 0s, stop and do 20 abmat sit-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Strongman Medley
Description: The Strongman Medley combines multiple barbell and weightlifting movements performed consecutively for time. Athletes cycle through different lifts—such as deadlifts, cleans, and carries—using moderate to heavy weights. This workout challenges total-body strength, cardiovascular endurance, and grip, demanding explosive power and efficient transitions between implements. It’s an ideal format for testing functional fitness and mental toughness in both competitive and training environments.
Flavor_Text: Strongman Medley – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Strongman Medley: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 ft Yoke Carry (Heavy), 5 Barbell Squat Cleans (92/30.1 kgs), 25 ft Sled Pull (Heavy). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 ft Yoke Carry (Heavy), 10 Barbell Squat Cleans (185/61.2 kgs), 50 ft Sled Pull (Heavy). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 ft Yoke Carry (Heavy), 10 Barbell Squat Cleans (185/61.2 kgs), 50 ft Sled Pull (Heavy). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 ft Yoke Carry (Heavy), 10 Barbell Squat Cleans (185/61.2 kgs), 50 ft Sled Pull (Heavy). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 ft yoke carry (heavy), 10 barbell squat cleans (185/61.2 kgs), 50 ft sled pull (heavy).
Instructions_Clean: 50 ft yoke carry (heavy), 10 barbell squat cleans (185/61.2 kgs), 50 ft sled pull (heavy).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Ring Complex
Description: The Ring Complex is a gymnastics skill workout performed on gymnastic rings. During a 12-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible), athletes cycle through challenging ring movements—such as ring rows, dips, muscle-ups, or holds—focusing on strength, technique, and control. The goal is to complete as many quality rounds and repetitions as possible, emphasizing proper form and skill progression on the rings throughout the duration.
Flavor_Text: Ring Complex – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes: For Ring Complex: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Ring Muscle-Ups, 5 Strict Ring Dips, 7 GHD Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Ring Muscle-Ups, 10 Strict Ring Dips, 15 GHD Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Ring Muscle-Ups, 10 Strict Ring Dips, 15 GHD Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Ring Muscle-Ups, 10 Strict Ring Dips, 15 GHD Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 ring muscle-ups, 10 strict ring dips, 15 ghd sit-ups. for time
Instructions_Clean: 5 ring muscle-ups, 10 strict ring dips, 15 ghd sit-ups. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Sandbag Carry Relay
Description: The Sandbag Carry Relay (or Dumbbell/Kettlebell Carry) is a full-body strength and conditioning workout performed in an Every Minute On the Minute (EMOM) format for 15 minutes. Athletes carry a sandbag, dumbbell, or kettlebell over a set distance or for a prescribed time each minute, resting for the remainder of the minute. This exercise targets grip strength, core stability, and overall muscular endurance while elevating the heart rate for an effective metabolic challenge.
Flavor_Text: Sandbag Carry Relay – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes: For Sandbag Carry Relay: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: 50 ft Sandbag Shoulder Carry (Heavy). Even: 7 Burpees over Sandbag. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: 100 ft Sandbag Shoulder Carry (Heavy). Even: 15 Burpees over Sandbag. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: 100 ft Sandbag Shoulder Carry (Heavy). Even: 15 Burpees over Sandbag. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: 100 ft Sandbag Shoulder Carry (Heavy). Even: 15 Burpees over Sandbag. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: 100 ft sandbag shoulder carry (heavy). even: 15 burpees over sandbag.
Instructions_Clean: odd: 100 ft sandbag shoulder carry (heavy). even: 15 burpees over sandbag.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Pegboard & Thruster
Description: This workout combines pegboard climbing, a demanding gymnastics skill that challenges upper body and core strength, with thrusters, a dynamic compound movement that targets legs, shoulders, and cardiovascular endurance. Athletes alternate between scaling the pegboard and performing thrusters, working for time to complete all rounds. This pairing develops functional fitness, grip and pulling strength, coordination, stamina, and mental toughness. Suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes familiar with pegboard techniques and proper thruster form.
Flavor_Text: Pegboard & Thruster – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Pegboard & Thruster: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Pegboard Ascent (or 1 Legless Rope Climbs), 5 Thrusters (47/14.2 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1 Pegboard Ascent (or 2 Legless Rope Climbs), 10 Thrusters (95/29.5 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1 Pegboard Ascent (or 2 Legless Rope Climbs), 10 Thrusters (95/29.5 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1 Pegboard Ascent (or 2 Legless Rope Climbs), 10 Thrusters (95/29.5 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1 pegboard ascent (or 2 legless rope climbs), 10 thrusters (95/29.5 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 1 pegboard ascent (or 2 legless rope climbs), 10 thrusters (95/29.5 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Heavy Sled & Row
Description: The Heavy Sled & Row workout combines powerful sled pushes or pulls with intense rowing intervals. This full-body, monostructural cardio session builds explosive strength, stamina, and cardiovascular endurance, challenging both your muscles and aerobic system for time. Perfect for developing athletic power and grit.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Sled & Row – Let patience do the work; speed only matters once you’re halfway in.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Sled & Row: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7/6 Calorie Row (Max Sprint), 50 ft Sled Push (Heavy). Rest 1m 0s between rounds. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15/12 Calorie Row (Max Sprint), 100 ft Sled Push (Heavy). Rest 1m 0s between rounds. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15/12 Calorie Row (Max Sprint), 100 ft Sled Push (Heavy). Rest 1m 0s between rounds. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15/12 Calorie Row (Max Sprint), 100 ft Sled Push (Heavy). Rest 1m 0s between rounds. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15/12 calorie row (max sprint), 100 ft sled push (heavy). rest 1m 0s between rounds.
Instructions_Clean: 15/12 calorie row (max sprint), 100 ft sled push (heavy). rest 1m 0s between rounds.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
Description:  
The Heavy Sled & Row workout combines powerful sled pushes or pulls with intense rowing intervals. This full-body, monostructural cardio session builds explosive strength, stamina, and cardiovascular endurance, challenging both your muscles and aerobic system for time. Perfect for developing athletic power and grit.
Description.to: The Heavy Sled & Row workout combines powerful sled pushes or pulls with intense rowing intervals. This full-body, monostructural cardio session builds explosive strength, stamina, and cardiovascular endurance, challenging both your muscles and aerobic system for time. Perfect for developing athletic power and grit.

Flavor_Text.from: Heavy Sled & Row - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: Heavy Sled & Row – Let patience do the work; speed only matters once you’re halfway in.

Name: Bodyweight Max Hold
Description: The Bodyweight Max Hold workout is designed to test and build isometric strength using only your body weight—ideal for travel or limited spaces. During this EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) session, you’ll perform a maximal-duration hold (such as a plank, wall sit, or hollow body hold) at the start of each minute, then rest for the remainder. Repeat for 10 minutes. This format boosts muscular endurance, core stability, and mental toughness without equipment.
Flavor_Text: Bodyweight Max Hold – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold on parallettes/bench. Even: Max Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold on parallettes/bench. Even: Max Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold on parallettes/bench. Even: Max Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: Max L-Sit Hold on parallettes/bench. Even: Max Plank Hold (weighted optional). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: max l-sit hold on parallettes/bench. even: max plank hold (weighted optional). for time
Instructions_Clean: odd: max l-sit hold on parallettes/bench. even: max plank hold (weighted optional). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Barbell & DU Penalty
Description: "Barbell & DU Penalty" is a 14-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout that combines barbell movements with a double under (DU) penalty. Athletes cycle through a set sequence of barbell exercises, aiming for maximum rounds and reps in 14 minutes. Each time double unders are missed or failed (penalty), additional reps or a brief exercise may be required before continuing. This workout challenges endurance, coordination, and stamina, encouraging athletes to push intensity while maintaining skill under fatigue. Ideal for high-intensity training and improving both barbell proficiency and jump rope skills.
Flavor_Text: Barbell & DU Penalty – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes: For Barbell & DU Penalty: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 4 Power Cleans (67/21.1 kgs), 8 Box Jump Overs. If you trip the box, perform 25 Double Unders immediately. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 8 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs), 16 Box Jump Overs. If you trip the box, perform 50 Double Unders immediately. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 8 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs), 16 Box Jump Overs. If you trip the box, perform 50 Double Unders immediately. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 8 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs), 16 Box Jump Overs. If you trip the box, perform 50 Double Unders immediately. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 8 power cleans (135/43.1 kgs), 16 box jump overs. if you trip the box, perform 50 double unders immediately.
Instructions_Clean: 8 power cleans (135/43.1 kgs), 16 box jump overs. if you trip the box, perform 50 double unders immediately.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Running & Overhead
Description: This workout combines running intervals with overhead strength movements in a grind/endurance format, performed for time. Athletes alternate between running segments and overhead lifts (such as barbell, dumbbell, or kettlebell presses). The goal is to maintain pace and steady effort throughout, challenging cardiovascular conditioning, muscular endurance, and mental resilience. Suitable for all fitness levels with modification options.
Flavor_Text: Running & Overhead – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Running & Overhead: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 300m Run, 10 Overhead Squats (47/14.2 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 600m Run, 20 Overhead Squats (95/29.5 kgs), 20 Toes-to-Bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 600m Run, 20 Overhead Squats (95/29.5 kgs), 20 Toes-to-Bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 600m Run, 20 Overhead Squats (95/29.5 kgs), 20 Toes-to-Bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 600m run, 20 overhead squats (95/29.5 kgs), 20 toes-to-bar.
Instructions_Clean: 600m run, 20 overhead squats (95/29.5 kgs), 20 toes-to-bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Iron Cross
Description: The Iron Cross is a demanding weightlifting workout performed for time. Using a barbell, athletes execute a strict series of wide-grip movements, typically involving holding or lowering the bar to chest or hip height while arms remain fully extended, mimicking the "iron cross" gymnastics position. This workout tests upper body strength, shoulder stability, grip, and muscular endurance. The objective is to complete a set number of reps as quickly as possible, maintaining proper form throughout.
Flavor_Text: The Iron Cross – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For The Iron Cross: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Deadlifts (137/41.4 kgs), 2 Strict Press (57/17.1 kgs), 2 Strict Pull-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs), 5 Strict Press (115/34.0 kgs), 5 Strict Pull-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs), 5 Strict Press (115/34.0 kgs), 5 Strict Pull-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs), 5 Strict Press (115/34.0 kgs), 5 Strict Pull-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs), 5 strict press (115/34.0 kgs), 5 strict pull-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 5 deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs), 5 strict press (115/34.0 kgs), 5 strict pull-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Heavy D-ball Over
Description: The Heavy D-ball Over workout is a high-intensity strength and conditioning exercise where athletes lift a heavy D-ball (or substitute with a dumbbell/kettlebell) from the ground and hoist it over an obstacle (such as a shoulder or a barrier) for a set number of repetitions, aiming to complete the task as quickly as possible. This movement challenges full-body power, grip strength, and explosive hip drive, making it ideal for developing total-body functional strength and boosting cardiovascular endurance.
Flavor_Text: Heavy D-ball Over – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Heavy D-ball Over: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 15 Dumbbell/D-Ball Over Shoulder (Heavy/Odd). Every 2 reps, perform 2 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 30 Dumbbell/D-Ball Over Shoulder (Heavy/Odd). Every 5 reps, perform 5 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 30 Dumbbell/D-Ball Over Shoulder (Heavy/Odd). Every 5 reps, perform 5 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 30 Dumbbell/D-Ball Over Shoulder (Heavy/Odd). Every 5 reps, perform 5 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 30 dumbbell/d-ball over shoulder (heavy/odd). every 5 reps, perform 5 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 30 dumbbell/d-ball over shoulder (heavy/odd). every 5 repetitions, perform 5 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Skill: 50 T2B
Description: Complete 50 Toes-to-Bar (T2B) reps as fast as possible. Focus on controlled, rhythmic kipping or strict movement—raising both feet to touch the bar between your hands each rep. Maintain grip strength, core stability, and consistent breathing throughout. This workout builds gymnastic skill, grip endurance, and core strength.
Flavor_Text: Skill: 50 T2B – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Skill: 50 T2B: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 Toes-to-Bar. Every minute on the minute, perform 1 Ring Dips. (Starts with Dips at 1:1). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 Toes-to-Bar. Every minute on the minute, perform 3 Ring Dips. (Starts with Dips at 0m 0s). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 Toes-to-Bar. Every minute on the minute, perform 3 Ring Dips. (Starts with Dips at 0m 0s). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 Toes-to-Bar. Every minute on the minute, perform 3 Ring Dips. (Starts with Dips at 0m 0s). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 toes-to-bar. every minute on the minute, perform 3 ring dips. (starts with dips at 0m 0s). for time
Instructions_Clean: 50 toes-to-bar. every minute on the minute, perform 3 ring dips. (starts with dips at 0m 0s). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Aerobic Chipper
Description: The Aerobic Chipper is a grind-style, endurance workout completed 'for time.' Athletes work through a long list of varied movements with high repetitions, aiming to finish the entire sequence as quickly as possible without sacrificing form. This workout taxes overall cardiovascular capacity and muscular stamina, encouraging steady pacing and mental grit. It’s ideal for building aerobic endurance, improving work capacity, and challenging both body and mind through sustained effort.
Flavor_Text: The Aerobic Chipper – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For The Aerobic Chipper: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Calorie Row, 75 Burpees, 50 Strict Press (65/20.4 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Calorie Row, 75 Burpees, 50 Strict Press (65/20.4 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Calorie Row, 75 Burpees, 50 Strict Press (65/20.4 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Name: Interval Stamina
Description: This interval stamina workout focuses on building cardiovascular endurance using a single modality, such as running, rowing, cycling, or swimming. Athletes alternate between periods of high-intensity effort and recovery, aiming to complete a set distance or total duration as quickly as possible. The session challenges aerobic capacity, pacing strategies, and mental toughness. Ideal for improving overall cardio fitness and stamina.
Flavor_Text: Interval Stamina – Build aerobic grit with honest pacing and controlled breathing.
CoachNotes: For Interval Stamina: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 12 GHD Sit-ups, 250m Run, 12 Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 25 GHD Sit-ups, 500m Run, 25 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 25 GHD Sit-ups, 500m Run, 25 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 25 GHD Sit-ups, 500m Run, 25 Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

EquipmentNeeded: GHD Machine (or AbMat), Running Space, KB
Instructions: 25 ghd sit-ups, 500m run, 25 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
Instructions_Clean: 25 ghd sit-ups, 500m run, 25 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Bike/wall Ball Duet
Description: This Bike/Wall Ball Duet AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) is a partner interval workout lasting 22 minutes. While one partner performs max-effort calories on an air bike, the other completes wall ball shots (a squat and toss movement using a medicine ball against a wall). Partners switch after each interval, continuously alternating for the full 22 minutes. The goal is to accumulate the highest combined totals of bike calories and wall ball reps, challenging both cardio capacity and full-body strength. This workout builds endurance, coordination, and teamwork.
Flavor_Text: Bike/wall Ball Duet – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes: For Bike/wall Ball Duet: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Wall Balls (10/3.2 kgs), 7/6 Calorie Bike, 7 Box Jumps (10 in). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs), 15/12 Calorie Bike, 15 Box Jumps (20 in). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs), 15/12 Calorie Bike, 15 Box Jumps (20 in). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs), 15/12 Calorie Bike, 15 Box Jumps (20 in). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 wall balls (20/6.4 kgs), 15/12 calorie bike, 15 box jumps (20 in).
Instructions_Clean: 15 wall balls (20/6.4 kgs), 15/12 calorie bike, 15 box jumps (20 in).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Power Endurance AMRAP
Description: Power Endurance AMRAP is an 18-minute, as-many-rounds-as-possible workout designed to enhance muscular stamina and explosive performance. Athletes cycle through a series of high-intensity, compound movements with minimal rest, emphasizing repeated power output and efficient pacing. Name: High Rep Thruster II
Description: High Rep Thruster II is a full-body, grind/endurance workout performed for time. This workout combines front squats and overhead presses into one dynamic movement—known as the thruster—challenging both muscular strength and cardiovascular stamina. Athletes complete a large volume of reps as quickly as possible, demanding efficient pacing, consistent technique, and mental toughness to maintain effort through fatigue. Thrusters build powerful legs, strong shoulders, and a resilient core while boosting overall endurance.
Flavor_Text: High Rep Thruster II – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For High Rep Thruster II: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 Double Unders, 12 Thrusters (37/12.4 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 Double Unders, 25 Thrusters (75/24.9 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 Double Unders, 25 Thrusters (75/24.9 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 Double Unders, 25 Thrusters (75/24.9 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 double unders, 25 thrusters (75/24.9 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 50 double unders, 25 thrusters (75/24.9 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Rowing EMOM Cycle
Description: Rowing EMOM Cycle is a 24-minute Every Minute On the Minute (EMOM) workout focused on building aerobic capacity, pacing, and rowing efficiency. Each minute, athletes aim to complete a set distance or calorie target on the rower, then use any remaining time in the minute to recover before the next interval begins. This format encourages consistent effort and improves endurance, making it suitable for athletes of varying abilities. Adjust intensity as needed to maintain proper pacing throughout all 24 rounds.
Flavor_Text: Rowing EMOM Cycle – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes: For Rowing EMOM Cycle: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: 125m Row (for pace). Even: 5 Burpees over Rower. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: 250m Row (for pace). Even: 10 Burpees over Rower. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: 250m Row (for pace). Even: 10 Burpees over Rower. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: 250m Row (for pace). Even: 10 Burpees over Rower. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: 250m row (for pace). even: 10 burpees over rower.
Instructions_Clean: odd: 250m row (for pace). even: 10 burpees over rower.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Bodyweight Endurance
Description: Bodyweight Endurance (Bodyweight/travel, For Time) is a high-intensity, equipment-free workout designed to improve muscular stamina and cardiovascular fitness. This session uses functional bodyweight movements—such as squats, push-ups, lunges, and burpees—performed at high repetitions or for maximum rounds within a set time. Ideal for travel or limited spaces, this workout builds endurance, burns calories, and enhances overall athletic performance using only your own bodyweight.
Flavor_Text: Bodyweight Endurance – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: Move continuously; avoid red-lining; break push-ups early.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Dumbbell Engine Cycle
Description: The Dumbbell Engine Cycle is a high-intensity, full-body workout performed for time using a dumbbell or kettlebell. This workout typically combines functional movements such as cleans, snatches, push presses, or goblet squats in cyclical patterns, challenging strength, power, and endurance. Moving quickly through each round, athletes aim to complete all prescribed repetitions and cycles as fast as possible, focusing on both speed and maintaining proper form. Great for conditioning, fat loss, and building muscular stamina.
Flavor_Text: Dumbbell Engine Cycle – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Dumbbell Engine Cycle: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs), 400m Run. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs), 400m Run. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Name: Heavy Hold Penalty
Description: Heavy Hold Penalty is a grind/endurance workout designed to test your strength, grit, and stamina. Athletes perform a designated movement or circuit “for time,” incorporating loaded holds (e.g., farmer’s carry, sandbag, or dumbbell holds) as penalties for rest or breaks. The aim is to complete all reps as fast as possible while minimizing breaks, as each pause incurs a challenging static hold. This workout builds physical and mental endurance, forearm and grip strength, and rewards effective pacing and tenacity.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Hold Penalty – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Hold Penalty: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Deadlifts (112/35.1 kgs). After each set, hold a Heavy Kettlebell/Dumbbell Farmer's Carry for 1m 0s (static hold or walk). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs). After each set, hold a Heavy Kettlebell/Dumbbell Farmer's Carry for 1m 0s (static hold or walk). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs). After each set, hold a Heavy Kettlebell/Dumbbell Farmer's Carry for 1m 0s (static hold or walk). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs). After each set, hold a Heavy Kettlebell/Dumbbell Farmer's Carry for 1m 0s (static hold or walk). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs). after each set, hold a heavy kettlebell/dumbbell farmer's carry for 1m 0s (static hold or walk). for time
Instructions_Clean: 15 deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs). after each set, hold a heavy kettlebell/dumbbell farmer's carry for 1m 0s (static hold or walk). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Hyrox Half
Description: The Hyrox Half (Grind/Endurance, For Time) is a challenging functional fitness workout designed to test and develop both cardiovascular and muscular endurance. Inspired by the official HYROX competition, this version features a series of running intervals broken up by functional workout stations, such as sled pushes, rowing, ski-erg, and bodyweight movements. The goal is to complete all prescribed work as quickly as possible, emphasizing consistent pacing, efficient transitions, and sustained effort throughout. This workout is suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes aiming to build holistic endurance and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Hyrox Half – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Hyrox Half: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 500m Ski Erg, 25m Sled Push (Heavy), 400m Run, 500m Row, 50m Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 15 Wall Balls. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 500m Ski Erg, 25m Sled Push (Heavy), 400m Run, 500m Row, 50m Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 15 Wall Balls. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 500m Ski Erg, 25m Sled Push (Heavy), 400m Run, 500m Row, 50m Farmer's Carry (Heavy), 15 Wall Balls. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

EquipmentNeeded: Ski Erg, Sled, KB/DBs, Wall Ball

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Burpee Tax
Description: The Burpee Tax is a high-intensity cardio workout performed for time, designed to challenge your endurance and metabolic conditioning. This workout involves completing a prescribed number of burpees as quickly as possible, emphasizing both speed and proper form. It's a total-body exercise that elevates heart rate, improves cardiovascular fitness, and builds muscular stamina. Ideal for athletes seeking a quick, effective conditioning session with minimal equipment.
Flavor_Text: The Burpee Tax – Long, steady output; aim for a rhythm you could explain, not survive.
CoachNotes: For The Burpee Tax: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Name: Sled Double
Description: The Sled Double workout focuses on grind and endurance, challenging athletes to push a weighted sled for a set distance or repetitions as quickly as possible. This workout builds lower body strength, power, and aerobic capacity while promoting mental toughness. The continuous nature of the sled work increases muscular endurance and improves work capacity under fatigue. Suitable for all fitness levels by adjusting sled weight.
Flavor_Text: Sled Double – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Sled Double: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.

Name: Engine & Core
Description: This Engine & Core workout features monostructural cardio movements—such as rowing, running, or cycling—paired with focused core exercises in an AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) format for 25 minutes. The session emphasizes sustained aerobic effort to build endurance ("engine") while incorporating ab-centric movements to strengthen and stabilize your core. This combination enhances cardiovascular conditioning, core strength, and overall work capacity. Repeat the sequence aiming for maximum rounds within the time cap, maintaining quality movement and consistent pace.
Flavor_Text: Engine & Core – Simple on paper, brutal if you disrespect the distance.
CoachNotes: For Engine & Core: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.

This combination enhances cardiovascular conditioning, core strength, and overall work capacity. Repeat the sequence aiming for maximum rounds within the time cap, maintaining quality movement and consistent pace.
Description.to: This Engine & Core workout features monostructural cardio movements—such as rowing, running, or cycling—paired with focused core exercises in an AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) format for 25 minutes. The session emphasizes sustained aerobic effort to build endurance ("engine") while incorporating ab-centric movements to strengthen and stabilize your core. This combination enhances cardiovascular conditioning, core strength, and overall work capacity. Repeat the sequence aiming for maximum rounds within the time cap, maintaining quality movement and consistent pace.

Flavor_Text.from: Engine & Core - A aerobic/mixed (long amrap) challenge that demands focus and grit.
Flavor_Text.to: Engine & Core – Simple on paper, brutal if you disrespect the distance.

Name: The Wall Ball Killer
Description: The Wall Ball Killer is a high-intensity, grind-style endurance workout performed for time. Athletes complete multiple rounds of wall ball shots combined with additional complementary movements, challenging both muscular stamina and cardiovascular capacity. The workout tests mental toughness and full-body coordination, as participants aim to finish all prescribed reps as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form under fatigue. Ideal for developing explosive power, core stability, and aerobic endurance.
Flavor_Text: The Wall Ball Killer – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For The Wall Ball Killer: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Wall Balls (10/3.2 kgs). Every minute on the minute, perform 5 Calorie Row. (Starts with Row at 1:1). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs). Every minute on the minute, perform 10 Calorie Row. (Starts with Row at 0m 0s). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs). Every minute on the minute, perform 10 Calorie Row. (Starts with Row at 0m 0s). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs). Every minute on the minute, perform 10 Calorie Row. (Starts with Row at 0m 0s). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 wall balls (20/6.4 kgs). every minute on the minute, perform 10 calorie row. (starts with row at 0m 0s).
Instructions_Clean: 100 wall balls (20/6.4 kgs). every minute on the minute, perform 10 calorie row. (starts with row at 0m 0s).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.
