**Description:**  
The Farmer's Trade is a grind/endurance team workout performed for time. Teams work together to transport heavy objects (often dumbbells or kettlebells), simulating a “farmer’s carry.” The objective is to complete all prescribed carry distances and/or repetitions as quickly as possible, emphasizing teamwork, grip strength, stamina, and consistent pacing. Each team member alternates carries, ensuring sustained effort and minimal rest throughout the workout. The workout challenges mental toughness, coordination, and cardiovascular endurance.
Description.to: The Farmer's Trade is a grind/endurance team workout performed for time. Teams work together to transport heavy objects (often dumbbells or kettlebells), simulating a “farmer’s carry.” The objective is to complete all prescribed carry distances and/or repetitions as quickly as possible, emphasizing teamwork, grip strength, stamina, and consistent pacing. Each team member alternates carries, ensuring sustained effort and minimal rest throughout the workout. The workout challenges mental toughness, coordination, and cardiovascular endurance.

Flavor_Text.from: The Farmer's Trade - A for time - high intensity pacing challenge that demands focus and grit.
Flavor_Text.to: The Farmer's Trade – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.

Name: Buy-in/cash-out Row
Description: The Buy-in/Cash-out Row is a workout structure where athletes begin (buy-in) and/or finish (cash-out) a main workout with a set rowing distance or time. This design emphasizes grind and endurance, often incorporated in team formats and executed "For Time." Teams work together to complete the rowing segment as quickly as possible, fostering pacing strategy, sustained effort, and team coordination. Rower segments can serve as a metabolic challenge before or after the main workout, enhancing conditioning and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Buy-in/cash-out Row – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Buy-in/cash-out Row: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Buy-in: 500m Row (Split). WOD: 50 Pull-ups, 50 Thrusters (32/10.2 kgs), 50 Burpees (All Split). Cash-out: 500m Row (Split). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Buy-in: 1000m Row (Split). WOD: 100 Pull-ups, 100 Thrusters (65/20.4 kgs), 100 Burpees (All Split). Cash-out: 1000m Row (Split). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Buy-in: 1000m Row (Split). WOD: 100 Pull-ups, 100 Thrusters (65/20.4 kgs), 100 Burpees (All Split). Cash-out: 1000m Row (Split). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Buy-in: 1000m Row (Split). WOD: 100 Pull-ups, 100 Thrusters (65/20.4 kgs), 100 Burpees (All Split). Cash-out: 1000m Row (Split). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: buy-in: 1000m row (split). wod: 100 pull-ups, 100 thrusters (65/20.4 kgs), 100 burpees (all split). cash-out: 1000m row (split).
Instructions_Clean: buy-in: 1000m row (split). wod: 100 pull-ups, 100 thrusters (65/20.4 kgs), 100 burpees (all split). cash-out: 1000m row (split).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Alternating Gymnastic
Description: Alternating Gymnastic (Gymnastics/skill, For Time) is a team-based workout where athletes cycle through gymnastic movements in an alternating fashion, aiming to complete the prescribed amount of work as quickly as possible. Participants perform skills such as pull-ups, handstand push-ups, or muscle-ups, trading off with teammates to maximize efficiency and minimize rest. The focus is on maintaining form, improving gymnastics proficiency, and building teamwork under a timed format. The workout challenges coordination, strength, and endurance.
Flavor_Text: Alternating Gymnastic – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Alternating Gymnastic: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Alternating Sets: P1 does 3 Ring Dips, P1 does 3 Ring Dips. P1 does 3 Pull-ups, P1 does 3 Pull-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Alternating Sets: P1 does 7 Ring Dips, P2 does 7 Ring Dips. P1 does 7 Pull-ups, P2 does 7 Pull-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Alternating Sets: P1 does 7 Ring Dips, P2 does 7 Ring Dips. P1 does 7 Pull-ups, P2 does 7 Pull-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Alternating Sets: P1 does 7 Ring Dips, P2 does 7 Ring Dips. P1 does 7 Pull-ups, P2 does 7 Pull-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: alternating sets: p1 does 7 ring dips, p2 does 7 ring dips. p1 does 7 pull-ups, p2 does 7 pull-ups.
Instructions_Clean: alternating sets: p1 does 7 ring dips, p2 does 7 ring dips. p1 does 7 pull-ups, p2 does 7 pull-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Max Rep Hold
Description: Max Rep Hold (AMRAP/Interval, Team) is a 15-minute workout where participants continuously perform as many repetitions as possible (AMRAP) of designated movements during set intervals. Team members alternate working and resting, supporting each other to maximize total repetitions. The focus is on endurance, teamwork, and pushing limits within the designated timeframe. Ideal for improving muscular stamina and cooperative effort.
Flavor_Text: Max Rep Hold – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Max Rep Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 holds Kettlebell Front Rack (Heavy). P1 completes Max Reps of Wall Balls (10/3.2 kgs). Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total Wall Balls. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 holds Kettlebell Front Rack (Heavy). P2 completes Max Reps of Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs). Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total Wall Balls. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 holds Kettlebell Front Rack (Heavy). P2 completes Max Reps of Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs). Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total Wall Balls. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 holds Kettlebell Front Rack (Heavy). P2 completes Max Reps of Wall Balls (20/6.4 kgs). Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total Wall Balls. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 holds kettlebell front rack (heavy). p2 completes max reps of wall balls (20/6.4 kgs). switch when p1 breaks hold. score is total wall balls. for time
Instructions_Clean: p1 holds kettlebell front rack (heavy). p2 completes max repetitions of wall balls (20/6.4 kgs). switch when p1 breaks hold. score is total wall balls. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Run/ski Split
Description: Run/ski split is a monostructural cardio team workout performed for time. Teams divide the prescribed distance or calories between running and ski erg, alternating or splitting work as needed. The focus is on sustained aerobic output, efficient transitions, and teamwork to complete the total work as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: Run/ski Split – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Run/ski Split: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 runs 400m. P1 completes max distance on Ski Erg. Switch. Total Ski meters is the score tie-breaker. Time is final score. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 runs 800m. P2 completes max distance on Ski Erg. Switch. Total Ski meters is the score tie-breaker. Time is final score. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 runs 800m. P2 completes max distance on Ski Erg. Switch. Total Ski meters is the score tie-breaker. Time is final score. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 runs 800m. P2 completes max distance on Ski Erg. Switch. Total Ski meters is the score tie-breaker. Time is final score. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 runs 800m. p2 completes max distance on ski erg. switch. total ski meters is the score tie-breaker. time is final score.
Instructions_Clean: p1 runs 800m. p2 completes max distance on ski erg. switch. total ski meters is the score tie-breaker. time is final score.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Devil's Press Partner
Description: The Devil's Press Partner workout is a fast-paced, team-based challenge that combines full-body strength and cardio. Working in pairs, teammates alternate reps using dumbbells or kettlebells. Each partner performs a Devil's Press—beginning with a burpee, immediately transitioning into a ground-to-overhead press—while the other rests. Partners continue alternating until all required repetitions are completed, aiming for the best possible time. This workout tests endurance, coordination, and teamwork.
Flavor_Text: Devil's Press Partner – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Devil's Press Partner: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Total Reps per round of Dual Dumbbell Devil's Press (25/7.4 kgs) (Split Reps). 12 Double Unders (Synchronized) after each round. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Total Reps per round of Dual Dumbbell Devil's Press (50/15.9 kgs) (Split Reps). 25 Double Unders (Synchronized) after each round. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Total Reps per round of Dual Dumbbell Devil's Press (50/15.9 kgs) (Split Reps). 25 Double Unders (Synchronized) after each round. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Total Reps per round of Dual Dumbbell Devil's Press (50/15.9 kgs) (Split Reps). 25 Double Unders (Synchronized) after each round. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: total reps per round of dual dumbbell devil's press (50/15.9 kgs) (split reps). 25 double unders (synchronized) after each round. for time
Instructions_Clean: total repetitions per round of dual dumbbell devil's press (50/15.9 kgs) (split repetitions). 25 double unders (synchronized) after each round. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Split Endurance
Description: This workout is a split endurance session, focusing on monostructural (single-modal) cardiovascular training designed for teams. Athletes will complete a set amount of work as quickly as possible ("For Time"), either splitting the workload evenly or strategizing based on individual strengths. This format enhances team coordination, aerobic capacity, and sustained output, emphasizing pacing and efficient transitions. It's ideal for building cardiovascular endurance and teamwork within a motivating, time-based challenge.
Flavor_Text: Split Endurance – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Split Endurance: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 100/75 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 20 Cals (total), both partners perform 5 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 200/150 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 40 Cals (total), both partners perform 10 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 200/150 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 40 Cals (total), both partners perform 10 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 200/150 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 40 Cals (total), both partners perform 10 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 200/150 calorie bike (split, work simultaneously). every 40 cals (total), both partners perform 10 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 200/150 calorie bike (split, work simultaneously). every 40 cals (total), both partners perform 10 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Weighted Carry
Description: The Weighted Carry is a challenging team workout focusing on grind and endurance. Participants work together to transport heavy objects—such as sandbags, kettlebells, or dumbbells—over a set distance or for a designated period. The team must coordinate pace and strategy, emphasizing teamwork, grip strength, core stability, and cardiovascular endurance. Completing the weighted carry "for time" adds an element of speed and competition, pushing participants to maintain intensity while managing fatigue and communication throughout the event.
Flavor_Text: The Weighted Carry – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For The Weighted Carry: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 200m Run (Together). 25 ft Heavy Sandbag Carry (P1 carries, P1 does Plank Hold). Switch halfway. 7 Burpees (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 400m Run (Together). 50 ft Heavy Sandbag Carry (P1 carries, P2 does Plank Hold). Switch halfway. 15 Burpees (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 400m Run (Together). 50 ft Heavy Sandbag Carry (P1 carries, P2 does Plank Hold). Switch halfway. 15 Burpees (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 400m Run (Together). 50 ft Heavy Sandbag Carry (P1 carries, P2 does Plank Hold). Switch halfway. 15 Burpees (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 400m run (together). 50 ft heavy sandbag carry (p1 carries, p2 does plank hold). switch halfway. 15 burpees (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 400m run (together). 50 ft heavy sandbag carry (p1 carries, p2 does plank hold). switch halfway. 15 burpees (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Deadlift Team Ladder
Description: The Deadlift Team Ladder is a high-intensity, team-based barbell workout focused on building strength, coordination, and teamwork. Teams work together, with each member completing increasing weights in a ladder format. Athletes take turns lifting a barbell for prescribed repetitions, adding weight after each round. The workout is performed for time, challenging teams to complete all rounds as quickly as possible while maintaining proper deadlift technique and safety. This group format encourages support, communication, and competitive spirit. Ideal for improving total-body strength, especially in the posterior chain.
Flavor_Text: Deadlift Team Ladder – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Deadlift Team Ladder: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Deadlifts (157/51.1 kgs) (Split Reps). Bar cannot be dropped until the 10, 7, or 4 reps are complete. After each set, both partners perform 7 C1B Pull-ups (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Deadlifts (315/102.1 kgs) (Split Reps). Bar cannot be dropped until the 21, 15, or 9 reps are complete. After each set, both partners perform 15 C2B Pull-ups (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Deadlifts (315/102.1 kgs) (Split Reps). Bar cannot be dropped until the 21, 15, or 9 reps are complete. After each set, both partners perform 15 C2B Pull-ups (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Deadlifts (315/102.1 kgs) (Split Reps). Bar cannot be dropped until the 21, 15, or 9 reps are complete. After each set, both partners perform 15 C2B Pull-ups (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: deadlifts (315/102.1 kgs) (split reps). bar cannot be dropped until the 21, 15, or 9 reps are complete. after each set, both partners perform 15 c2b pull-ups (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: deadlifts (315/102.1 kgs) (split repetitions). bar cannot be dropped until the 21, 15, or 9 repetitions are complete. after each set, both partners perform 15 c2b pull-ups (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Air Squat Penalty
Description: Air Squat Penalty is a team-based AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed in a 20-minute interval. Teams work together to complete as many rounds as possible of a specified circuit. If any movement standard isn’t met or a rep is missed, the entire team incurs a penalty of a set number of air squats before continuing. This format encourages accountability, teamwork, and high-intensity effort throughout the session.
Flavor_Text: Air Squat Penalty – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Air Squat Penalty: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Ring Rows (Split Reps). P1 holds bottom of Air Squat. If P1 stands up, P1 must stop work. P1/P1 switch at end of Ring Row set. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Ring Rows (Split Reps). P2 holds bottom of Air Squat. If P2 stands up, P1 must stop work. P1/P2 switch at end of Ring Row set. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Ring Rows (Split Reps). P2 holds bottom of Air Squat. If P2 stands up, P1 must stop work. P1/P2 switch at end of Ring Row set. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Ring Rows (Split Reps). P2 holds bottom of Air Squat. If P2 stands up, P1 must stop work. P1/P2 switch at end of Ring Row set. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 ring rows (split reps). p2 holds bottom of air squat. if p2 stands up, p1 must stop work. p1/p2 switch at end of ring row set.
Instructions_Clean: 10 ring rows (split repetitions). p2 holds bottom of air squat. if p2 stands up, p1 must stop work. p1/p2 switch at end of ring row set.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
**Description:**  
Air Squat Penalty is a team-based AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed in a 20-minute interval. Teams work together to complete as many rounds as possible of a specified circuit. If any movement standard isn’t met or a rep is missed, the entire team incurs a penalty of a set number of air squats before continuing. This format encourages accountability, teamwork, and high-intensity effort throughout the session.
Description.to: Air Squat Penalty is a team-based AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed in a 20-minute interval. Teams work together to complete as many rounds as possible of a specified circuit. If any movement standard isn’t met or a rep is missed, the entire team incurs a penalty of a set number of air squats before continuing. This format encourages accountability, teamwork, and high-intensity effort throughout the session.

Flavor_Text.from: Air Squat Penalty - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: Air Squat Penalty – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.

Name: Wall Climb & Row
Description: The Wall Climb & Row is a gymnastics/skill-focused team workout performed for time. Athletes alternate between wall climbs—where you move from a prone position to having your chest touch the wall in a handstand—and rowing on a machine. This combination challenges upper body strength, core stability, and cardiovascular endurance. Teams complete prescribed repetitions, coordinating transitions efficiently for the best cumulative time.
Flavor_Text: Wall Climb & Row – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Wall Climb & Row: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Wall Walks (P1 works, P1 rests). 125m Row (YGIY). 10 Wall Balls (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Wall Walks (P1 works, P2 rests). 250m Row (YGIY). 20 Wall Balls (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Wall Walks (P1 works, P2 rests). 250m Row (YGIY). 20 Wall Balls (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Wall Walks (P1 works, P2 rests). 250m Row (YGIY). 20 Wall Balls (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 wall walks (p1 works, p2 rests). 250m row (ygiy). 20 wall balls (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 5 wall walks (p1 works, p2 rests). 250m row (ygiy). 20 wall balls (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Chipper Split
Description: Chipper Split is a team-based grind/endurance workout performed for time. Athletes collectively complete a long sequence of varied functional movements, splitting the total workload as desired. The objective is to chip away at the reps as a team, pushing cardiovascular endurance, muscular stamina, and teamwork. The workout emphasizes efficient transitions and consistent effort until all prescribed reps are completed.
Flavor_Text: Chipper Split – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Chipper Split: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 100 Double Unders, 50 GHD Sit-ups, 25 Burpees (All Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 200 Double Unders, 100 GHD Sit-ups, 50 Burpees (All Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 200 Double Unders, 100 GHD Sit-ups, 50 Burpees (All Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 200 Double Unders, 100 GHD Sit-ups, 50 Burpees (All Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 200 double unders, 100 ghd sit-ups, 50 burpees (all split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 200 double unders, 100 ghd sit-ups, 50 burpees (all split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Pacing Run
Description:
**Workout**: The Pacing Run  
**Type**: Monostructural/Cardio (Team), For Time

**Description**:  
"The Pacing Run" is a team-based cardio workout designed to improve cardiovascular endurance, pacing strategy, and teamwork. Teams work together to complete a set running distance as fast as possible, supporting each other to maintain a steady pace throughout. The focus is on consistent effort, communication, and strategic pacing, challenging both aerobic capacity and group coordination. Perfect for developing stamina, mental toughness, and team spirit.
Flavor_Text: The Pacing Run – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For The Pacing Run: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 runs 400m. P1 rows max meters. Switch. Score is total time + total meters rowed. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 runs 800m. P2 rows max meters. Switch. Score is total time + total meters rowed. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 runs 800m. P2 rows max meters. Switch. Score is total time + total meters rowed. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 runs 800m. P2 rows max meters. Switch. Score is total time + total meters rowed. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 runs 800m. p2 rows max meters. switch. score is total time + total meters rowed.
Instructions_Clean: p1 runs 800m. p2 rows max meters. switch. score is total time + total meters rowed.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Synchro Thruster
Description:
**Description**:  
The Synchro Thruster (Barbell/weightlifting, team) is a full-body compound exercise performed with a partner for 18 minutes as many reps as possible (AMRAP). Both athletes hold barbells and synchronize each repetition, starting from a front squat (barbell held at shoulders), standing up while pressing the barbell overhead in one fluid motion. The movement demands teamwork, power, and endurance, promoting coordination, lower and upper body strength, and cardiovascular conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Synchro Thruster – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Synchro Thruster: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Synchronized Thrusters (47/14.2 kgs), 10 Toes-to-Bar (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Synchronized Thrusters (95/29.5 kgs), 20 Toes-to-Bar (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Synchronized Thrusters (95/29.5 kgs), 20 Toes-to-Bar (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Synchronized Thrusters (95/29.5 kgs), 20 Toes-to-Bar (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 synchronized thrusters (95/29.5 kgs), 20 toes-to-bar (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 10 synchronized thrusters (95/29.5 kgs), 20 toes-to-bar (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Wall Ball Hold
Description:
**Wall Ball Hold (AMRAP/Interval, Team, AMRAP 15) - Description:**

Teams work for 15 minutes AMRAP (as many reps as possible). Partner 1 holds a wall ball at chest height, ensuring elbows stay below the ball and maintaining an upright posture against a wall. Partner 2 performs designated exercise or reps. Partners switch roles each interval or upon predetermined rep count. Challenge: wall ball must not touch the ground during the 15-minute period—rest only while holding the ball. Encourages teamwork, endurance, and upper body/core stability.
Flavor_Text: Wall Ball Hold – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Wall Ball Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 holds the bottom of a Wall Ball Squat. P1 completes max rounds of: 5 Push-ups, 5 Sit-ups. Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total rounds. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 holds the bottom of a Wall Ball Squat. P2 completes max rounds of: 10 Push-ups, 10 Sit-ups. Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total rounds. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 holds the bottom of a Wall Ball Squat. P2 completes max rounds of: 10 Push-ups, 10 Sit-ups. Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total rounds. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 holds the bottom of a Wall Ball Squat. P2 completes max rounds of: 10 Push-ups, 10 Sit-ups. Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total rounds. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 holds the bottom of a wall ball squat. p2 completes max rounds of: 10 push-ups, 10 sit-ups. switch when p1 breaks hold. score is total rounds.
Instructions_Clean: p1 holds the bottom of a wall ball squat. p2 completes max rounds of: 10 push-ups, 10 sit-ups. switch when p1 breaks hold. score is total rounds.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Partner Chipper III
Description: Partner Chipper III is a high-energy, endurance-based workout designed for pairs. Team up and tackle a long sequence of diverse movements together, dividing reps as needed. Only one partner works at a time, pushing through each exercise before advancing. Race against the clock to complete the full chipper, fostering teamwork, communication, and grit. This grind-style WOD tests your aerobic capacity, muscular stamina, and partnership under pressure.
Flavor_Text: Partner Chipper III – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Partner Chipper III: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 75 Wall Balls, 50 Calorie Row, 25 Burpees Over Rower. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 150 Wall Balls, 100 Calorie Row, 50 Burpees Over Rower. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 150 Wall Balls, 100 Calorie Row, 50 Burpees Over Rower. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 150 Wall Balls, 100 Calorie Row, 50 Burpees Over Rower. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 150 wall balls, 100 calorie row, 50 burpees over rower.
Instructions_Clean: 150 wall balls, 100 calorie row, 50 burpees over rower.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: I Go, You Go Lifts
Description:
**I Go, You Go Lifts (Barbell/Weightlifting, For Time) - Description:**

A high-intensity partner workout where teammates alternate lifting sets of a specified barbell movement (e.g., deadlifts, cleans, snatches). One partner completes their set while the other rests, then they switch roles immediately. This format continues until the target number of reps or rounds is achieved as quickly as possible. Encourages teamwork, fast transitions, and sustained effort.
Flavor_Text: I Go, You Go Lifts – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For I Go, You Go Lifts: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Hang Power Cleans (67/21.1 kgs) (YGIY), 5 Handstand Push-ups (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Hang Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY), 10 Handstand Push-ups (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Hang Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY), 10 Handstand Push-ups (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Hang Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY), 10 Handstand Push-ups (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 hang power cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (ygiy), 10 handstand push-ups (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 10 hang power cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (ygiy), 10 handstand push-ups (split repetitions).
TrainingGoals: Barbell Cycling Speed, Skill Under Fatigue
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Dual Carry & Tax
Description: The Dual Carry & Tax is a challenging team workout where athletes work together to transport a pair of dumbbells or kettlebells for a set distance or duration. Only one athlete may carry the weights at a time, requiring teammates to coordinate transitions efficiently. The "tax" refers to a physical task (such as burpees, push-ups, or squats) that must be completed either before picking up the weights or immediately after setting them down, adding intensity and demanding grip endurance, teamwork, and cardiovascular output. The objective is to complete the entire distance or target reps in the fastest time possible.
Flavor_Text: Dual Carry & Tax – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Dual Carry & Tax: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50m Run (Together). P1 does 25 ft Dual DB Overhead Carry, P1 does 25 ft Dual DB Farmer's Carry. Switch. 5 Synchro Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100m Run (Together). P1 does 50 ft Dual DB Overhead Carry, P2 does 50 ft Dual DB Farmer's Carry. Switch. 10 Synchro Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100m Run (Together). P1 does 50 ft Dual DB Overhead Carry, P2 does 50 ft Dual DB Farmer's Carry. Switch. 10 Synchro Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100m Run (Together). P1 does 50 ft Dual DB Overhead Carry, P2 does 50 ft Dual DB Farmer's Carry. Switch. 10 Synchro Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100m run (together). p1 does 50 ft dual db overhead carry, p2 does 50 ft dual db farmer's carry. switch. 10 synchro burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 100m run (together). p1 does 50 ft dual db overhead carry, p2 does 50 ft dual db farmer's carry. switch. 10 synchro burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Team Engine Repeater
Description: Team Engine Repeater is a high-energy, team-based monostructural cardio workout designed for time. Working together, teammates rotate through cardio intervals (such as rowing, biking, running, or ski erg) to accumulate a target distance or calorie goal as quickly as possible. Team members motivate each other, push the pace, and strategically switch to maximize efficiency and endurance until the objective is completed. This workout promotes teamwork, aerobic capacity, and relentless conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Team Engine Repeater – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Team Engine Repeater: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10/7 Calorie Ski (Split Reps), 50 Double Unders (Split Reps), 5 Deadlifts (112/35.1 kgs) (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20/15 Calorie Ski (Split Reps), 100 Double Unders (Split Reps), 10 Deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs) (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20/15 Calorie Ski (Split Reps), 100 Double Unders (Split Reps), 10 Deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs) (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20/15 Calorie Ski (Split Reps), 100 Double Unders (Split Reps), 10 Deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs) (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20/15 calorie ski (split reps), 100 double unders (split reps), 10 deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs) (split reps). for time
Instructions_Clean: 20/15 calorie ski (split repetitions), 100 double unders (split repetitions), 10 deadlifts (225/70.3 kgs) (split repetitions). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Flavor_Text.from: Team Engine Repeater - Brutal but fair; pace wisely and prioritize technique.
Flavor_Text.to: Team Engine Repeater – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.

Name: Team 'DT'
Description: “DT” is a classic CrossFit Hero WOD, designed to be completed by a team using a barbell. The workout consists of 5 rounds, performed for time, of: 12 Deadlifts, 9 Hang Power Cleans, and 6 Push Jerks. Team members alternate rounds or split the work as needed, focusing on strength, endurance, and teamwork. The primary goal is to finish all repetitions as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form and coordination. This workout challenges grip, pulling power, and explosive overhead movements, making it an excellent test of barbell cycling and teamwork.
Flavor_Text: Team 'DT' – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Team 'DT': Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 6 Deadlifts, 4 Hang Power Cleans, 3 Push Jerks (All Split Reps, 77/23.3 kgs). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 12 Deadlifts, 9 Hang Power Cleans, 6 Push Jerks (All Split Reps, 155/47.6 kgs). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 12 Deadlifts, 9 Hang Power Cleans, 6 Push Jerks (All Split Reps, 155/47.6 kgs). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 12 Deadlifts, 9 Hang Power Cleans, 6 Push Jerks (All Split Reps, 155/47.6 kgs). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 12 deadlifts, 9 hang power cleans, 6 push jerks (all split reps, 155/47.6 kgs).
Instructions_Clean: 12 deadlifts, 9 hang power cleans, 6 push jerks (all split repetitions, 155/47.6 kgs).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Assault Bike Pacer
Description:
**Assault Bike Pacer (Team AMRAP 16) Description:**  
Work in pairs to accumulate as many calories as possible in 16 minutes on the Assault Bike. While one teammate bikes at maximum effort, the other rests or cheers. Switch riders as needed, keeping transitions fast to maintain intensity. Track total calories as the team score. Focus on pacing, communication, and steady output for the full duration. This workout builds cardiovascular endurance, leg power, and teamwork under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: Assault Bike Pacer – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Assault Bike Pacer: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 bikes 7/6 Cals (Max Effort). P1 completes Max Reps of Dumbbell Thrusters (17/5.1 kgs). Switch. Score is total Thruster reps. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 bikes 15/12 Cals (Max Effort). P2 completes Max Reps of Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs). Switch. Score is total Thruster reps. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 bikes 15/12 Cals (Max Effort). P2 completes Max Reps of Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs). Switch. Score is total Thruster reps. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 bikes 15/12 Cals (Max Effort). P2 completes Max Reps of Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs). Switch. Score is total Thruster reps. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 bikes 15/12 cals (max effort). p2 completes max reps of dumbbell thrusters (35/11.3 kgs). switch. score is total thruster reps.
Instructions_Clean: p1 bikes 15/12 cals (max effort). p2 completes max repetitions of dumbbell thrusters (35/11.3 kgs). switch. score is total thruster repetitions.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Strict Pull-up Hold
Description: The Strict Pull-up Hold is a gymnastics strength skill where athletes maintain the top position of a pull-up with chin above the bar, focusing on scapular engagement and core stability. Performed as an EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) for 15 minutes in a team format, athletes alternate turns each minute, maximizing hold time and refining strict pull-up mechanics, grip endurance, and upper body control. Ideal for developing foundational pulling strength and improving bar awareness.
Flavor_Text: Strict Pull-up Hold – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Strict Pull-up Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Odd: P1 performs Max Strict Pull-ups. P1 holds bottom of Air Squat. Switch. Even: P1 performs Max Strict Push-ups. P1 holds Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Odd: P1 performs Max Strict Pull-ups. P2 holds bottom of Air Squat. Switch. Even: P1 performs Max Strict Push-ups. P2 holds Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Odd: P1 performs Max Strict Pull-ups. P2 holds bottom of Air Squat. Switch. Even: P1 performs Max Strict Push-ups. P2 holds Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Odd: P1 performs Max Strict Pull-ups. P2 holds bottom of Air Squat. Switch. Even: P1 performs Max Strict Push-ups. P2 holds Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: odd: p1 performs max strict pull-ups. p2 holds bottom of air squat. switch. even: p1 performs max strict push-ups. p2 holds chin-over-bar. switch.
Instructions_Clean: odd: p1 performs max strict pull-ups. p2 holds bottom of air squat. switch. even: p1 performs max strict push-ups. p2 holds chin-over-bar. switch.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Row/burpee YGIY
Description: Row/Burpee YGIY is a team-based, grind-style endurance workout performed "For Time." Teams alternate between rowing and burpees, pushing their limits to complete a set distance or repetitions as quickly as possible. The focus is on steady pacing, teamwork, and continuous effort through alternating sprints and bodyweight movements, promoting cardiovascular endurance and full-body conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Row/burpee YGIY – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Row/burpee YGIY: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 125m Row (YGIY), 5 Burpees Over Rower (YGIY). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 250m Row (YGIY), 10 Burpees Over Rower (YGIY). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 250m Row (YGIY), 10 Burpees Over Rower (YGIY). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 250m Row (YGIY), 10 Burpees Over Rower (YGIY). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 250m row (ygiy), 10 burpees over rower (ygiy).
Instructions_Clean: 250m row (ygiy), 10 burpees over rower (ygiy).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Synchro Wall Balls II
Description: Synchro Wall Balls II is a team-based, grind/endurance workout performed for time. Partners work in sync, completing wall ball shots together, ensuring each rep is counted only when both athletes finish simultaneously. The focus is on maintaining consistent pacing, communication, and teamwork while managing fatigue over high-rep sets. This workout challenges total-body strength, cardiovascular endurance, coordination, and mental resilience.
Flavor_Text: Synchro Wall Balls II – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Synchro Wall Balls II: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 15 Synchro Wall Balls, 10 Synchro Box Jumps, 5 Rope Climbs (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 30 Synchro Wall Balls, 20 Synchro Box Jumps, 10 Rope Climbs (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 30 Synchro Wall Balls, 20 Synchro Box Jumps, 10 Rope Climbs (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 30 Synchro Wall Balls, 20 Synchro Box Jumps, 10 Rope Climbs (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 30 synchro wall balls, 20 synchro box jumps, 10 rope climbs (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 30 synchro wall balls, 20 synchro box jumps, 10 rope climbs (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Team Dumbbell Power
Description: Team Dumbbell Power is a high-intensity, team-based workout where partners work together using dumbbells or kettlebells. The workout is performed "For Time," meaning participants complete all prescribed rounds and reps as quickly as possible. Teammates alternate reps or exercises, efficiently splitting the workload for optimal performance. This session builds strength, power, and teamwork, targeting multiple muscle groups with functional, compound movements. Suitable for all fitness levels—modify weights and pacing as needed.
Flavor_Text: Team Dumbbell Power – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Team Dumbbell Power: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20 Dual Dumbbell Squat Cleans (Split Reps, 40/13.6 kgs), 30 Toes-to-Bar (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Dual Dumbbell Squat Cleans (Split Reps, 40/13.6 kgs), 30 Toes-to-Bar (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Dual Dumbbell Squat Cleans (Split Reps, 40/13.6 kgs), 30 Toes-to-Bar (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20 dual dumbbell squat cleans (split reps, 40/13.6 kgs), 30 toes-to-bar (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 20 dual dumbbell squat cleans (split repetitions, 40/13.6 kgs), 30 toes-to-bar (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Partner Carry
Description: The Partner Carry is an endurance-focused, team-based exercise performed for 15 minutes AMRAP (as many rounds as possible). Partners alternate carrying each other over a designated distance, testing strength, grit, and teamwork. The carrier develops lower body power and grip endurance, while the carried partner engages core stability. Maintain communication and focus on safe lifting to maximize both performance and injury prevention.
Flavor_Text: The Partner Carry – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For The Partner Carry: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 carries P1 25 ft (Fireman or Piggyback). 5 Synchro Air Squats. Switch roles. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 carries P2 50 ft (Fireman or Piggyback). 10 Synchro Air Squats. Switch roles. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 carries P2 50 ft (Fireman or Piggyback). 10 Synchro Air Squats. Switch roles. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 carries P2 50 ft (Fireman or Piggyback). 10 Synchro Air Squats. Switch roles. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 carries p2 50 ft (fireman or piggyback). 10 synchro air squats. switch roles.

ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Yoke Carry Pacer
Description: The Yoke Carry Pacer is a team-based barbell/weightlifting workout focused on both strength and speed. Teams work together to carry a loaded yoke or barbell for a set distance as quickly as possible. Each member shares the load or takes turns carrying, with teamwork, coordination, and pacing being key to completing the challenge in the fastest time. This workout develops full-body strength, core stability, and cardiovascular endurance.
Flavor_Text: Yoke Carry Pacer – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Yoke Carry Pacer: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 carries Yoke 100 ft (Heavy). P2 completes max reps of Overhead Squats (95/29.5 kgs). Switch. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.

Name: High Volume Press
Description: The High Volume Press (Grind/Endurance, Team, For Time) is a challenging team workout focused on building upper body strength, muscular endurance, and teamwork. Teams work together to complete a high number of pressing repetitions—such as barbell presses, push presses, or dumbbell presses—in the shortest possible time. The "grind/endurance" format tests sustained effort, requiring strategic pacing, quick transitions, and communication among team members to maintain consistent movement under fatigue. This workout cultivates resilience, increases work capacity, and supports muscle development in the shoulders, chest, and triceps.
Flavor_Text: High Volume Press – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For High Volume Press: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Push Press (Split Reps, 95/29.5 kgs), 100 Burpees (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Description.from:

Team Bar Muscle-up is a gymnastics-based skill workout performed for time. Working in groups, athletes take turns completing muscle-ups on a pull-up bar, focusing on proper technique and efficient transitions. This workout enhances upper body strength, coordination, and teamwork, challenging participants to perform as many clean repetitions as possible within the fastest time, while supporting each other’s progress and safety.

Name: Kettlebell Swing Pacer
Description: The Kettlebell Swing Pacer is a team workout performed for time using either a dumbbell or kettlebell. Athletes alternate performing kettlebell swings in short, intense intervals, aiming to maintain a steady, fast pace throughout the workout. The focus is on generating hip drive, maintaining a neutral spine, and synchronized team transitions. Suitable for building endurance, power, and teamwork.
Flavor_Text: Kettlebell Swing Pacer – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Kettlebell Swing Pacer: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 completes 25 KB Swings (12/8 kg). P1 holds a Chin-Over-Bar hold. Switch. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 completes 50 KB Swings (24/16 kg). P2 holds a Chin-Over-Bar hold. Switch. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 completes 50 KB Swings (24/16 kg). P2 holds a Chin-Over-Bar hold. Switch. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 completes 50 KB Swings (24/16 kg). P2 holds a Chin-Over-Bar hold. Switch. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 completes 50 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). p2 holds a chin-over-bar hold. switch.
Instructions_Clean: p1 completes 50 kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). p2 holds a chin-over-bar hold. switch.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Partner Assault Bike
Description: Partner Assault Bike is a team-based, monostructural cardio workout where two athletes alternate intervals on an assault bike to complete a set distance or calories as quickly as possible. Partners switch at predetermined intervals or upon fatigue, promoting teamwork, high-intensity effort, and aerobic conditioning. This for-time challenge tests endurance, speed, and communication between teammates.
Flavor_Text: Partner Assault Bike – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Partner Assault Bike: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 150/112 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 25 Cals (total), both perform 5 Synchro Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 300/225 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 50 Cals (total), both perform 10 Synchro Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 300/225 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 50 Cals (total), both perform 10 Synchro Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 300/225 Calorie Bike (Split, work simultaneously). Every 50 Cals (total), both perform 10 Synchro Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 300/225 calorie bike (split, work simultaneously). every 50 cals (total), both perform 10 synchro sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 300/225 calorie bike (split, work simultaneously). every 50 cals (total), both perform 10 synchro sit-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Deadlift-burpee Tax
Description: The Deadlift-burpee Tax is a high-intensity, team-based barbell workout performed as an AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) in 14 minutes. Athletes work together to complete a set number of deadlifts, immediately followed by burpees. Partners must alternate turns, sharing both the workload and rest, maximizing efficiency and teamwork. This workout targets the posterior chain, core, and cardiovascular endurance, challenging both strength and aerobic capacity. Ideal for group settings, it encourages strategy, coordination, and mutual motivation.
Flavor_Text: Deadlift-burpee Tax – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Deadlift-burpee Tax: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Deadlifts (137/41.4 kgs) (YGIY), 5 Burpee Broad Jumps (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs) (YGIY), 10 Burpee Broad Jumps (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs) (YGIY), 10 Burpee Broad Jumps (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs) (YGIY), 10 Burpee Broad Jumps (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs) (ygiy), 10 burpee broad jumps (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 10 deadlifts (275/83.9 kgs) (ygiy), 10 burpee broad jumps (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Alternating Man-makers
Description: Alternating Man-makers are a full-body, compound exercise performed for time, utilizing dumbbells or kettlebells. Athletes alternate repetitions in a team format. One rep consists of a push-up on the weights, a renegade row on each side, a squat clean, and a push press or thruster. This workout challenges strength, endurance, and coordination, incorporating upper body, core, and lower body muscles. Rotate turns with a teammate, aiming to complete the prescribed number of reps or finish as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: Alternating Man-makers – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Alternating Man-makers: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Man-Makers (YGIY, 17/5.1 kgs DBs), 10 V-ups (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Man-Makers (YGIY, 35/11.3 kgs DBs), 20 V-ups (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Man-Makers (YGIY, 35/11.3 kgs DBs), 20 V-ups (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Man-Makers (YGIY, 35/11.3 kgs DBs), 20 V-ups (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 man-makers (ygiy, 35/11.3 kgs dbs), 20 v-ups (split reps). for time
Instructions_Clean: 10 man-makers (ygiy, 35/11.3 kgs dbs), 20 v-ups (split repetitions). complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Triplet Synchronized
Description: The Triplet Synchronized is a team-based, grind/endurance workout performed for time. Athletes work in sync to complete three different functional movements, cycling through them in rounds. Team members must synchronize their reps, maintaining a steady pace and communication throughout. The focus is on endurance, teamwork, and efficient transitions to finish the workout as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: The Triplet Synchronized – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For The Triplet Synchronized: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10 Synchro Wall Balls, 10 Synchro Dumbbell Thrusters (17/5.1 kgs), 10 Synchro Sit-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20 Synchro Wall Balls, 20 Synchro Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs), 20 Synchro Sit-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Synchro Wall Balls, 20 Synchro Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs), 20 Synchro Sit-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Synchro Wall Balls, 20 Synchro Dumbbell Thrusters (35/11.3 kgs), 20 Synchro Sit-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20 synchro wall balls, 20 synchro dumbbell thrusters (35/11.3 kgs), 20 synchro sit-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 20 synchro wall balls, 20 synchro dumbbell thrusters (35/11.3 kgs), 20 synchro sit-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Row/ski Tax Hold
Description: The Row/Ski Tax Hold is a cardio-intensive, team-based workout designed to build endurance and teamwork. Athletes alternate between rowing or ski erg segments and static hold positions, accumulating meters or calories as quickly as possible. While one teammate rows or skis for max output, the other maintains a challenging hold (such as a plank or wall sit), with partners switching roles upon completion. The workout continues until a set distance or target is achieved, blending aerobic conditioning with isometric strength for a balanced, high-intensity challenge.
Flavor_Text: Row/ski Tax Hold – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Row/ski Tax Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1000m Row (Split Reps). While P1 rows, P1 holds a Squat. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. 1000m Ski (Split Reps), P1 holds a Plank. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 2000m Row (Split Reps). While P1 rows, P2 holds a Squat. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. 2000m Ski (Split Reps), P2 holds a Plank. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 2000m Row (Split Reps). While P1 rows, P2 holds a Squat. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. 2000m Ski (Split Reps), P2 holds a Plank. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 2000m Row (Split Reps). While P1 rows, P2 holds a Squat. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. 2000m Ski (Split Reps), P2 holds a Plank. Switch when P1 finishes set/drops. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 2000m row (split reps). while p1 rows, p2 holds a squat. switch when p1 finishes set/drops. 2000m ski (split reps), p2 holds a plank. switch when p1 finishes set/drops.
Instructions_Clean: 2000m row (split repetitions). while p1 rows, p2 holds a squat. switch when p1 finishes set/drops. 2000m ski (split repetitions), p2 holds a plank. switch when p1 finishes set/drops.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Barbell Hold Penalty
Description: In the Barbell Hold Penalty workout (team version, for time), athletes work together to complete a set workload as quickly as possible. Teams are divided so that while one member performs assigned exercises (such as deadlifts, thrusters, or burpees), another must maintain a static barbell hold (for example, at the top of a deadlift or front rack position). If the barbell is dropped or the static hold is broken, the entire team incurs a penalty—usually involving extra reps, a short run, or additional exercises—before continuing. This format emphasizes teamwork, grip strength, endurance, and coordination under pressure.
Flavor_Text: Barbell Hold Penalty – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Barbell Hold Penalty: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Power Cleans (67/21.1 kgs) (YGIY). P1 holds Barbell in Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P1 drops bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY). P2 holds Barbell in Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY). P2 holds Barbell in Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Power Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY). P2 holds Barbell in Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 power cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (ygiy). p2 holds barbell in front rack. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops bar.
Instructions_Clean: 15 power cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (ygiy). p2 holds barbell in front rack. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Synchro Pulling
Description: Synchro Pulling is a team gymnastics skill workout performed for time. Athletes work together to complete synchronized pulling movements—such as pull-ups, chest-to-bar, or muscle-ups—with all team members executing each rep simultaneously. The workout emphasizes coordination, timing, and communication, challenging teams to move efficiently and maintain perfect synchronicity throughout the assigned number of reps or rounds. This format builds teamwork, upper body strength, and gymnastics proficiency.
Flavor_Text: Synchro Pulling – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Synchro Pulling: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Synchronized Pull-ups, Alternating Dumbbell Thrusters (50/15.9 kgs, YGIY). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Synchronized Pull-ups, Alternating Dumbbell Thrusters (50/15.9 kgs, YGIY). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Synchronized Pull-ups, Alternating Dumbbell Thrusters (50/15.9 kgs, YGIY). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: synchronized pull-ups, alternating dumbbell thrusters (50/15.9 kgs, ygiy).
Instructions_Clean: synchronized pull-ups, alternating dumbbell thrusters (50/15.9 kgs, ygiy).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Heavy Sled Partner
