While one partner works, the other supports, motivates, or rests as needed, switching roles to maintain steady progress. This workout challenges cardiovascular endurance, full-body strength, teamwork, and mental grit. Completion time is recorded, emphasizing sustained effort and cooperation.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Sled Partner – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Sled Partner: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25m Heavy Sled Push (P1 works, P1 rests). 25m Heavy Sled Pull (P1 works, P1 rests). 5 Synchro Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50m Heavy Sled Push (P1 works, P2 rests). 50m Heavy Sled Pull (P2 works, P1 rests). 10 Synchro Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50m Heavy Sled Push (P1 works, P2 rests). 50m Heavy Sled Pull (P2 works, P1 rests). 10 Synchro Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50m Heavy Sled Push (P1 works, P2 rests). 50m Heavy Sled Pull (P2 works, P1 rests). 10 Synchro Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50m heavy sled push (p1 works, p2 rests). 50m heavy sled pull (p2 works, p1 rests). 10 synchro burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 50m heavy sled push (p1 works, p2 rests). 50m heavy sled pull (p2 works, p1 rests). 10 synchro burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Description.from:
**Description:**  
Heavy Sled Partner is a grind/endurance team workout performed for time. Partners work together to push or pull a heavily loaded sled across a set distance. While one partner works, the other supports, motivates, or rests as needed, switching roles to maintain steady progress. This workout challenges cardiovascular endurance, full-body strength, teamwork, and mental grit. Completion time is recorded, emphasizing sustained effort and cooperation.
Description.to: Heavy Sled Partner is a grind/endurance team workout performed for time. Partners work together to push or pull a heavily loaded sled across a set distance. While one partner works, the other supports, motivates, or rests as needed, switching roles to maintain steady progress. This workout challenges cardiovascular endurance, full-body strength, teamwork, and mental grit. Completion time is recorded, emphasizing sustained effort and cooperation.

Flavor_Text.from: Heavy Sled Partner - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Heavy Sled Partner – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.

Name: Assault Bike Exchange
Description: The Assault Bike Exchange is a high-intensity, team-based cardio workout where participants alternate riding an assault bike as quickly as possible. Teammates take turns completing set intervals or calories, maintaining maximum effort during their turns, while non-riders rest and recover. The workout continues until the assigned total distance or calorie count is reached, aiming for the fastest overall completion time. This format encourages teamwork, strategic interval management, and peaks heart rate, delivering an effective full-body cardiovascular challenge.
Flavor_Text: Assault Bike Exchange – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Assault Bike Exchange: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 150 Cals total (Split Reps). Partners can exchange at any time but must switch every time a partner drops their hands from the handles. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 300 Cals total (Split Reps). Partners can exchange at any time but must switch every time a partner drops their hands from the handles. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 300 Cals total (Split Reps). Partners can exchange at any time but must switch every time a partner drops their hands from the handles. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 300 Cals total (Split Reps). Partners can exchange at any time but must switch every time a partner drops their hands from the handles. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 300 cals total (split reps). partners can exchange at any time but must switch every time a partner drops their hands from the handles. for time
Instructions_Clean: 300 cals total (split repetitions). partners can exchange at any time but must switch every time a partner drops their hands from the handles. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Odd Object Relay
Description: The Odd Object Relay is a fun, team-based workout where participants alternate carrying or moving a dumbbell or kettlebell through a set course. Working in relay-style rotations, team members complete as many rounds as possible (AMRAP) within 20 minutes. The workout emphasizes teamwork, grip strength, functional movement, and endurance. Each teammate must complete their turn before passing the object to the next, keeping transitions fast and efficient. Ideal for building camaraderie and testing fitness under unconventional conditions.
Flavor_Text: Odd Object Relay – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Odd Object Relay: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 runs 100m carrying a Sandbag (Heavy). P1 completes max reps of Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). Switch roles. Score is total swings. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 runs 200m carrying a Sandbag (Heavy). P2 completes max reps of Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Switch roles. Score is total swings. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 runs 200m carrying a Sandbag (Heavy). P2 completes max reps of Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Switch roles. Score is total swings. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 runs 200m carrying a Sandbag (Heavy). P2 completes max reps of Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Switch roles. Score is total swings. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 runs 200m carrying a sandbag (heavy). p2 completes max reps of kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). switch roles. score is total swings.
Instructions_Clean: p1 runs 200m carrying a sandbag (heavy). p2 completes max repetitions of kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). switch roles. score is total swings.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: The Strict Synchronized
Description: The Strict Synchronized workout is a team-based gymnastics skill challenge performed for time. All team members complete strict (no kipping) gymnastics movements—such as pull-ups, handstand push-ups, or muscle-ups—moving in perfect unison. Each rep must be performed simultaneously, requiring communication, technique, and synchronization. The goal is to finish all prescribed reps as quickly as possible while maintaining strict form and team synchronization. This workout enhances strength, gymnastic skills, teamwork, and timing under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: The Strict Synchronized – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For The Strict Synchronized: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Synchronized Strict Pull-ups, 5 Synchronized Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Synchronized Strict Pull-ups, 10 Synchronized Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Synchronized Strict Pull-ups, 10 Synchronized Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Synchronized Strict Pull-ups, 10 Synchronized Strict Handstand Push-ups. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 synchronized strict pull-ups, 10 synchronized strict handstand push-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 10 synchronized strict pull-ups, 10 synchronized strict handstand push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Barbell Clean Hold
Description: The Barbell Clean Hold is a weightlifting exercise where athletes explosively lift a barbell from the ground to the front rack position (clean), then pause and maintain a static hold with elbows high and chest up. It trains total-body power, grip, core stability, and reinforces proper clean receiving position. Ideal for developing posture, tension, and endurance under load. Commonly performed for time or as part of team workouts.
Flavor_Text: Barbell Clean Hold – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Barbell Clean Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 performs 5 Front Squats (67/21.1 kgs). P1 holds Barbell in the Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P1 drops bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 performs 10 Front Squats (135/43.1 kgs). P2 holds Barbell in the Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 performs 10 Front Squats (135/43.1 kgs). P2 holds Barbell in the Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 performs 10 Front Squats (135/43.1 kgs). P2 holds Barbell in the Front Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 performs 10 front squats (135/43.1 kgs). p2 holds barbell in the front rack. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops bar.
Instructions_Clean: p1 performs 10 front squats (135/43.1 kgs). p2 holds barbell in the front rack. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Rowing Penalty Chipper
Description: The Rowing Penalty Chipper is a grind/endurance team workout performed for time. Athletes complete a sequence of challenging movements ("chipper" style), progressing through each exercise before moving to the next. Between stations or upon set intervals, teams must complete assigned rowing distances as a "penalty" to advance. This format promotes teamwork, sustained effort, and aerobic capacity while encouraging consistent pacing. Expect elevated heart rates and muscular fatigue, testing both grit and endurance.
Flavor_Text: Rowing Penalty Chipper – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Rowing Penalty Chipper: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Pull-ups, 50 Box Jumps, 50 Push-ups. Every time a partner breaks or tags out, the other must complete a 125m Row immediately. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Pull-ups, 100 Box Jumps, 100 Push-ups. Every time a partner breaks or tags out, the other must complete a 250m Row immediately. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Pull-ups, 100 Box Jumps, 100 Push-ups. Every time a partner breaks or tags out, the other must complete a 250m Row immediately. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Pull-ups, 100 Box Jumps, 100 Push-ups. Every time a partner breaks or tags out, the other must complete a 250m Row immediately. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 pull-ups, 100 box jumps, 100 push-ups. every time a partner breaks or tags out, the other must complete a 250m row immediately.
Instructions_Clean: 100 pull-ups, 100 box jumps, 100 push-ups. every time a partner breaks or tags out, the other must complete a 250m row immediately.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: EMOM Gymnastic Pacer
Description: The EMOM Gymnastic Pacer is a team-based workout structured as “Every Minute On the Minute” (EMOM) for 16 minutes. Each minute, team members complete assigned gymnastic movements—such as pull-ups, handstand push-ups, or toes-to-bar—at a steady, maintainable pace. Rest or rotate as needed before the next minute begins, with an emphasis on teamwork, pacing, and consistent technique throughout the session. This format develops muscular endurance, coordination, and effective pacing strategies within a supportive team environment.
Flavor_Text: EMOM Gymnastic Pacer – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For EMOM Gymnastic Pacer: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Min 1: 5 Toes-to-Bar (Split). Min 1: 5/3 Cal Ski (YGIY). Min 1: 5 Box Jump Overs (Split). Min 2: Rest. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Min 1: 10 Toes-to-Bar (Split). Min 2: 10/7 Cal Ski (YGIY). Min 3: 10 Box Jump Overs (Split). Min 4: Rest. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Min 1: 10 Toes-to-Bar (Split). Min 2: 10/7 Cal Ski (YGIY). Min 3: 10 Box Jump Overs (Split). Min 4: Rest. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Min 1: 10 Toes-to-Bar (Split). Min 2: 10/7 Cal Ski (YGIY). Min 3: 10 Box Jump Overs (Split). Min 4: Rest. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: min 1: 10 toes-to-bar (split). min 2: 10/7 cal ski (ygiy). min 3: 10 box jump overs (split). min 4: rest.
Instructions_Clean: min 1: 10 toes-to-bar (split). min 2: 10/7 cal ski (ygiy). min 3: 10 box jump overs (split). min 4: rest.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Team Half Murph
Description: Team Half Murph is a bodyweight workout designed for pairs or groups, ideal for travel or limited equipment. As a team, complete 800m run, 50 pull-ups (or alternatives), 100 push-ups, and 150 air squats, followed by another 800m run. Only one team member works at a time; split reps as needed to finish as quickly as possible. This challenging WOD promotes teamwork, endurance, and functional strength—no gym required!
Flavor_Text: Team Half Murph – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Team Half Murph: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 400m Run (Together). 25 Pull-ups, 50 Push-ups, 75 Air Squats (All Split Reps). 400m Run (Together). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 800m Run (Together). 50 Pull-ups, 100 Push-ups, 150 Air Squats (All Split Reps). 800m Run (Together). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 800m Run (Together). 50 Pull-ups, 100 Push-ups, 150 Air Squats (All Split Reps). 800m Run (Together). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 800m Run (Together). 50 Pull-ups, 100 Push-ups, 150 Air Squats (All Split Reps). 800m Run (Together). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 800m run (together). 50 pull-ups, 100 push-ups, 150 air squats (all split reps). 800m run (together).
Instructions_Clean: 800m run (together). 50 pull-ups, 100 push-ups, 150 air squats (all split repetitions). 800m run (together).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Alternating C&J
Description: Alternating Clean & Jerk (C&J) is a barbell-based, team workout performed for time. Team members alternate repetitions, each executing a clean (lifting barbell from ground to shoulders) followed by a jerk (driving bar overhead). This format encourages teamwork, pacing, and efficient barbell cycling. It challenges full-body strength, coordination, and cardiovascular endurance while promoting technique consistency under fatigue. Suitable weights and rep schemes should be agreed upon in advance for balanced team output.
Flavor_Text: Alternating C&J – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Alternating C&J: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 50 Clean & Jerks (57/17.1 kgs), performed "I Go, You Go" (P1 does 1, P1 does 1). Every 10 reps, both partners perform 5 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 100 Clean & Jerks (115/34.0 kgs), performed "I Go, You Go" (P1 does 1, P2 does 1). Every 20 reps, both partners perform 10 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 100 Clean & Jerks (115/34.0 kgs), performed "I Go, You Go" (P1 does 1, P2 does 1). Every 20 reps, both partners perform 10 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 100 Clean & Jerks (115/34.0 kgs), performed "I Go, You Go" (P1 does 1, P2 does 1). Every 20 reps, both partners perform 10 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 100 clean & jerks (115/34.0 kgs), performed "i go, you go" (p1 does 1, p2 does 1). every 20 reps, both partners perform 10 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 100 clean & jerks (115/34.0 kgs), performed "i go, you go" (p1 does 1, p2 does 1). every 20 repetitions, both partners perform 10 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Pistol Penalty Hold
Description: The Pistol Penalty Hold is a bodyweight gymnastics skill performed as a team during an AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) 15-minute workout. Team members hold the bottom position of a single-leg squat (pistol), maintaining balance and control. If form is broken or a member cannot hold, a penalty, such as extra reps or time, is assigned to the team, reinforcing teamwork, mobility, and lower-body strength.
Flavor_Text: Pistol Penalty Hold – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Pistol Penalty Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 performs Max Reps of Ring Rows. P1 holds a Pistol Squat position (bottom, alternating legs every 15s). Switch when P1 breaks hold. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 performs Max Reps of Ring Rows. P2 holds a Pistol Squat position (bottom, alternating legs every 30s). Switch when P2 breaks hold. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 performs Max Reps of Ring Rows. P2 holds a Pistol Squat position (bottom, alternating legs every 30s). Switch when P2 breaks hold. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 performs Max Reps of Ring Rows. P2 holds a Pistol Squat position (bottom, alternating legs every 30s). Switch when P2 breaks hold. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 performs max reps of ring rows. p2 holds a pistol squat position (bottom, alternating legs every 30s). switch when p2 breaks hold.
Instructions_Clean: p1 performs max repetitions of ring rows. p2 holds a pistol squat position (bottom, alternating legs every 30s). switch when p2 breaks hold.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Row/ski Tax Sprint
Description: Row/Ski Tax Sprint is a fast-paced team monostructural cardio workout designed to boost speed, endurance, and teamwork. Teams alternate between rowing and ski erg sprints, challenging members to complete targeted distances as quickly as possible. The workout emphasizes cardiovascular capacity, quick transitions, and high-intensity effort for time, making it an excellent choice for building aerobic power and fostering group motivation.
Flavor_Text: Row/ski Tax Sprint – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Row/ski Tax Sprint: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 rows 125m (Max Effort). P1 holds a Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. P1 skis 125m (Max Effort). P1 holds a Plank. Switch. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 rows 250m (Max Effort). P2 holds a Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. P1 skis 250m (Max Effort). P2 holds a Plank. Switch. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 rows 250m (Max Effort). P2 holds a Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. P1 skis 250m (Max Effort). P2 holds a Plank. Switch. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 rows 250m (Max Effort). P2 holds a Chin-Over-Bar. Switch. P1 skis 250m (Max Effort). P2 holds a Plank. Switch. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 rows 250m (max effort). p2 holds a chin-over-bar. switch. p1 skis 250m (max effort). p2 holds a plank. switch.
Instructions_Clean: p1 rows 250m (max effort). p2 holds a chin-over-bar. switch. p1 skis 250m (max effort). p2 holds a plank. switch.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Partner Ladder
Description:
**Description**:  
The Partner Ladder is a team-based AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout completed in 18 minutes. Partners take turns completing ascending (or descending) repetitions of selected exercises—one partner works while the other rests. The goal is for each pair to accumulate as many rounds and reps as possible within the time cap, fostering teamwork, conditioning, and endurance. This workout is scalable for all fitness levels and promotes motivation through partner accountability.
Flavor_Text: The Partner Ladder – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For The Partner Ladder: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: Ladder of 1-2-3-4...: Dumbbell Snatch (Alternating, Split Reps), Box Jump Overs (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: Ladder of 2-4-6-8...: Dumbbell Snatch (Alternating, Split Reps), Box Jump Overs (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: Ladder of 2-4-6-8...: Dumbbell Snatch (Alternating, Split Reps), Box Jump Overs (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: Ladder of 2-4-6-8...: Dumbbell Snatch (Alternating, Split Reps), Box Jump Overs (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: ladder of 2-4-6-8...: dumbbell snatch (alternating, split reps), box jump overs (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: ladder of 2-4-6-8...: dumbbell snatch (alternating, split repetitions), box jump overs (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Synchro KB Swings
Description: In Synchro KB Swings, teams perform kettlebell or dumbbell swings together, matching the timing of each rep. All team members must reach the overhead lockout position in sync before returning the weight between their legs. This workout builds coordination, power, and teamwork, and is completed as fast as possible (For Time). Proper form and communication are essential for maximizing performance and safety.
Flavor_Text: Synchro KB Swings – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Synchro KB Swings: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 75 Synchronized Kettlebell Swings (12/8 kg). Every time partners fall out of sync, they must complete 2 Burpees each. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 150 Synchronized Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Every time partners fall out of sync, they must complete 5 Burpees each. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 150 Synchronized Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Every time partners fall out of sync, they must complete 5 Burpees each. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 150 Synchronized Kettlebell Swings (24/16 kg). Every time partners fall out of sync, they must complete 5 Burpees each. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 150 synchronized kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). every time partners fall out of sync, they must complete 5 burpees each.
Instructions_Clean: 150 synchronized kettlebell swings (24/16 kg). every time partners fall out of sync, they must complete 5 burpees each.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Weighted Vest Run
Description: A Weighted Vest Run is an endurance-focused team workout performed “for time,” where each participant or the team collectively runs a set distance while wearing a weighted vest. The extra resistance increases intensity, enhancing cardiovascular endurance, strength, and mental toughness. The goal is to complete the prescribed distance as quickly as possible while maintaining team coordination and pacing strategies.
Flavor_Text: Weighted Vest Run – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Weighted Vest Run: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Mile Run (Together, one partner wears 10/3.2 kg vest). 25 AbMat Sit-ups (Split Reps). Vest must be exchanged at 400m mark. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1 Mile Run (Together, one partner wears 20/6.4 kg vest). 50 AbMat Sit-ups (Split Reps). Vest must be exchanged at 800m mark. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1 Mile Run (Together, one partner wears 20/6.4 kg vest). 50 AbMat Sit-ups (Split Reps). Vest must be exchanged at 800m mark. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1 Mile Run (Together, one partner wears 20/6.4 kg vest). 50 AbMat Sit-ups (Split Reps). Vest must be exchanged at 800m mark. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1 mile run (together, one partner wears 20/6.4 kg vest). 50 abmat sit-ups (split reps). vest must be exchanged at 800m mark.
Instructions_Clean: 1 mile run (together, one partner wears 20/6.4 kg vest). 50 abmat sit-ups (split repetitions). vest must be exchanged at 800m mark.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Synchro Wall Climbs
Description: Synchro Wall Climbs is a gymnastics-based skill workout designed for teams. Athletes work together to complete wall climbs simultaneously, focusing on synchronization. Each team member starts at the base of a wall, moves into a handstand or plank position against the wall, and ascends in unison until their chest touches the wall. The movement emphasizes core stability, upper body strength, and precise timing. The workout is performed for time, challenging teams to maintain coordination and communication throughout to achieve the fastest possible completion.
Flavor_Text: Synchro Wall Climbs – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Synchro Wall Climbs: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Synchronized Wall Walks, 5 Synchro Air Squats. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Synchronized Wall Walks, 10 Synchro Air Squats. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Synchronized Wall Walks, 10 Synchro Air Squats. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Synchronized Wall Walks, 10 Synchro Air Squats. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 synchronized wall walks, 10 synchro air squats.
Instructions_Clean: 5 synchronized wall walks, 10 synchro air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Clean & Jerk Penalty
Description: The Clean & Jerk Penalty workout is a barbell-based, team weightlifting challenge completed for time. Athletes perform a set number of Clean & Jerk reps; if a lift is missed or a rule is broken, a predetermined penalty must be completed (such as burpees or extra reps) before returning to the workout. This format tests both strength and endurance under pressure, emphasizing consistency, teamwork, and penalty management. Ideal for building power and fostering a competitive team environment.
Flavor_Text: Clean & Jerk Penalty – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Clean & Jerk Penalty: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 2 Clean & Jerks (92/28.3 kgs) (YGIY). P1 holds barbell in Back Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P1 drops bar. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 5 Clean & Jerks (185/56.7 kgs) (YGIY). P2 holds barbell in Back Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 5 Clean & Jerks (185/56.7 kgs) (YGIY). P2 holds barbell in Back Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 5 Clean & Jerks (185/56.7 kgs) (YGIY). P2 holds barbell in Back Rack. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops bar. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 5 clean & jerks (185/56.7 kgs) (ygiy). p2 holds barbell in back rack. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops bar.
Instructions_Clean: 5 clean & jerks (185/56.7 kgs) (ygiy). p2 holds barbell in back rack. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops bar.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Ski/wall Ball Hold
Description:
**Ski/Wall Ball Hold (AMRAP 18, Team Interval)**

Teams alternate between max-effort ski erg calories and static wall ball holds for 18 minutes. One teammate skis for max calories while the other maintains an active wall ball hold at the chest. Partners switch roles as needed, always maintaining at least one person holding the ball before the other starts skiing. Score total calories skied. This workout combines cardio endurance with isometric strength for a full-body challenge.
Flavor_Text: Ski/wall Ball Hold – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For Ski/wall Ball Hold: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: P1 performs Max Cals on Ski Erg. P1 holds a GHD Sit-up position (at 45 degrees). Switch when P1 breaks hold. Score is total Cals. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: P1 performs Max Cals on Ski Erg. P2 holds a GHD Sit-up position (at 90 degrees). Switch when P2 breaks hold. Score is total Cals. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: P1 performs Max Cals on Ski Erg. P2 holds a GHD Sit-up position (at 90 degrees). Switch when P2 breaks hold. Score is total Cals. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: P1 performs Max Cals on Ski Erg. P2 holds a GHD Sit-up position (at 90 degrees). Switch when P2 breaks hold. Score is total Cals. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: p1 performs max cals on ski erg. p2 holds a ghd sit-up position (at 90 degrees). switch when p2 breaks hold. score is total cals. for time
Instructions_Clean: p1 performs max cals on ski erg. p2 holds a ghd sit-up position (at 90 degrees). switch when p2 breaks hold. score is total cals. complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Partner Burpee Over
Description: Partner Burpee Over is a team-based, bodyweight workout designed for travel or minimal-equipment settings. Partners face each other on the floor. While one partner performs a burpee, the other partner holds a plank. After completing the burpee, the athlete lateral-jumps over their partner to switch positions. Continue alternating for the prescribed duration or number of reps. This movement builds total-body conditioning, coordination, and teamwork, boosting cardiovascular endurance and muscular strength. Adapt reps and pace to match your fitness level.
Flavor_Text: Partner Burpee Over – Communication, trust, and tempo matter more than any single split.
CoachNotes: For Partner Burpee Over: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Burpees Over Partner (Partner lies flat on ground, partner works). 5 Air Squats (Synchro). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Burpees Over Partner (Partner lies flat on ground, partner works). 10 Air Squats (Synchro). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Burpees Over Partner (Partner lies flat on ground, partner works). 10 Air Squats (Synchro). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Burpees Over Partner (Partner lies flat on ground, partner works). 10 Air Squats (Synchro). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 burpees over partner (partner lies flat on ground, partner works). 10 air squats (synchro).
Instructions_Clean: 10 burpees over partner (partner lies flat on ground, partner works). 10 air squats (synchro).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Legless Relay
Description: The Legless Relay is a team-based gymnastics workout completed for time, focusing on legless rope climbs. Each team member takes turns performing a set number of legless climbs before tagging the next athlete. The relay continues until all required repetitions are finished. This workout challenges grip strength, upper body pulling power, coordination, and teamwork. It is typically structured so that athletes rest while teammates work, allowing for short bursts of maximal effort. Suitable for advanced athletes due to the high skill and strength demands of legless climbs.
Flavor_Text: Legless Relay – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Legless Relay: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 1 Legless Rope Climb (YGIY), 7 Box Jumps (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1 Legless Rope Climb (YGIY), 15 Box Jumps (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1 Legless Rope Climb (YGIY), 15 Box Jumps (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1 Legless Rope Climb (YGIY), 15 Box Jumps (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1 legless rope climb (ygiy), 15 box jumps (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 1 legless rope climb (ygiy), 15 box jumps (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).

Description.from:
**Description:**  
The Legless Relay is a team-based gymnastics workout completed for time, focusing on legless rope climbs. Each team member takes turns performing a set number of legless climbs before tagging the next athlete. The relay continues until all required repetitions are finished. This workout challenges grip strength, upper body pulling power, coordination, and teamwork. It is typically structured so that athletes rest while teammates work, allowing for short bursts of maximal effort. Suitable for advanced athletes due to the high skill and strength demands of legless climbs.
Description.to: The Legless Relay is a team-based gymnastics workout completed for time, focusing on legless rope climbs. Each team member takes turns performing a set number of legless climbs before tagging the next athlete. The relay continues until all required repetitions are finished. This workout challenges grip strength, upper body pulling power, coordination, and teamwork. It is typically structured so that athletes rest while teammates work, allowing for short bursts of maximal effort. Suitable for advanced athletes due to the high skill and strength demands of legless climbs.

Flavor_Text.from: Legless Relay - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Legless Relay – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.

Name: Team Triplet Grind
Description: Team Triplet Grind is a high-intensity endurance workout performed in teams. Athletes alternate movements in a continuous, circuit-style rotation, sustaining effort over an extended duration. The objective is to complete all designated work "For Time," encouraging sustained pacing, teamwork, and effective communication. This grind-style session develops aerobic capacity, muscular endurance, and mental toughness, making it ideal for building camaraderie and collective resilience in group settings.
Flavor_Text: Team Triplet Grind – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes: For Team Triplet Grind: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 25 Double Unders (Synchro), 10 Kettlebell Goblet Squats (YGIY), 5 Ring Dips (Split Reps). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 50 Double Unders (Synchro), 20 Kettlebell Goblet Squats (YGIY), 10 Ring Dips (Split Reps). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 50 Double Unders (Synchro), 20 Kettlebell Goblet Squats (YGIY), 10 Ring Dips (Split Reps). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 50 Double Unders (Synchro), 20 Kettlebell Goblet Squats (YGIY), 10 Ring Dips (Split Reps). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 50 double unders (synchro), 20 kettlebell goblet squats (ygiy), 10 ring dips (split reps).
Instructions_Clean: 50 double unders (synchro), 20 kettlebell goblet squats (ygiy), 10 ring dips (split repetitions).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Alternating Row/clean
Description: Alternating Row/Clean is a team-based, cardio-intensive workout performed for time. Athletes alternate between rowing (on an erg or rower for a set distance or calories) and performing cleans (barbell or dumbbell). Partners switch roles after completing each assigned segment, maintaining a steady, high-intensity pace throughout. This workout enhances cardiovascular endurance, improves total-body strength, and promotes teamwork by combining dynamic pulling and lifting movements in a race-style format.
Flavor_Text: Alternating Row/clean – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes: For Alternating Row/clean: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 250m Row (YGIY, P1 does 125m then P1 does 125m). 5 Squat Cleans (67/21.1 kgs) (YGIY). - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 500m Row (YGIY, P1 does 250m then P2 does 250m). 10 Squat Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY). - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 500m Row (YGIY, P1 does 250m then P2 does 250m). 10 Squat Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY). - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 500m Row (YGIY, P1 does 250m then P2 does 250m). 10 Squat Cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (YGIY). - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 500m row (ygiy, p1 does 250m then p2 does 250m). 10 squat cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (ygiy).
Instructions_Clean: 500m row (ygiy, p1 does 250m then p2 does 250m). 10 squat cleans (135/43.1 kgs) (ygiy).
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: The Sandbag Squat Tax
Description:
**The Sandbag Squat Tax (Dumbbell/Kettlebell, Team, AMRAP 16):**  
Teams work together for 16 minutes to complete as many reps as possible. Athletes squat with a sandbag, dumbbell, or kettlebell, engaging the entire lower body and core. One team member performs squats while others rest or rotate, promoting teamwork and endurance. This workout tests leg strength, stamina, and functional movement under load—maximizing calorie burn and building muscle. Suitable for all fitness levels by adjusting weight and rest intervals.
Flavor_Text: The Sandbag Squat Tax – Shared suffering; clean handovers and honest effort keep the team moving.
CoachNotes: For The Sandbag Squat Tax: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 5 Sandbag Front Squats (Heavy, YGIY). P1 performs a Wall Sit. Switch when P1 finishes set or P1 drops from wall. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 10 Sandbag Front Squats (Heavy, YGIY). P2 performs a Wall Sit. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops from wall. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 10 Sandbag Front Squats (Heavy, YGIY). P2 performs a Wall Sit. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops from wall. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 10 Sandbag Front Squats (Heavy, YGIY). P2 performs a Wall Sit. Switch when P1 finishes set or P2 drops from wall. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 10 sandbag front squats (heavy, ygiy). p2 performs a wall sit. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops from wall.
Instructions_Clean: 10 sandbag front squats (heavy, ygiy). p2 performs a wall sit. switch when p1 finishes set or p2 drops from wall.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Partner Run Penalty
Description: Partner Run Penalty is a team-based cardiovascular workout designed for time. Pairs run together, covering a set distance. Whenever one partner cannot keep up or stops, the team incurs a predetermined "penalty" (such as bodyweight exercises or extra distance). The objective is to complete the required running distance as quickly as possible, managing penalties through teamwork, endurance, and pacing. This workout fosters cooperation, accountability, and cardio conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Partner Run Penalty – Perfect for sharpening teamwork under controlled chaos.
CoachNotes: For Partner Run Penalty: Focus on consistent pacing, maintain proper form throughout, and scale appropriately to preserve workout stimulus. Break up reps strategically and prioritize breathing rhythm. See CrossFit.com for detailed guidance.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 800m Run (Together). Every time partners separate by more than 5 ft, both must stop and perform 2 Burpees. - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 1600m Run (Together). Every time partners separate by more than 10 ft, both must stop and perform 5 Burpees. - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 1600m Run (Together). Every time partners separate by more than 10 ft, both must stop and perform 5 Burpees. - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 1600m Run (Together). Every time partners separate by more than 10 ft, both must stop and perform 5 Burpees. - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 1600m run (together). every time partners separate by more than 10 ft, both must stop and perform 5 burpees.
Instructions_Clean: 1600m run (together). every time partners separate by more than 10 ft, both must stop and perform 5 burpees.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Deadly Dozen - Solo Run
Description: The "Deadly Dozen - Solo Run" is a benchmark running workout designed to test your speed, endurance, and mental grit. Complete either a set distance or race against the clock, striving for your personal best. This solo challenge helps gauge progress and build race-day confidence.
Flavor_Text: Deadly Dozen - Solo Run – Clean movement and sensible pacing will carry you further than heroics.
CoachNotes:
**  
Warm up thoroughly before starting. Focus on steady pacing—don’t surge too early. Maintain proper running form to maximize efficiency, especially as fatigue sets in. Record your time, effort level, and any challenges experienced. Use results to adjust future training and set realistic race goals. Cool down and stretch after completion.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: For Time (6 Rounds) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: For Time (12 Rounds) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: For Time (12 Rounds) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: For Time (12 Rounds) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: complete 12 rounds of: 400m run, followed by one of the 12 labours in order. the 12 labours are: 1) 240m farmers carry (2×24kg kb). 2) 60 reps kb deadlift (32kg kb). 3) 60m db lunge (2×12.5kg db). 4) 60 reps alt. db snatch (15kg db). 5) 60m burpee broad jump (bw). 6) 60 reps kb goblet squat (16kg kb). 7) 240m plate front carry (25kg plate). 8) 60 reps db push press (2×12.5kg db). 9) 120m bear crawl (bw). 10) 60 reps plate clean & press (15kg plate). 11) 180m plate overhead carry (15kg plate). 12) 20 reps db devil press (2×10kg db).
Instructions_Clean: for time (12 rounds)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Deadly Dozen - Pairs Race
Description: Deadly Dozen - Pairs Race is a benchmark team workout where partners race to complete 12 challenging movements as quickly as possible. Each pair splits the workload however they choose, pushing each other to maintain intensity and pace throughout the diverse, full-body circuit.
Flavor_Text: Deadly Dozen - Pairs Race – A team test where pacing and attitude are just as important as fitness.
CoachNotes:
**  
Emphasize communication and efficient transitions between partners for best results. Encourage athletes to strategize rep splits based on individual strengths. Maintain strong form, especially under fatigue, and keep water and towels nearby. Record total completion time for future benchmarking and progress tracking.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: For Time (6 Rounds) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: For Time (12 Rounds) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: For Time (12 Rounds) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: For Time (12 Rounds) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: team of 2. both partners run 400m together, then split the reps/distance of the labour in any way. the 12 labours are: 1) 240m farmers carry (2×24kg kb). 2) 60 reps kb deadlift (32kg kb). 3) 60m db lunge (2×12.5kg db). 4) 60 reps alt. db snatch (15kg db). 5) 60m burpee broad jump (bw). 6) 60 reps kb goblet squat (16kg kb). 7) 240m plate front carry (25kg plate). 8) 60 reps db push press (2×12.5kg db). 9) 120m bear crawl (bw). 10) 60 reps plate clean & press (15kg plate). 11) 180m plate overhead carry (15kg plate). 12) 20 reps db devil press (2×10kg db). (use male weights for mixed/male teams).
Instructions_Clean: for time (12 rounds)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Deadly Dozen - Deadly Row
Description: The Deadly Row is a high-intensity rowing benchmark where athletes aim to complete a set distance or achieve maximum meters in the shortest possible time. This cardio-focused workout challenges endurance, power, and technique, serving as a key race metric in the Deadly Dozen series.
Flavor_Text: Deadly Dozen - Deadly Row – A well-rounded test of fitness that punishes sloppiness, not just slowness.
CoachNotes: Maintain a strong, consistent stroke rate. Focus on explosive drive with the legs, steady core engagement, and a controlled recovery phase. Monitor pacing closely—start slightly conservative, then push your limits in the final third. Track metrics to compare performance over time and identify technique improvements.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: For Time (6 Rounds) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: For Time (12 Rounds) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: For Time (12 Rounds) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: For Time (12 Rounds) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: complete 12 rounds of: 400m row, followed by one of the 12 labours in order. (replaces the run journey with the row erg). the 12 labours are: 1) 240m farmers carry (2×24kg kb). 2) 60 reps kb deadlift (32kg kb). 3) 60m db lunge (2×12.5kg db). 4) 60 reps alt. db snatch (15kg db). 5) 60m burpee broad jump (bw). 6) 60 reps kb goblet squat (16kg kb). 7) 240m plate front carry (25kg plate). 8) 60 reps db push press (2×12.5kg db). 9) 120m bear crawl (bw). 10) 60 reps plate clean & press (15kg plate). 11) 180m plate overhead carry (15kg plate). 12) 20 reps db devil press (2×10kg db).
Instructions_Clean: for time (12 rounds)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Deadly Dozen - Deadly Strong
Description: Deadly Dozen – Deadly Strong is a race-format benchmark workout focused on maximum strength across twelve challenging movements. Designed to test total-body power and muscular endurance, athletes aim for speed, form, and performance progression.
Flavor_Text: Deadly Dozen - Deadly Strong – Simple structure, plenty of sting; effort and discipline set the tone.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize proper warm-up and movement mechanics. Emphasize quality reps and controlled breathing through heavy lifts. Scale load sensibly—intensity is key, but safety matters most. Track times and weights; rally effort, but maintain form under fatigue.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: For Time (All 6 Labours) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: For Time (All 12 Labours) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: For Time (All 12 Labours) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: For Time (All 12 Labours) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: complete all 12 labours in order for time, with no running or cardio in between. total volume: 480m of carries/crawls, 300 reps. the 12 labours are: 1) 240m farmers carry (2×24kg kb). 2) 60 reps kb deadlift (32kg kb). 3) 60m db lunge (2×12.5kg db). 4) 60 reps alt. db snatch (15kg db). 5) 60m burpee broad jump (bw). 6) 60 reps kb goblet squat (16kg kb). 7) 240m plate front carry (25kg plate). 8) 60 reps db push press (2×12.5kg db). 9) 120m bear crawl (bw). 10) 60 reps plate clean & press (15kg plate). 11) 180m plate overhead carry (15kg plate). 12) 20 reps db devil press (2×10kg db).
Instructions_Clean: for time (all 12 labours)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Deadly Dozen - DFT Run
Description: The Deadly Dozen - DFT Run is a high-intensity benchmark workout focused on testing and improving cardiovascular endurance and running speed. This session typically includes a set distance or timed tempo run performed at maximal sustainable effort, often used as a “race day” to gauge fitness progression for runners.
Flavor_Text: Deadly Dozen - DFT Run – A solid piece for building capacity without overcomplicating the session.
CoachNotes:
**  
Warm up thoroughly with dynamic stretches and light jogging before starting. Maintain an even pace, aiming for consistent splits, and focus on controlled breathing throughout. Push hard, but prioritize good running form: upright posture, relaxed shoulders, and strong cadence. Use this workout to assess your current running fitness—note your time and effort for future comparison. Cool down with easy jogging and stretching to aid recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: For Time (3 Rounds) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: For Time (6 Rounds) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: For Time (6 Rounds) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: For Time (6 Rounds) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 6 rounds: 400m run, followed by one of the 6 rep labours in order. the 6 labours are: 1) 60 reps kb deadlift (32kg kb). 2) 60 reps alt. db snatch (15kg db). 3) 60 reps kb goblet squat (16kg kb). 4) 60 reps db push press (2×12.5kg db). 5) 60 reps plate clean & press (15kg plate). 6) 20 reps db devil press (2×10kg db).
Instructions_Clean: for time (6 rounds)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Description.from:
**  
The Deadly Dozen - DFT Run is a high-intensity benchmark workout focused on testing and improving cardiovascular endurance and running speed. This session typically includes a set distance or timed tempo run performed at maximal sustainable effort, often used as a “race day” to gauge fitness progression for runners.

**
Description.to: The Deadly Dozen - DFT Run is a high-intensity benchmark workout focused on testing and improving cardiovascular endurance and running speed. This session typically includes a set distance or timed tempo run performed at maximal sustainable effort, often used as a “race day” to gauge fitness progression for runners.

CoachNotes.from:
**Description:**  
The Deadly Dozen - DFT Run is a high-intensity benchmark workout focused on testing and improving cardiovascular endurance and running speed. This session typically includes a set distance or timed tempo run performed at maximal sustainable effort, often used as a “race day” to gauge fitness progression for runners.

**CoachNotes:**  
Warm up thoroughly with dynamic stretches and light jogging before starting. Maintain an even pace, aiming for consistent splits, and focus on controlled breathing throughout. Push hard, but prioritize good running form: upright posture, relaxed shoulders, and strong cadence. Use this workout to assess your current running fitness—note your time and effort for future comparison. Cool down with easy jogging and stretching to aid recovery.
CoachNotes.to:
**  
Warm up thoroughly with dynamic stretches and light jogging before starting. Maintain an even pace, aiming for consistent splits, and focus on controlled breathing throughout. Push hard, but prioritize good running form: upright posture, relaxed shoulders, and strong cadence. Use this workout to assess your current running fitness—note your time and effort for future comparison. Cool down with easy jogging and stretching to aid recovery.

Flavor_Text.from: Deadly Dozen - DFT Run - A general conditioning (mixed stimulus) challenge that demands focus and grit.
Flavor_Text.to: Deadly Dozen - DFT Run – A solid piece for building capacity without overcomplicating the session.

Name: Deadly Dozen - DFT Team
Description: The Deadly Dozen - DFT Team is a challenging benchmark race workout designed for teams (male and/or mixed gender, standard or scaled). Teams work together to complete 12 sequential exercises for time, focusing on endurance, strength, and coordination. The format promotes teamwork, communication, and shared effort through varied movements.
Flavor_Text: Deadly Dozen - DFT Team – Trade work, trade lungs; push hard while your partner watches.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Review and assign roles based on teammates’ strengths to optimize efficiency.
- Communicate rep schemes and transitions clearly to avoid confusion.
- Encourage smooth pacing—start strong but reserve energy for the final exercises.
- Prioritize safe form, especially under fatigue.
- Remind athletes to support each other; motivation and strategy are keys to a top score.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: For Time (3 Rounds) - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: For Time (6 Rounds) - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: For Time (6 Rounds) - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: For Time (6 Rounds) - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: team of 2. both partners complete the "journey" (400m run, row, or ski) together, then split the reps of the labour. the 6 labours are: 1) 60 reps kb deadlift (32kg kb). 2) 60 reps alt. db snatch (15kg db). 3) 60 reps kb goblet squat (16kg kb). 4) 60 reps db push press (2×12.5kg db). 5) 60 reps plate clean & press (15kg plate). 6) 20 reps db devil press (2×10kg db).
Instructions_Clean: for time (6 rounds)
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or modify gymnastics (e.g., banded pull-ups, lighter KB, shortened run distances).
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Reactor-0
Description: Reactor-0 is a high-intensity, custom “For Time” workout designed to challenge your cardiovascular endurance and muscular stamina. Complete all prescribed movements and reps as quickly as possible. Pace yourself strategically and aim for unbroken sets where possible to minimize rest.
Flavor_Text: Reactor-0 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Warm up thoroughly before starting. Focus on proper form throughout each movement—quality over speed prevents injury. Break longer sets into manageable chunks if needed to avoid burnout. Track your time for future benchmarking. After finishing, cool down and stretch to assist recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 15 Pull-ups, 17 Handstand Push-ups, 6 Wall Balls - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 30 Pull-ups, 34 Handstand Push-ups, 12 Wall Balls - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 30 Pull-ups, 34 Handstand Push-ups, 12 Wall Balls - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 30 Pull-ups, 34 Handstand Push-ups, 12 Wall Balls - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 30 pull-ups, 34 handstand push-ups, 12 wall balls
Instructions_Clean: 30 pull-ups, 34 handstand push-ups, 12 wall balls
ScalingOptions: Scale Reactor-0 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Inferno-1
Description: Inferno-1 (Custom, EMOM 10) is a high-intensity interval workout structured as "Every Minute On the Minute" (EMOM) for 10 minutes. Each minute, you'll complete a specific exercise or set of reps as prescribed. The quicker you finish, the more rest you get before the next minute starts. This format boosts muscular endurance, cardiovascular fitness, and keeps you moving at a consistent pace.
Flavor_Text: Inferno-1 – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on quality movement and controlled breathing—EMOMs can be deceptively tough. Select weights and variations that challenge you but still allow for good form, especially as fatigue sets in. Use any remaining time each minute to shake out tension and reset your focus. Track your performance to gauge progress and help tailor future sessions. Warm up well, stay hydrated, and cool down properly post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 22 Box Jumps, 9 Deadlifts - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 44 Box Jumps, 18 Deadlifts - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 44 Box Jumps, 18 Deadlifts - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 44 Box Jumps, 18 Deadlifts - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 44 box jumps, 18 deadlifts
Instructions_Clean: 44 box jumps, 18 deadlifts
ScalingOptions: Scale Inferno-1 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Grinder-2
Description: Grinder-2 is a high-intensity, full-body workout performed for time. Expect a blend of challenging functional movements targeting strength and stamina. Move quickly but maintain good form throughout.
Flavor_Text: Grinder-2 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pacing—don't start too fast. Prioritize quality movement over speed, especially as fatigue sets in. Scale movements if necessary to maintain intensity. Record your time for future benchmarking. Warm-up well and cool down after.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Name: Reactor-3
Description: Reactor-3 is a 12-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout. Perform the prescribed exercises in sequence, repeating the circuit as many times as possible within 12 minutes. Focus on consistent pacing and quality movement throughout the session.
Flavor_Text: Reactor-3 – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes:
**  
Start with a thorough warm-up to prepare your joints and muscles. Prioritize proper technique over speed—maintain controlled movements and full range of motion. Pace yourself early to avoid burnout; aim for steady, uninterrupted rounds. Keep a bottle of water nearby and listen to your body—modify exercises if needed to maintain good form. Record your final round count to track progress over time. Cool down post-workout with light stretching.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 44 Clean and Jerks, 17 Wall Balls, 28 Box Jumps - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions_Clean: 44 clean and jerks, 17 wall balls, 28 box jumps
ScalingOptions: Scale Reactor-3 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Athletes complete a designated set of exercises and repetitions as quickly as possible, challenging both muscular and aerobic systems. This session emphasizes full-body movements and efficient pacing.
Flavor_Text: Phoenix-4 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent movement and proper form—don’t sacrifice technique for speed. Break reps into manageable sets with short, planned rest periods. Keep track of your time, but prioritize steady breathing and safe transitions between exercises. Remember to warm up thoroughly and cool down after completing the workout for optimal recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Name: Reactor-6
Description: Reactor-6 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) 10-minute workout. Each minute, complete 6 reps each of two chosen compound movements (e.g., 6 push-ups + 6 goblet squats). Once reps are finished, use the remaining time within the minute to rest. Repeat for 10 total rounds.
Flavor_Text: Reactor-6 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on good form during each rep. Choose weights or variations that challenge you but allow for unbroken sets. Pace yourself so you can finish reps within 40 seconds, leaving time for rest. Track movement quality and avoid rushing as you fatigue. Push hard, but prioritize consistent technique throughout all 10 rounds.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility
