Reactor-6 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) 10-minute workout. Each minute, complete 6 reps each of two chosen compound movements (e.g., 6 push-ups + 6 goblet squats). Once reps are finished, use the remaining time within the minute to rest. Repeat for 10 total rounds.

**CoachNotes:**  
Focus on good form during each rep. Choose weights or variations that challenge you but allow for unbroken sets. Pace yourself so you can finish reps within 40 seconds, leaving time for rest. Track movement quality and avoid rushing as you fatigue. Push hard, but prioritize consistent technique throughout all 10 rounds.
CoachNotes.to:
**  
Focus on good form during each rep. Choose weights or variations that challenge you but allow for unbroken sets. Pace yourself so you can finish reps within 40 seconds, leaving time for rest. Track movement quality and avoid rushing as you fatigue. Push hard, but prioritize consistent technique throughout all 10 rounds.

Flavor_Text.from: Reactor-6 - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Reactor-6 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.

Name: Voltage-7
Description: Voltage-7 is a high-intensity, custom circuit workout performed for time. It combines strength and conditioning exercises to challenge both muscular endurance and cardiovascular fitness. Participants complete a set number of rounds or repetitions as quickly as possible, focusing on maintaining proper form.
Flavor_Text: Voltage-7 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize good technique throughout the workout, even as you increase speed. Warm up thoroughly before starting, and scale movements as needed for your fitness level. Hydrate, pace yourself, and record your total time to track improvement. Cool down and stretch after finishing.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 19 Rowing, 9 Thrusters - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 38 Rowing, 18 Thrusters - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 38 Rowing, 18 Thrusters - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 38 Rowing, 18 Thrusters - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 38 rowing, 18 thrusters
Instructions_Clean: 38 rowing, 18 thrusters
ScalingOptions: Scale Voltage-7 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Ironwolf-8
Description: Ironwolf-8 is a high-intensity, custom "for time" workout designed to challenge overall strength, endurance, and mental toughness. Participants cycle through eight rounds of compound, bodyweight, and weighted exercises with minimal rest, striving to complete the full circuit as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form.
Flavor_Text: Ironwolf-8 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on controlled repetitions and efficient transitions between movements. Pace yourself early and avoid burnout—break reps into manageable sets if needed. Maintain strong posture, especially during weighted lifts, and prioritize range of motion. Have a water bottle and timer ready. If form begins to suffer, dial back intensity or adjust weights to stay safe and effective.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 14 Box Jumps, 15 Rowing - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 14 Box Jumps, 15 Rowing - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 14 box jumps, 15 rowing
Instructions_Clean: 14 box jumps, 15 rowing
ScalingOptions: Scale Ironwolf-8 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Grinder-9
Description: Grinder-9 is a high-intensity, custom for-time workout designed to challenge your strength, endurance, and mental grit. This workout typically includes a mix of functional movements performed in repeated sets or rounds, pushing you to complete all prescribed reps as quickly and efficiently as possible. Expect a combination of exercises such as squats, push-ups, burpees, or kettlebell swings—aiming for smooth transitions and minimal rest.
Flavor_Text: Grinder-9 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pacing throughout Grinder-9—avoid early burnout by starting at a steady, sustainable intensity. Maintain quality form on each rep, scaling movements as needed to prioritize safety. Break larger sets into manageable chunks and use controlled breathing to recover during transitions. Remember, your goal is to finish strong, so stay mentally engaged and push through the final reps. Celebrate your effort and time once complete!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 27 Running, 29 Snatches, 35 Box Jumps, 39 Thrusters - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 27 Running, 29 Snatches, 35 Box Jumps, 39 Thrusters - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 27 running, 29 snatches, 35 box jumps, 39 thrusters
Instructions_Clean: 27 running, 29 snatches, 35 box jumps, 39 thrusters
ScalingOptions: Scale Grinder-9 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Hammerfall-10
Description: Hammerfall-10 is a high-intensity, full-body workout designed to test strength, endurance, and mental resilience. Complete 10 challenging rounds as quickly as possible, prioritizing form and safe progression. Movements target major muscle groups while requiring both power and stamina.
Flavor_Text: Hammerfall-10 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself in the early rounds—avoid burning out too soon. Focus on efficient transitions and steady breathing. Modify weights or reps as needed to maintain proper technique. Hydrate before and after. Record your time for future progress tracking.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Name: Falcon-11
Description: Falcon-11 is a fast-paced, custom "for time" workout designed to test your endurance, strength, and mental grit. Complete all prescribed movements and repetitions as quickly as possible, focusing on maintaining proper form and consistent effort throughout.
Flavor_Text: Falcon-11 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Warm up thoroughly before starting. Pace yourself in the opening rounds—avoid sprinting out too fast. Break high-rep movements into manageable sets if needed, and keep transitions quick. Focus on controlled breathing, efficient movement, and good form, especially as you fatigue. Finish strong!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Name: Viper-12
Description: Viper-12 is an intense AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed in 18 minutes. It features a customized mix of functional movements designed to build strength, stamina, and cardio endurance. Each round challenges multiple muscle groups for a full-body burn.
Flavor_Text: Viper-12 – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize quality movement over speed, especially as fatigue sets in. Pace yourself early—aim for consistent effort each round. Focus on proper form to maximize benefits and minimize injury risk. Breathe steadily and use transitions for quick recovery. Adjust weights or reps as needed for your fitness level.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

ScalingOptions: Scale Viper-12 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.

Name: Ironwolf-13
Description: Ironwolf-13 is a high-intensity, bodyweight workout performed for time. Complete 13 unbroken rounds of the following sequence: 4 push-ups, 8 sit-ups, and 13 air squats per round. The goal is to finish all rounds as quickly as possible, sustaining consistent pace while maintaining proper form.
Flavor_Text: Ironwolf-13 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on quality reps and efficient transitions between exercises. Maintain proper push-up form (chest to floor), controlled sit-ups (shoulder blades touch ground), and full-depth squats (hips below parallel). Pace yourself to avoid early burnout, but challenge your limits. Keep rest periods minimal. Log your completion time for progress tracking.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Name: Phoenix-14
Description: Phoenix-14 is a high-intensity, custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 12 minutes. It challenges both strength and endurance, blending functional movements for a full-body, time-efficient session. Suitable for all fitness levels, participants cycle through a set of targeted exercises, aiming to complete as many quality rounds as possible within the time cap.
Flavor_Text: Phoenix-14 – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Maintain proper form, especially as fatigue sets in—quality over quantity. Pace yourself in the first few minutes; avoid burning out early. Focus on controlled breathing to maximize endurance. Record your total rounds and reps to track progress and set future goals. Rest only as needed, and modify movements to fit your ability level while still challenging yourself.

Name: Thunderbolt-16
Description: Thunderbolt-16 is a 12-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout, custom-designed for intensity and versatility. Athletes cycle through a sequence of functional movements targeting strength and conditioning. Focus on strong, consistent pacing as you accumulate as many quality rounds as possible within the time cap.
Flavor_Text: Thunderbolt-16 – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize excellent form over speed—quality reps trump quantity. Break movements into manageable sets to avoid early burnout. Keep transitions efficient and use steady breathing to maintain your rhythm. Scale load or intensity as needed to minimize rest and maximize active time. Record your score and use it as a benchmark for future progress.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Name: Grinder-19
Description: Grinder-19 is an 18-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout designed to build strength, endurance, and mental grit. This custom circuit challenges both upper and lower body through a balanced combination of compound movements, pushing you to maintain intensity and good form throughout the duration.
Flavor_Text: Grinder-19 – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself from the start—find a steady rhythm and avoid burning out early. Prioritize quality movement over speed, ensuring each rep is controlled and precise. Breathe consistently and shake out your limbs as needed to reduce fatigue. Remember, this workout tests your ability to stay consistent under fatigue, so dig deep and push through when it gets tough while keeping technique sharp.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Instructions: 46 deadlifts, 13 burpees
Instructions_Clean: 46 deadlifts, 13 burpees
ScalingOptions: Scale Grinder-19 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Falcon-20
Description: Falcon-20 is a high-intensity, bodyweight circuit designed to be completed as quickly as possible (“For Time”). This workout includes 20 repetitions each of push-ups, air squats, burpees, sit-ups, and jumping lunges. It targets full-body strength and cardiovascular endurance, making it ideal for athletes seeking a quick, effective challenge.
Flavor_Text: Falcon-20 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Maintain proper form throughout—quality over speed. Warm up well to prevent injury, especially for dynamic movements. Pace yourself early; breaking reps into manageable sets can prevent burnout. Focus on breathing and core engagement, particularly during burpees and lunges. Cool down with stretching after finishing. Record your time to track progress and aim to improve in future sessions.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Wall Balls, 13 Kettlebell Swings, 10 Pull-ups - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Wall Balls, 26 Kettlebell Swings, 20 Pull-ups - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Wall Balls, 26 Kettlebell Swings, 20 Pull-ups - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Wall Balls, 26 Kettlebell Swings, 20 Pull-ups - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 wall balls, 26 kettlebell swings, 20 pull-ups
Instructions_Clean: 15 wall balls, 26 kettlebell swings, 20 pull-ups
ScalingOptions: Scale Falcon-20 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

The goal is to complete as many rounds as possible while maintaining proper form throughout.

Description: Rampage-24 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) 10-minute workout featuring 2-4 compound exercises performed for a fixed number of reps each minute. This fast-paced format promotes intensity, muscular endurance, and calorie burn within a compact timeframe.
Flavor_Text: Rampage-24 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on quality movement and consistent pacing. Adjust reps to finish each round with at least 10-15 seconds to rest. Prioritize full range of motion and stable form, especially as fatigue sets in. Scale weights or reps as needed to maintain intensity without compromising technique.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 7 Deadlifts, 14 Wall Balls - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 15 Deadlifts, 29 Wall Balls - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 15 Deadlifts, 29 Wall Balls - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 15 Deadlifts, 29 Wall Balls - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 15 deadlifts, 29 wall balls for time
Instructions_Clean: 15 deadlifts, 29 wall balls complete the following for time
ScalingOptions: Scale Rampage-24 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Havoc-25
Description: Havoc-25 is a high-intensity, 12-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout designed to challenge your strength, endurance, and mental grit. In this custom circuit, you'll cycle through a set sequence of movements, repeating as many full rounds as possible before time expires. Track your rounds to measure progress over time.
Flavor_Text: Havoc-25 – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Start with a dynamic warm-up to prep your body. Pace yourself early—aim for steady, unbroken sets. Focus on quality reps, tight form, and deep breathing throughout. If fatigue sets in, prioritize short, efficient rest breaks over extended pauses. Log your score and any modifications for future reference. Give your best effort and finish strong!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 21 Kettlebell Swings, 23 Burpees, 10 Handstand Push-ups - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 42 Kettlebell Swings, 46 Burpees, 20 Handstand Push-ups - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 42 Kettlebell Swings, 46 Burpees, 20 Handstand Push-ups - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 42 Kettlebell Swings, 46 Burpees, 20 Handstand Push-ups - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 42 kettlebell swings, 46 burpees, 20 handstand push-ups
Instructions_Clean: 42 kettlebell swings, 46 burpees, 20 handstand push-ups
ScalingOptions: Scale Havoc-25 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Nitro-26
Description: Nitro-26 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge your full body and cardiovascular endurance. Complete all prescribed movements and repetitions as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form and technique.
Flavor_Text: Nitro-26 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: Push your pace, but prioritize efficient movement and breath control. Break reps into manageable sets if needed, aiming for minimal rest. Have a timer ready and record your finish time to track progress on future attempts. Stay hydrated and perform a thorough cool-down after completion.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 17 Running, 17 Pull-ups, 5 Clean and Jerks - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 35 Running, 35 Pull-ups, 10 Clean and Jerks - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 35 Running, 35 Pull-ups, 10 Clean and Jerks - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 35 running, 35 pull-ups, 10 clean and jerks
Instructions_Clean: 35 running, 35 pull-ups, 10 clean and jerks
ScalingOptions: Scale Nitro-26 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Falcon-27
Description: Falcon-27 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 10 minutes. Each minute, you'll complete a set sequence of bodyweight and functional movements, then rest for the remainder of the minute. This high-intensity structure boosts cardio fitness and muscular endurance.
Flavor_Text: Falcon-27 – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes:
**  
Choose variations and reps that challenge you, but allow at least 15 seconds rest each round. Focus on explosive movement quality, strong form, and steady breathing. Scale exercises as needed; consistency and good technique matter most. Track your reps for progressive improvement in future sessions.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 27 Wall Balls, 10 Thrusters, 10 Double-unders, 39 Running - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 27 wall balls, 10 thrusters, 10 double-unders, 39 running
Instructions_Clean: 27 wall balls, 10 thrusters, 10 double-unders, 39 running
ScalingOptions: Scale Falcon-27 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Stormbreaker-28
Description: Stormbreaker-28 is a high-intensity, custom “For Time” workout designed to challenge strength, endurance, and mental grit. The session combines functional movements such as squats, push-ups, and compound lifts in a rapid sequence. The goal is to complete all prescribed rounds and repetitions as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form throughout.
Flavor_Text: Stormbreaker-28 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Warm up with dynamic stretches and activation drills to prep your body.
- Pace yourself strategically; break up reps early to avoid burnout.
- Focus on efficient transitions between movements to minimize downtime.
- Maintain good technique, even as fatigue sets in—quality over speed.
- Track your finish time to measure progress over future sessions.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 29 Clean and Jerks, 23 Pull-ups, 27 Bike Erg - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 29 clean and jerks, 23 pull-ups, 27 bike erg
Instructions_Clean: 29 clean and jerks, 23 pull-ups, 27 bike erg
ScalingOptions: Scale Stormbreaker-28 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Havoc-29
Description: Havoc-29 is a custom high-intensity AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed for 18 minutes. Challenge yourself to complete as many rounds as possible of a set circuit, focusing on maximizing effort and maintaining good form throughout. This session is designed to boost endurance, stamina, and full-body strength.
Flavor_Text: Havoc-29 – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early, but strive for consistent movement—short pauses are okay, but avoid long rests. Prioritize clean technique, especially as fatigue sets in. Keep a steady breathing rhythm and break big sets into manageable reps if needed. Aim to record your rounds for future progress tracking. Hydrate before and after, and cool down with light stretching.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

ScalingOptions: Scale Havoc-29 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.

Name: Hammerfall-30
Description: Hammerfall-30 is a custom, high-intensity for-time workout that challenges full-body strength, endurance, and mental toughness. Complete 30 rounds as quickly as possible, with each round combining kettlebell swings, push-ups, and box jumps. The workout is designed to develop explosive power, cardiovascular capacity, and muscular stamina.
Flavor_Text: Hammerfall-30 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace your efforts—avoid sprinting early rounds. Focus on form, especially during swings and box jumps. Break reps into manageable sets to prevent burnout. Modify movements or reps to maintain safety and quality throughout all 30 rounds. Track your time for future progress and remember to cool down and stretch post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

This "For Time" session requires you to complete 32 total rounds as quickly as possible, featuring a combination of functional movements and short rest intervals. Each round pushes cardiovascular capacity and muscular stamina, making it ideal for experienced athletes seeking a demanding test.

CoachNotes.from:
**Description:**  
Rampage-32 is a high-intensity, custom workout designed to challenge strength, endurance, and mental grit. This "For Time" session requires you to complete 32 total rounds as quickly as possible, featuring a combination of functional movements and short rest intervals. Each round pushes cardiovascular capacity and muscular stamina, making it ideal for experienced athletes seeking a demanding test.

**CoachNotes:**  
Pace yourself early—avoid burnout by breaking the rounds into manageable sets. Focus on maintaining consistent form, especially as fatigue sets in. Prioritize safe movement standards over speed and utilize efficient transitions. Hydrate well before and after the session, and scale movements as needed for your ability. Remember: quality over quantity leads to better progress and injury prevention.

Name: Thunderbolt-33
Description: Thunderbolt-33 is a high-intensity custom workout designed for time, challenging both strength and cardiovascular endurance. Athletes complete 33 reps each of three core movements (e.g., burpees, kettlebell swings, and box jumps), racing against the clock to finish as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: Thunderbolt-33 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: Maintain proper form even at speed—focus on full range of motion for each rep. Pace yourself early to avoid burning out; steady effort beats starting too fast. Prioritize safe landings on jumps and strong core engagement on all movements. Record your time for future benchmarking and progress tracking.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Titan-34
Description: Titan-34 is a 12-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout designed to test your endurance and strength. Perform a custom sequence of full-body exercises repeatedly for 12 minutes, aiming to complete as many rounds as you can. Each round targets multiple muscle groups to build power, stamina, and mental grit.
Flavor_Text: Titan-34 – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pacing—avoid sprinting early to ensure you maintain quality reps throughout. Prioritize proper form to reduce injury risk, especially as you become fatigued. Track your rounds to monitor progress and aim to beat your score in future sessions. Stay hydrated and warm up thoroughly before starting.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 15 Deadlifts, 14 Kettlebell Swings, 18 Box Jumps - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 31 Deadlifts, 29 Kettlebell Swings, 36 Box Jumps - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 31 Deadlifts, 29 Kettlebell Swings, 36 Box Jumps - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 31 Deadlifts, 29 Kettlebell Swings, 36 Box Jumps - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 31 deadlifts, 29 kettlebell swings, 36 box jumps
Instructions_Clean: 31 deadlifts, 29 kettlebell swings, 36 box jumps
ScalingOptions: Scale Titan-34 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Blaze-35
Description: Blaze-35 is a high-intensity, 35-minute custom workout using an EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) format for 10 minutes. Each minute features a challenging movement or combo, promoting strength, endurance, and metabolic conditioning. Designed to push your limits and maximize calorie burn in a short session.
Flavor_Text: Blaze-35 – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent form and effort each round; choose weights and movements allowing you 10–20 seconds rest per minute. Hydrate before and after. Adjust intensity by scaling reps or load. Track completed rounds for progress. Push hard, but prioritize good technique throughout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 33 Handstand Push-ups, 21 Kettlebell Swings, 43 Box Jumps - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 33 Handstand Push-ups, 21 Kettlebell Swings, 43 Box Jumps - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 33 handstand push-ups, 21 kettlebell swings, 43 box jumps
Instructions_Clean: 33 handstand push-ups, 21 kettlebell swings, 43 box jumps
ScalingOptions: Scale Blaze-35 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Thunderbolt-36
Description: Thunderbolt-36 is a custom Every Minute On the Minute (EMOM) workout lasting 10 minutes. Each minute, you'll perform a targeted set of exercises designed to maximize intensity and efficiency within the time cap. This workout challenges strength, speed, and endurance, pushing you to maintain quality reps under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: Thunderbolt-36 – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes:
**  
Stay disciplined with your pacing—aim for consistent output each minute. Focus on quality movement and full range of motion. Know your limits, but don’t be afraid to push the pace if you're finishing comfortably each round. Use any spare time within the minute for active recovery: regulate your breathing and prepare for the next set. Adjust load and intensity to match your current fitness level.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 23 Kettlebell Swings, 43 Thrusters, 32 Rowing, 50 Snatches - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 23 Kettlebell Swings, 43 Thrusters, 32 Rowing, 50 Snatches - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 23 kettlebell swings, 43 thrusters, 32 rowing, 50 snatches
Instructions_Clean: 23 kettlebell swings, 43 thrusters, 32 rowing, 50 snatches
ScalingOptions: Scale Thunderbolt-36 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Reactor-37
Description: Reactor-37 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 18 minutes. Athletes repeat a designated sequence of functional bodyweight and/or weighted movements continuously, aiming for maximum rounds and repetitions before time expires. This format emphasizes conditioning, muscular endurance, and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Reactor-37 – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early—avoid sprinting the first few rounds. Focus on smooth, consistent movement quality and efficient transitions between exercises. Track your rounds and reps to measure progress. Prioritize form over speed, scaling weights and reps as needed to keep moving. Stay focused on breathing, and push hard in the final minutes while maintaining good technique.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 22 Pull-ups, 9 Deadlifts - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 44 Pull-ups, 19 Deadlifts - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 44 Pull-ups, 19 Deadlifts - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 44 pull-ups, 19 deadlifts
Instructions_Clean: 44 pull-ups, 19 deadlifts
ScalingOptions: Scale Reactor-37 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Each minute, you perform a prescribed exercise or circuit, aiming for consistent effort and quality reps. Expect a blend of strength and conditioning moves designed for maximum efficiency within a short timeframe.
Flavor_Text: Viper-38 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:

Name: Grinder-39
Description: Grinder-39 is a high-intensity, custom workout designed to test your full-body strength and cardiovascular endurance. Complete all prescribed movements as quickly as possible (“For Time”). The challenge pushes your limits with varied functional exercises, aiming for total body fatigue and maximum calorie burn.
Flavor_Text: Grinder-39 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early—avoid sprinting the first round. Maintain proper form to prevent injury, especially under fatigue. Break reps into manageable sets and use controlled breathing to support sustained effort. Record your finishing time and note any scaling. Focus on consistency and a strong finish.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 16 Rowing, 33 Thrusters, 19 Wall Balls - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 16 Rowing, 33 Thrusters, 19 Wall Balls - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 16 rowing, 33 thrusters, 19 wall balls
Instructions_Clean: 16 rowing, 33 thrusters, 19 wall balls
ScalingOptions: Scale Grinder-39 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Ironwolf-40
Description: Ironwolf-40 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge both strength and conditioning. Complete 40 repetitions each of four compound movements: push-ups, air squats, burpees, and mountain climbers (each leg counts as one rep), aiming to finish as quickly as possible while maintaining good form.
Flavor_Text: Ironwolf-40 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize full range of motion in every rep for best results. Keep transitions between exercises quick but controlled to maintain a steady pace. Scale reps or modify movements (e.g., knee push-ups) if necessary without compromising form. Warm up beforehand and cool down after. Track your time to measure progress in future sessions. Focus on even breathing and efficient movement patterns throughout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 22 Box Jumps, 43 Kettlebell Swings, 35 Thrusters - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Prioritize full range of motion in every rep for best results. Keep transitions between exercises quick but controlled to maintain a steady pace. Scale reps or modify movements (e.g., knee push-ups) if necessary without compromising form. Warm up beforehand and cool down after. Track your time to measure progress in future sessions. Focus on even breathing and efficient movement patterns throughout.
CoachNotes.to:
**  
Prioritize full range of motion in every rep for best results. Keep transitions between exercises quick but controlled to maintain a steady pace. Scale reps or modify movements (e.g., knee push-ups) if necessary without compromising form. Warm up beforehand and cool down after. Track your time to measure progress in future sessions. Focus on even breathing and efficient movement patterns throughout.

Flavor_Text.from: IronWolf-40 - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Ironwolf-40 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.

Name: Nitro-42
Description: Nitro-42 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 12 minutes. Push yourself to complete as many quality rounds of the prescribed movements as possible within the time limit. This high-intensity format builds cardiovascular endurance, muscular stamina, and mental toughness.

**

Breathe steadily, and minimize rest between rounds, but listen to your body to prevent sloppy technique. Record your final round count and use it as a baseline for future efforts.

The session combines strength and conditioning exercises performed sequentially. The goal is to complete all prescribed repetitions as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form.

CoachNotes:  
Warm up thoroughly to prepare joints and raise heart rate. Pace yourself strategically—open strong but avoid early burnout. Focus on efficient movement and quick transitions between exercises. Maintain quality reps, especially when fatigued. Track your time for future progress checks, and cool down properly after completion.

Name: Phoenix-50
Description: Phoenix-50 is a high-intensity, customized AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 12 minutes. The session blends full-body strength with metabolic conditioning, focusing on dynamic compound movements to maximize calorie burn and muscular endurance. Every round targets major muscle groups to promote balanced development.
Flavor_Text: Phoenix-50 – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize technique over speed to prevent fatigue-induced form breakdown. Choose a challenging, sustainable pace—rest only if needed. Scale movements for safety and intended intensity. Have all equipment ready before starting; log completed rounds for progress tracking. Adjust weights or reps to match your fitness level and goals. Push hard but listen to your body!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10 Kettlebell Swings, 17 Running, 7 Clean and Jerks - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 20 Kettlebell Swings, 35 Running, 15 Clean and Jerks - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Kettlebell Swings, 35 Running, 15 Clean and Jerks - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Kettlebell Swings, 35 Running, 15 Clean and Jerks - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20 kettlebell swings, 35 running, 15 clean and jerks
Instructions_Clean: 20 kettlebell swings, 35 running, 15 clean and jerks
ScalingOptions: Scale Phoenix-50 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Reactor-51
Description: Reactor-51 is a high-intensity, custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 12 minutes. Athletes cycle through a tailored set of movements, aiming to complete as many rounds and reps as possible within the time cap. The structure promotes conditioning, stamina, and muscular endurance.
Flavor_Text: Reactor-51 – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace consistently from the start—don’t go out too hot in the first few rounds. Focus on controlled movement quality, especially as you fatigue. Prioritize full range of motion and safe technique. Keep transitions tight to maximize rounds, and make note of your score for future benchmarking. Scale movements as needed to maintain intensity throughout the 12 minutes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 24 Rowing, 24 Handstand Push-ups, 16 Burpees, 21 Snatches - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 48 Rowing, 49 Handstand Push-ups, 33 Burpees, 43 Snatches - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 48 Rowing, 49 Handstand Push-ups, 33 Burpees, 43 Snatches - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 48 Rowing, 49 Handstand Push-ups, 33 Burpees, 43 Snatches - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 48 rowing, 49 handstand push-ups, 33 burpees, 43 snatches
Instructions_Clean: 48 rowing, 49 handstand push-ups, 33 burpees, 43 snatches
ScalingOptions: Scale Reactor-51 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Havoc-52
Description: Havoc-52 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to push your cardiovascular endurance and total-body strength. Complete all prescribed movements and repetitions as quickly as possible, maintaining proper form throughout. This workout targets multiple muscle groups and elevates your heart rate for maximum calorie burn.
Flavor_Text: Havoc-52 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Warm up thoroughly before starting. Pace yourself early—avoid burnout, but don’t rest too long between sets. Focus on full range of motion and safe technique. Stay hydrated and track your finish time for future progress. Cool down and stretch after completion to aid recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 24 Deadlifts, 12 Running, 19 Pull-ups - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 48 Deadlifts, 25 Running, 38 Pull-ups - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 48 Deadlifts, 25 Running, 38 Pull-ups - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 48 Deadlifts, 25 Running, 38 Pull-ups - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 48 deadlifts, 25 running, 38 pull-ups
Instructions_Clean: 48 deadlifts, 25 running, 38 pull-ups
ScalingOptions: Scale Havoc-52 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high.

Name: Viper-53
Description: Viper-53 is a high-intensity, custom workout designed for time. It features a challenging mix of full-body compound movements and metabolic conditioning. The routine aims to improve strength, power, and cardiovascular endurance, with a focus on functional fitness. Suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes seeking a versatile and result-driven session.
Flavor_Text: Viper-53 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize form over speed—maintain technique, especially under fatigue. Scale weights or reps as needed to preserve intensity without compromising safety. Warm up thoroughly and mobilize major muscle groups before starting. Pace yourself strategically: break reps into manageable sets with short, planned rest intervals. Cool down and stretch post-workout for optimal recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

ScalingOptions: Scale Viper-53 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.

Name: Stormbreaker-54
Description: Stormbreaker-54 is a high-intensity, custom “for time” workout designed to challenge both strength and endurance. Complete the specified sequence of exercises—such as functional movements, plyometrics, and weighted lifts—as quickly as possible, focusing on quality form. The workout is scalable, making it suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes.
Flavor_Text: Stormbreaker-54 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early and use steady, controlled movements to prevent fatigue. Prioritize correct technique, especially under fatigue, to reduce injury risk. Break up larger sets into manageable reps and focus on efficient transitions between exercises. Keep water nearby and monitor your heart rate. Log your time to track progress on future attempts.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Name: Hammerfall-55
Description: Hammerfall-55 is a custom, high-intensity EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 10 minutes. Each minute, perform a set sequence of functional movements, focusing on maximum effort and maintaining consistent form. This workout blends strength and cardio elements, challenging muscular endurance and cardiovascular conditioning in a short, effective session.
Flavor_Text: Hammerfall-55 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize proper technique, especially as fatigue sets in. Scale reps or modify movements as needed for your fitness level. Engage your core, control your breathing, and push for consistent pacing each minute. Warm up thoroughly beforehand and cool down afterward to aid recovery and reduce injury risk.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Name: Havoc-56
Description: Havoc-56 is a challenging, 12-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout designed to test your endurance, strength, and mental grit. You’ll cycle through a custom combination of functional movements, aiming to complete as many quality rounds as possible within the time frame. This session prioritizes intensity and efficient movement, making it ideal for athletes looking to improve metabolic conditioning and push performance boundaries.
Flavor_Text: Havoc-56 – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on smooth transitions between movements and maintain consistent pacing throughout the 12 minutes—avoid sprinting at the start. Prioritize good form to minimize fatigue-related mistakes. Scale the workout as needed for your ability, and track your rounds for future benchmarking. Stay strong and embrace the challenge; the goal is to keep moving!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Name: Stormbreaker-57
Description: Stormbreaker-57 is a high-intensity, custom For Time workout designed to challenge both strength and conditioning. It features a dynamic blend of compound lifts, explosive bodyweight movements, and cardio intervals. The goal: complete all prescribed rounds and reps as fast as possible while maintaining top form under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: Stormbreaker-57 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Pace early and break up big sets to prevent burnout.  
- Focus on efficient transitions between movements.  
- Prioritize full range of motion on all reps for maximum benefit.  
- Monitor breathing—steady inhales/exhales will keep oxygen flowing.  
- Scale movements or weights if form breaks down; quality over speed.  
- Record finish time for future benchmarking and progression tracking.

Track your time for future progress and use functional movements throughout.

Warm up thoroughly and cool down after to support recovery.

Name: Inferno-79
Description: Inferno-79 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) workout performed for 10 minutes. Each minute, complete a set sequence of high-intensity exercises, aiming for maximum effort with minimal rest. The session is designed to boost metabolic conditioning and muscular endurance within a short timeframe.
Flavor_Text: Inferno-79 – Control the early minutes and let clean movement carry you late.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on perfect form and pacing—start strong, but conserve enough energy to maintain quality work each round. Scale movements or reps as needed to ensure consistent completion within the minute. Prioritize safe technique as fatigue sets in, and use any remaining seconds to recover before the next cycle begins.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Instructions_Clean: 29 thrusters, 28 wall balls, 25 clean and jerks
ScalingOptions: Scale Inferno-79 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Eclipse-80
Description: Eclipse-80 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 10 minutes. At the start of every minute, complete a specific exercise or set of repetitions as prescribed. The focus is on maintaining intense effort with short recovery periods to boost cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, and overall conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Eclipse-80 – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself to complete each minute’s effort with some rest before the next round. Quality over speed: use proper form throughout to maximize results and prevent injury. Modify movement or intensity if needed, but aim for consistent work each minute. Track reps if the goal is progression in future sessions. Don’t forget a thorough warm-up before and cool-down afterward.

**CoachNotes:**  
Focus on smooth transitions between exercises to minimize rest and maintain intensity. Pace yourself early; don’t go out too hard in the first few minutes. Prioritize good technique—quality reps beat quick, sloppy ones. Track your rounds for future progress. Embrace the challenge, breathe deeply, and push through the discomfort as you get stronger each round.

Flavor_Text.from: Stormbreaker-83 - Expect sharp efforts and quick transitions; small mistakes add up.
Flavor_Text.to: Stormbreaker-83 – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.

Name: Hammerfall-84
Description: Hammerfall-84 is a custom 10-minute EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout. Each minute, perform a set of prescribed exercises with intensity, then rest for the remainder of the minute. The routine blends functional strength and conditioning, designed to boost muscular endurance and metabolic fitness in a short, focused timeframe.
Flavor_Text: Hammerfall-84 – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize form over speed—quality reps yield better results. Select weights or intensity levels that remain challenging but sustainable across all rounds. Move powerfully during work phases, then use rest periods to recover with deep, steady breathing. Adjust reps or load as needed to maintain good technique throughout the EMOM.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 19 Snatches, 45 Wall Balls, 21 Deadlifts, 43 Handstand Push-ups - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 19 Snatches, 45 Wall Balls, 21 Deadlifts, 43 Handstand Push-ups - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 19 snatches, 45 wall balls, 21 deadlifts, 43 handstand push-ups
Instructions_Clean: 19 snatches, 45 wall balls, 21 deadlifts, 43 handstand push-ups
ScalingOptions: Scale Hammerfall-84 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Phoenix-85
Description: Phoenix-85 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to push your endurance, strength, and mental toughness. Tackle a challenging series of functional movements performed as quickly and accurately as possible. The focus is on maximizing performance while maintaining quality form.
Flavor_Text: Phoenix-85 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early--avoid burnout in the first half. Prioritize movement efficiency and keep transitions tight. Break reps before fatigue sets in, especially on compound lifts. Maintain steady breathing and monitor technique closely to prevent injury. Record your finish time and note areas to improve.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Name: Ironwolf-86
Description: Ironwolf-86 is an 18-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout, designed to boost muscular endurance and cardiovascular fitness. Participants cycle through a custom sequence of bodyweight and functional exercises, aiming for maximum rounds within the time cap. This session prioritizes intensity, pacing, and full-body conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Ironwolf-86 – A grinder; steady round times beat one big opening sprint.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on steady pacing from the start—avoid burning out early. Maintain good form as fatigue sets in; quality reps are more valuable than speed alone. Breathe consistently and manage transitions efficiently between exercises. Scale movements as needed to ensure continuous work. Track rounds and reps to measure progress for future sessions.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

ScalingOptions: Scale Ironwolf-86 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.

Name: Inferno-87
Description: Inferno-87 is a fast-paced, high-intensity custom workout designed to push your limits. Challenge yourself to complete a demanding sequence of functional movements as quickly as possible. Focus on maintaining form while attacking each round, racing against the clock for your best time.
Flavor_Text: Inferno-87 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Warm up thoroughly before starting. Pace yourself early, but keep intensity high. Emphasize quality reps over speed as you fatigue. Modify movements as needed, but keep transitions quick. Record your finish time for future progress tracking. Stay hydrated, breathe deep, and push hard—Inferno-87 is meant to ignite your inner fire.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Name: Stormbreaker-92

Name: Stormbreaker-94
Description: Stormbreaker-94 is an intense, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge your strength, endurance, and mental toughness. This workout blends functional movements—such as power cleans, burpees, and running—performed in a chipper style, meaning all reps of one movement are completed before moving to the next. The goal: finish every rep as fast as possible, with proper form.
Flavor_Text: Stormbreaker-94 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Attack Stormbreaker-94 with a steady pace; resist the urge to sprint out of the gate. Focus on efficient movement patterns, especially during high-rep exercises. Break sets as needed to avoid burnout. Prioritize controlled breathing and smooth transitions. Remember: quality reps reduce risk of injury and improve your overall time. Log your results for progress tracking and recovery insight.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 8 Deadlifts, 6 Rowing, 11 Thrusters - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 17 Deadlifts, 12 Rowing, 22 Thrusters - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 17 Deadlifts, 12 Rowing, 22 Thrusters - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 17 Deadlifts, 12 Rowing, 22 Thrusters - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 17 deadlifts, 12 rowing, 22 thrusters
Instructions_Clean: 17 deadlifts, 12 rowing, 22 thrusters
ScalingOptions: Scale Stormbreaker-94 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Titan-95
Description: Titan-95 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) workout, lasting 10 minutes. Each minute, perform a set sequence of compound functional movements at high intensity. The focus is on total body strength, cardiovascular endurance, and efficient calorie burn, making it suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes.
Flavor_Text: Titan-95 – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes: Maintain strict timing: start each set at the top of the minute and use remaining time for rest. Prioritize quality form over speed. Select weight/intensity so that sets are challenging but doable within 40–45 seconds, leaving 15–20 seconds to recover. Track your reps for progress. Scale movements or load as needed to preserve your technique throughout the EMOM. Stay hydrated and warm up thoroughly.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Name: Voltage-96
Description: Voltage-96 is a high-intensity, 12-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout. Combining strength and cardio, it challenges you to complete a set circuit of functional movements repeatedly within the time cap. The emphasis is on speed, consistency, and proper form throughout each round.
Flavor_Text: Voltage-96 – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early—start steady to avoid burnout halfway through. Focus on clean technique, especially as fatigue sets in. Prioritize full range of motion over rushing through reps. Use controlled breathing to maintain energy and aim for consistent round splits. Track your rounds to push for a strong finish in the final minutes.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Instructions_Clean: 14 box jumps, 27 bike erg, 26 kettlebell swings
ScalingOptions: Scale Voltage-96 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Havoc-97
Description: Havoc-97 is a high-intensity, custom workout performed for time. Athletes complete a series of challenging functional movements as quickly as possible. The session is designed to test strength, endurance, and mental grit, pushing participants to maintain intensity from start to finish.
Flavor_Text: Havoc-97 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.

Record your time and note any scaling for future progress tracking.

Name: Reactor-98
Description: Reactor-98 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) 10-minute workout designed to maximize intensity and efficiency. Each minute, perform a set number of reps for prescribed exercises, then rest for the remainder of the minute. The goal is to complete the work quickly and maintain consistent output across all rounds.
Flavor_Text: Reactor-98 – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on explosive, high-quality reps from the start. Stay consistent with pacing—avoid burnout by going too fast in early rounds. Prioritize form to reduce injury risk and maximize gains. Use any remaining time in the minute to recover, preparing for the next round. Adjust rep counts or modify movements as needed to finish each set within 40–45 seconds. Track performance for future progress.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Name: Thunderbolt-99
Description: Thunderbolt-99 is a high-intensity, timed workout designed to build endurance, speed, and full-body strength. Participants complete 99 total reps of each movement as fast as possible, rotating through exercises such as squats, push-ups, sit-ups, and jump lunges. The aim is to maintain proper form while pushing your cardiovascular limits for a total-body challenge. Suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes.
Flavor_Text: Thunderbolt-99 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early—avoid burning out in the first rounds. Focus on perfect form and consistent breathing to maximize performance and minimize injury risk. Break reps into manageable sets with short rests. Track your time to monitor progress and adjust strategies in future attempts. Scale movements or rep counts for newer athletes if needed. Finish strong—mental grit counts as much as physical ability.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Description: Jaguar-100 is a high-intensity, custom “For Time” workout designed to build strength, cardiovascular endurance, and grit. Complete 100 total reps of assigned functional movements as quickly and efficiently as possible. Aim for consistent pacing and quality movement throughout.
Flavor_Text: Jaguar-100 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.

Name: Ironwolf-101
Description: Ironwolf-101 is a custom, full-body EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 10 minutes. Each minute, perform a designated exercise or rep scheme, then rest for the remainder of the minute. Great for boosting endurance, strength, and mental toughness in a short, intense session.
Flavor_Text: Ironwolf-101 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on maintaining proper form throughout every round, as intensity can cause fatigue quickly. Scale reps or movements if needed to ensure you complete each set within 40-45 seconds, leaving time for rest. EMOMs challenge your stamina and discipline; stay consistent and track your progress over time.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 24 Kettlebell Swings, 19 Handstand Push-ups - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 24 kettlebell swings, 19 handstand push-ups
Instructions_Clean: 24 kettlebell swings, 19 handstand push-ups
ScalingOptions: Scale Ironwolf-101 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Nitro-102
Description: Nitro-102 is a high-intensity, custom-designed workout structured for time. Perform the prescribed exercises as quickly as possible, focusing on maintaining proper form and consistent effort throughout. The goal is to complete all rounds and repetitions in the shortest time, challenging both strength and cardiovascular endurance.
Flavor_Text: Nitro-102 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Warm up thoroughly to prepare your muscles and joints. Pace yourself strategically—avoid going out too fast to prevent burnout. Prioritize full range of motion and proper technique over speed. Keep transitions efficient and track your time for future benchmarking. Cool down and stretch post-workout for optimal recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Name: Eclipse-103

This session combines bodyweight exercises and functional movements to challenge cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, and core stability. Athletes are encouraged to move efficiently while maintaining good form throughout.
Flavor_Text: Eclipse-103 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.

Name: Rampage-105
Description: Rampage-105 is a high-intensity, full-body workout performed for time. Athletes move quickly through 105 total reps split across several functional movements, pushing cardio capacity and muscular endurance.
Flavor_Text: Rampage-105 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Maintain consistent pacing from the start. Prioritize quality movement; don’t sacrifice form for speed. Break reps into manageable sets, minimizing rest. Record finish time—aim to improve with each attempt. Warm up joints, especially shoulders and hips, before starting. Cool down and stretch after completing Rampage-105.

Name: Cyclone-108
Description: Cyclone-108 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge your cardiovascular endurance, muscular stamina, and mental toughness. Complete 108 reps of select functional movements, cycling through them in sequence until all reps are finished as quickly as possible. This workout emphasizes both speed and consistency, making it ideal for athletes seeking an all-in-one conditioning test.
Flavor_Text: Cyclone-108 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early while maintaining strong, efficient movement patterns. Break reps into manageable sets to avoid burnout. Focus on good form, especially as fatigue sets in. Track your splits per movement to identify improvement areas. Hydrate well before and after; a thorough warm-up and cool-down are essential to optimize performance and recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Name: Phoenix-111
Description: Phoenix-111 is a custom, high-intensity, "For Time" workout designed to push both strength and endurance limits. Athletes perform a challenging sequence of functional movements as quickly as possible, focusing on proper form and consistency throughout. The workout targets full-body conditioning and is adaptable for various fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Phoenix-111 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself in the early rounds—avoid burning out too soon. Maintain good technique, especially under fatigue; quality reps matter more than speed. Break up sets as needed to prevent form breakdown. Breathe steadily and stay mentally tough. Scale movements or reps if necessary to suit your ability. Record your finish time and reflect on pacing for future improvement.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Name: Stormbreaker-112
Description: Stormbreaker-112 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed for 18 minutes. Participants cycle through a set sequence of functional movements, aiming to complete as many quality rounds as possible within the time cap. The session emphasizes full-body strength, endurance, and intensity.
Flavor_Text: Stormbreaker-112 – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early; don’t go out too fast. Prioritize solid technique over speed, especially as fatigue sets in. Keep transitions tight and minimize downtime. Focus on steady breathing and intentional movement. Modify exercises as needed for your fitness level. Record rounds and reps to track progress for future benchmarks.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Instructions_Clean: 42 thrusters, 22 wall balls, 15 double-unders
ScalingOptions: Scale Stormbreaker-112 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Inferno-113
Description: Inferno-113 is a high-intensity workout designed to push your limits by combining functional movements at maximum effort, completed as quickly as possible. This workout emphasizes conditioning, strength, and mental toughness, challenging both aerobic and anaerobic systems. Customizable to various fitness levels, Inferno-113 is perfect for those seeking a fiery, results-driven session.
Flavor_Text: Inferno-113 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on efficient movement and steady pacing—avoid going out too fast. Prioritize quality reps and maintain form, even under fatigue. Break up larger sets early if needed to prevent burnout. Stay hydrated and prepare your equipment ahead of time. Remember, consistency and determination through discomfort are key to maximizing this “for time” challenge.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Instructions_Clean: 17 kettlebell swings, 39 bike erg, 21 box jumps

Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Nitro-115
Description: Nitro-115 is a high-intensity, custom “for time” workout designed to rapidly improve cardiovascular endurance, power, and muscular stamina. Athletes complete the prescribed movements and repetitions as fast as possible, focusing on efficient transitions and maintaining good form throughout. This workout is scalable for all fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Nitro-115 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
- Prioritize correct technique to avoid injury, especially as fatigue sets in.  
- Break movements into manageable sets with brief rest if necessary, but push your pace.  
- Prepare equipment and space for quick transitions.  
- Warm up thoroughly to raise heart rate and activate target muscles.  
- Track your time and use it as a benchmark for future improvement.  
- Stay mentally focused—consistency and effort are key to maximum benefit.

Description.from:
Description:  
Jaguar-117 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge both strength and cardiovascular endurance. Participants cycle through a series of compound movements, aiming to complete all prescribed repetitions as quickly as possible while maintaining proper technique and form.

CoachNotes:  
Focus on efficient movement and pacing—start with controlled intensity to avoid early fatigue. Prioritize quality reps and full range of motion, especially when under fatigue. Use modifications as needed to maintain form. Hydrate before and after, and cool down with stretching to aid recovery.

Participants cycle through a series of compound movements, aiming to complete all prescribed repetitions as quickly as possible while maintaining proper technique and form.

Name: Thunderbolt-118
Description: Thunderbolt-118 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to push your strength, speed, and endurance. Complete all prescribed rounds and reps as quickly as possible, focusing on maintaining proper form and consistent effort throughout.
Flavor_Text: Thunderbolt-118 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early—go out strong, but avoid burning out in the first round. Prioritize quality movement, especially as fatigue sets in. Break reps into manageable sets if needed, and use transitions strategically to recover. Have water ready and track your split times for future progress.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Name: Voltage-119
Description: Voltage-119 is a high-intensity, custom ‘For Time’ workout designed to maximize cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, and metabolic conditioning. Athletes aim to complete a prescribed set of functional movements as quickly and efficiently as possible. Movements can include combinations of bodyweight, weighted, and plyometric exercises tailored to individual goals and fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Voltage-119 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on proper movement mechanics throughout the session, prioritizing quality over speed to reduce injury risk. Warm up thoroughly before starting and pace yourself during the workout—push intensity but listen to your body. Stay consistent with transitions between exercises to maintain momentum. Track your time to monitor progress and encourage healthy competition with yourself or others. Cool down with mobility and stretching post-workout to aid recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions
