Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 13 Kettlebell Swings, 17 Handstand Push-ups, 22 Bike Erg, 11 Thrusters - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 13 Kettlebell Swings, 17 Handstand Push-ups, 22 Bike Erg, 11 Thrusters - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 13 kettlebell swings, 17 handstand push-ups, 22 bike erg, 11 thrusters
Instructions_Clean: 13 kettlebell swings, 17 handstand push-ups, 22 bike erg, 11 thrusters
ScalingOptions: Scale Voltage-119 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Aim for unbroken swings if possible; hinge from the hips.

Name: Nitro-120
Description: Nitro-120 is a high-intensity, custom “For Time” workout designed to push your endurance and power. Complete a set workload as quickly as possible, focusing on speed, consistency, and proper movement patterns to challenge both cardiovascular fitness and muscular stamina.
Flavor_Text: Nitro-120 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Maintain steady pacing from the start; avoid burning out early. Focus on efficient movement and controlled breathing. Break reps into manageable sets if needed, but minimize rest. Prioritize good form and full range of motion for every rep. Track your time to measure progress and motivate self-improvement in future sessions.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Name: Blaze-121
Description: Blaze-121 is a custom, high-intensity AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed in 12 minutes. It blends strength and cardio exercises to boost endurance, build muscle, and torch calories. Move quickly between movements, aiming to complete as many quality rounds as possible within the time cap.
Flavor_Text: Blaze-121 – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pacing from start to finish—avoid sprinting the first few minutes. Maintain proper form, especially as you fatigue. Keep transitions between exercises fast but controlled. Track rounds to measure progress over time, and modify movements as needed to match your fitness level. Stay hydrated and cool down after completion.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Name: Thunderbolt-122
Description: Thunderbolt-122 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) 10-minute workout. Each minute, perform a specific set of exercises as prescribed, maximizing intensity while maintaining form. With short, structured intervals, this session sharpens cardiovascular fitness, boosts muscular endurance, and delivers efficient calorie burn.
Flavor_Text: Thunderbolt-122 – Interval-style intensity that tests composure under mounting fatigue.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on quality reps and smooth transitions between movements. Use the first 10-15 seconds to perform your set, then utilize the remaining time for recovery. Scale repetitions or modify movements as needed to ensure you can safely maintain intensity for all 10 rounds. Track your completion each minute to monitor progress and enhance accountability.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 14 Snatches, 40 Handstand Push-ups, 12 Clean and Jerks - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

ScalingOptions: Scale Thunderbolt-122 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Voltage-123
Description: Voltage-123 is a custom 18-minute AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout that challenges both strength and cardiovascular endurance. Designed to keep intensity high, athletes cycle through functional full-body movements, maximizing effort and technique within the time cap. Suitable for all levels with scaling options.
Flavor_Text: Voltage-123 – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pacing to avoid early burnout—aim for steady movement, not speed sprints. Prioritize full range of motion and safe technique, especially as fatigue sets in. Maintain quality reps and quick, intentional transitions between exercises. Remember to monitor your breathing and take short, strategic rests when necessary. Log rounds and partial reps for tracking progress.

Name: Hammerfall-124
Description: Hammerfall-124 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) 18-minute workout. Push your limits as you cycle through a challenging circuit of bodyweight and functional movements designed to test both stamina and total-body strength. The goal is to complete as many quality rounds as you can before the clock runs out. Great for conditioning and building mental grit.
Flavor_Text: Hammerfall-124 – Treat it like a long fight: relaxed breathing, tidy movement, no panic.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early—avoid burnout in the first half. Focus on smooth, controlled reps and minimize transition time between movements. Maintain good form, especially when fatigued. If needed, modify exercises to keep moving. Track your rounds and aim to match or exceed your personal best next time. Stay hydrated and cool down thoroughly post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Name: Phoenix-128
Description: Phoenix-128 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout challenge performed over 18 minutes. Athletes cycle through a set sequence of functional movements designed to maximize total rounds completed within the time cap. This workout targets endurance, strength, and mental grit, delivering a full-body conditioning session.
Flavor_Text: Phoenix-128 – Chip away each round with smooth transitions and smart breaks.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on steady pacing—partition reps if needed to maintain good form and avoid burnout early. Prioritize quality movement, especially under fatigue. Use modifications or scaling options where necessary to maintain intensity but keep moving. Track rounds and partial reps for benchmarking progress in future sessions. Stay hydrated and cool down properly post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

Name: Viper-129
Description: Viper-129 is a custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge your strength, endurance, and cardiovascular fitness. The routine integrates compound movements and functional exercises to work multiple muscle groups efficiently, promoting muscle growth and fat loss. Suitable for intermediate to advanced athletes, the goal is to complete all prescribed reps and rounds as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form.
Flavor_Text: Viper-129 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on consistent pacing – start strong but avoid burning out early. Prioritize full range of motion and quality reps, especially as fatigue sets in. Break reps into manageable sets if needed, with short, strategic rests. Maintain steady breathing, and stay mindful of core engagement throughout. Scale movements or weights as required to ensure safety and effectiveness. Record your completion time to track progress and set goals for future sessions.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 13 Thrusters, 29 Clean and Jerks, 43 Box Jumps - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Name: Voltage-130
Description: Voltage-130 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) 18-minute workout designed to challenge full-body strength, power, and endurance. Athletes complete a prescribed sequence of movements—such as squats, push-ups, and kettlebell swings—cycling through as many quality rounds as possible within the time limit.
Flavor_Text: Voltage-130 – Volume adds up fast, so break early and stay moving.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on steady pacing from the start; avoid early burnout. Prioritize good form—especially on compound lifts—to maximize efficiency and minimize injury risk. Quick, controlled transitions between movements will boost round count. Scale weights or reps to maintain intensity throughout the entire 18 minutes. Finish strong—aim to increase speed slightly in the final 3 minutes!
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 10 Wall Balls, 22 Snatches, 7 Clean and Jerks, 12 Bike Erg - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 20 Wall Balls, 45 Snatches, 15 Clean and Jerks, 25 Bike Erg - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 20 Wall Balls, 45 Snatches, 15 Clean and Jerks, 25 Bike Erg - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 20 wall balls, 45 snatches, 15 clean and jerks, 25 bike erg
Instructions_Clean: 20 wall balls, 45 snatches, 15 clean and jerks, 25 bike erg
ScalingOptions: Scale Voltage-130 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Blaze-131
Description: Blaze-131 is a high-intensity AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 12 minutes. This custom session challenges your full body with a mix of strength and cardio movements, designed to maximize calorie burn, build muscular endurance, and improve overall conditioning. Move efficiently from one exercise to the next, aiming to complete as many rounds as possible within the time cap.
Flavor_Text: Blaze-131 – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on maintaining proper form as you fatigue — quality over speed. Pace yourself at the start so you can sustain effort through all 12 minutes. Keep transitions between movements quick, but controlled. Track rounds and reps for progress. Modify exercises as needed to fit your ability or training environment. Remember to breathe and push your limits, but listen to your body.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 22 Deadlifts, 32 Bike Erg - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 22 deadlifts, 32 bike erg
Instructions_Clean: 22 deadlifts, 32 bike erg
ScalingOptions: Scale Blaze-131 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Maintain neutral spine; use mixed grip for heavy sets if needed.

Name: Havoc-132
Description: Havoc-132 is a high-intensity EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) workout lasting 10 minutes. Each minute, you’ll complete a set circuit of custom functional movements, aiming for consistent effort and speed. The goal is to maximize reps and maintain form throughout each interval.
Flavor_Text: Havoc-132 – Short, punchy intervals that reward tight pacing and crisp transitions.
CoachNotes: Push to finish each round quickly, using any remaining seconds for recovery. Prioritize form over speed, especially as fatigue sets in. Thunderbolt-134 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge your strength, speed, and endurance. Complete all prescribed movements and repetitions as quickly as possible. Focus on maintaining proper form while pushing for your best time.

Name: Voltage-135
Description: Voltage-135 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to test strength, power, and endurance. Participants complete a prescribed set of functional movements as quickly as possible, focusing on proper form while pushing intensity. Exercises may include barbell lifts, plyometrics, and cardio intervals.
Flavor_Text: Voltage-135 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: Move with purpose but do not sacrifice technique for speed. Break up reps early if needed to avoid burnout. Warm up thoroughly, especially shoulders and hips. Prioritize controlled breathing and steady pacing—quick early splits can lead to fatigue. Record your time to track progress and aim to improve next session.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Name: Cyclone-136
Description: Cyclone-136 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge cardiovascular endurance and full-body strength. Athletes will cycle through a combination of functional movements—including squats, push-ups, and cardio bursts—with the goal of completing all prescribed reps as quickly as possible.
Flavor_Text: Cyclone-136 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: Focus on steady pacing to avoid early fatigue. Prioritize good form, especially as you tire, to prevent injury. Break reps into manageable sets and monitor your breathing throughout. Record your completion time as a benchmark, and use it to track progress in future sessions. Warm up thoroughly before starting and allow time to cool down and stretch after the workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility

Name: Raptor-137
Description: Raptor-137 is a high-intensity, custom "For Time" workout designed to challenge both strength and cardiovascular endurance. Participants complete a set sequence of functional bodyweight and weighted movements as quickly as possible. The workout features cyclical and compound exercises to maximize intensity, power output, and conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Raptor-137 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on maintaining consistent pacing throughout the workout—avoid burning out early. Prioritize safe, efficient form, especially as fatigue sets in. Break large rep schemes into manageable sets with short rests. Breathe steadily and use transitions to recover briefly. Scale movements as needed to preserve workout intent and intensity. Record your time for future progress tracking.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups

Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 29 Pull-ups, 50 Box Jumps, 35 Thrusters, 17 Rowing - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 29 Pull-ups, 50 Box Jumps, 35 Thrusters, 17 Rowing - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 29 pull-ups, 50 box jumps, 35 thrusters, 17 rowing
Instructions_Clean: 29 pull-ups, 50 box jumps, 35 thrusters, 17 rowing
ScalingOptions: Scale Raptor-137 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Use kip efficiently; consider banded pull-ups to keep turnover high. Break thrusters into manageable sets; keep front rack tight.

Name: Reactor-138
Description: Reactor-138 is a high-intensity, for-time workout designed to test strength, endurance, and speed. Athletes will move through a series of compound movements with minimal rest, aiming to complete the prescribed work as quickly as possible. The workout structure challenges both aerobic capacity and muscular resilience.
Flavor_Text: Reactor-138 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Prioritize efficient movement mechanics to maintain pace without sacrificing form. Break up reps early if needed to avoid burnout. Monitor your breathing, and implement brief, strategic rests during transitions. Scale load and intensity based on current ability. Remember: consistent pacing outperforms early sprinting. Warm up well beforehand and cool down post-workout for optimal recovery.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8

Name: Havoc-139
Description: Havoc-139 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute On the Minute) 10-minute workout designed for high-intensity, focused training. Each minute, complete a set exercise or rep scheme, then rest for the remainder of the minute. The aim is to maintain form and maximize effort throughout all 10 rounds.
Flavor_Text: Havoc-139 – Manageable work, small windows; don’t waste time between stations.
CoachNotes:
**  
Choose compound movements (e.g., burpees, kettlebell swings, push-ups) to maximize results. Adjust reps or weight so each interval challenges you but allows at least 15 seconds rest per minute. Consistent pacing and proper technique are key. Track your reps for future progress and modify as needed for your fitness level.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Shoulder activation: band pull-aparts, push-up progressions

ScalingOptions: Scale Havoc-139 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint.

Name: Eclipse-140
Description: Eclipse-140 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 18 minutes. Athletes cycle through a set sequence of functional movements, maximizing rounds completed within the time cap. The focus is on intensity, efficiency, and maintaining consistent effort across all rounds.
Flavor_Text: Eclipse-140 – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself early and prioritize quality movement over speed. Break up reps to avoid burnout, especially for larger sets. Keep transitions tight and limit rest between movements. Track rounds for pacing, but don’t compromise form for reps. Hydrate well and cool down with mobility work post-workout.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike)

Name: Raptor-142
Description: Raptor-142 is a custom EMOM (Every Minute on the Minute) 10-minute workout. Each minute, perform a set list of functional exercises at a challenging but sustainable pace, maximizing effort while preserving form. Ideal for building work capacity, cardiovascular fitness, and muscular endurance in a short time frame.
Flavor_Text: Raptor-142 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.
CoachNotes:
**  
Focus on quality movement with each rep. Choose exercise variations and weights that allow completion in 35-45 seconds, leaving time to recover before the next minute begins. Maintain consistent pacing, breathe rhythmically, and scale intensity if fatigue causes form breakdown. Track rounds and reps to monitor progress over time.

Focus on quality movement with each rep. Choose exercise variations and weights that allow completion in 35-45 seconds, leaving time to recover before the next minute begins. Maintain consistent pacing, breathe rhythmically, and scale intensity if fatigue causes form breakdown. Track rounds and reps to monitor progress over time.

Flavor_Text.from: Raptor-142 - A interval power / strength-endurance challenge that demands focus and grit.
Flavor_Text.to: Raptor-142 – Stay sharp each round; smooth reps and quick resets beat hero bursts.

Name: Hammerfall-143
Description: Hammerfall-143 is a custom AMRAP (As Many Rounds As Possible) workout performed over 12 minutes. Push through a circuit of functional exercises, aiming for maximum rounds and reps. Ideal for building muscular endurance and cardiovascular capacity.
Flavor_Text: Hammerfall-143 – Pure mixed-modal engine work; consistency across rounds is the real score.
CoachNotes:
**  
Pace yourself from the start but keep intensity high. Focus on clean form, especially as fatigue sets in. Track your rounds to measure progress over time. Remember to breathe consistently and use efficient transitions between movements.
Warmup: 5-10m 0s general cardio (row/jog/bike); Hip hinge mobility: kettlebell deadlift warm-up, Romanian deadlift 3x8; Air squats and goblet squats progression, ankle mobility; Scapular pull-ups, ring rows or banded pull-ups; Strides or ramped efforts for 6x20s

Scaling_Tiers.Beginner: 23 Running, 11 Wall Balls, 7 Snatches, 6 Pull-ups - Beginner: lighter loads, banded/assistance, reduced volume.
Scaling_Tiers.Intermediate: 46 Running, 22 Wall Balls, 15 Snatches, 12 Pull-ups - Intermediate: moderate loads, standard scaling.
Scaling_Tiers.Advanced: 46 Running, 22 Wall Balls, 15 Snatches, 12 Pull-ups - Advanced: Rx or add weight/tempo.
Scaling_Tiers.Limited Equipment: 46 Running, 22 Wall Balls, 15 Snatches, 12 Pull-ups - Limited equipment: substitute barbells with dumbbells/kettlebells, row with running.

Instructions: 46 running, 22 wall balls, 15 snatches, 12 pull-ups
Instructions_Clean: 46 running, 22 wall balls, 15 snatches, 12 pull-ups
ScalingOptions: Scale Hammerfall-143 by reducing weight, reps, or rounds. Substitute movements as needed. Consult with a coach for personalized scaling recommendations.
Coaching_Cues: Pace the workout according to the time domain; avoid all-out opening bursts unless short sprint. Set a rhythm and target the top of the wall mark consistently.

Name: Michael
Description: "Michael" is a classic CrossFit benchmark WOD (Workout of the Day) designed to test and build your cardiovascular endurance, core stability, and posterior chain strength. The workout consists of three rounds for time of 800-meter runs, 50 back extensions, and 50 sit-ups. The combination of running and high-rep bodyweight movements challenges both aerobic and muscular endurance, making "Michael" a demanding yet scalable workout suitable for all levels. Expect a strong metabolic effect and an excellent test of grit and pacing.
Flavor_Text: Michael – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Michael: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: see crossfit.com for official michael workout instructions and standards.
Instructions_Clean: Complete 3 rounds for time of: 800m run, 50 back extensions, 50 sit-ups. Follow official CrossFit standards for each movement.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Kelly
Description: Kelly is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout designed to improve cardiovascular endurance, muscular stamina, and mental toughness. This challenging "For Time" workout consists of five rounds of a 400-meter run, 30 box jumps (24/20 in), and 30 wall ball shots (20/14 lbs, 10/9 ft). Athletes move through each movement as quickly and safely as possible, testing both aerobic capacity and full-body coordination. Kelly is suitable for all fitness levels with scalable options.

CoachNotes: For Kelly: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.

Name: Blake
Description: "Blake" is a Hero WOD (Workout of the Day) designed to enhance overall functional strength, stamina, and endurance. Athletes aim to complete all prescribed movements as quickly as possible ("for time"), balancing speed with proper form. The workout challenges multiple muscle groups and tests cardiovascular fitness, making it suitable for those seeking a demanding full-body session and honoring a hero’s legacy.
Flavor_Text: Blake – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Blake: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: see crossfit.com for official blake workout instructions and standards.
Instructions_Clean: Complete 30 squat cleans at 135/95 lbs for time. Perform each rep with proper squat depth and full extension.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Nancy
Description: ancy is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout performed for time. It combines running with overhead squats to test cardiovascular endurance, strength, and stability. Name: Daniel
Description:
"Daniel" is a classic CrossFit Hero WOD designed to test and build both metabolic conditioning and muscular endurance. The workout is performed for time with the following sequence:  
- 50 pull-ups  
- 400-meter run  
- 21 thrusters (95/65 lbs)  
- 800-meter run  
- 21 thrusters (95/65 lbs)  
- 400-meter run  
- 50 pull-ups  

This workout honors Sgt. 1st Class Daniel Crabtree and challenges your grip, stamina, and mental toughness. It delivers a full-body workout, targeting the upper body, lower body, and cardiovascular system. Adjust movements and weights as needed to match your fitness level. The goal is to complete all repetitions and runs as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form.
Flavor_Text: Daniel – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Daniel: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: see crossfit.com for official daniel workout instructions and standards.
Instructions_Clean: Complete 5 rounds for time of: 50 back squats (155/105 lb), 7 muscle-ups, 10 handstand push-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Griff
Description:
"Griff" is a classic Hero WOD (Workout of the Day) designed to test your conditioning, speed, and coordination. Completed for time, you’ll alternate running laps both forwards and backwards, challenging your cardiovascular system and engaging different muscle groups. The workout is straightforward but highly demanding, making it ideal for athletes seeking to develop endurance, agility, and mental grit.

Workout format:
- 800 meter run
- 400 meter run (backwards)

Name: Filthy Fifty
Description: The Filthy Fifty is a high-intensity, benchmark CrossFit workout designed to test total body endurance, strength, and stamina. Athletes perform 50 repetitions each of 10 different functional movements for time. Movements typically include box jumps, jumping pull-ups, kettlebell swings, walking lunges, knees-to-elbows, push presses, back extensions, wall balls, burpees, and double-unders, completed consecutively. This challenging chipper-style workout demands pacing, mental grit, and versatile fitness.
Flavor_Text: Filthy Fifty – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Filthy Fifty: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
MovementTypes: Jumping, Pulling, Swinging, Lunging, Core, Pressing, Extension, Throwing, Burpee, Jump Rope
Instructions: Complete 50 reps of each of the following 10 exercises as fast as possible: Box Jumps (24/20 in), Jumping Pull-ups, Kettlebell Swings (35/26 lbs), Walking Lunge Steps, Knees to Elbows, Push Press (45/35 lbs), Back Extensions, Wall Balls (20/14 lbs), Burpees, Double-Unders.
Instructions_Clean: Perform 50 repetitions of each exercise in sequence: box jumps, jumping pull-ups, kettlebell swings, walking lunges, knees to elbows, push press, back extensions, wall balls, burpees, and double-unders. Complete the workout as quickly as possible.

Description.from:
**Description:**  
The Bear is a full-body, high-intensity barbell complex performed for time. It involves cycling through a sequence of six movements: power clean, front squat, push press, back squat, and another push press from behind the neck, repeated without resting the barbell on the ground. This workout challenges strength, endurance, and technique, delivering a demanding cardio and muscular endurance session. The goal is to complete the assigned rounds or repetitions as quickly as possible while maintaining proper form.

Flavor_Text.from: The Bear - An effective CrossFit workout.

Name: Klepto
Description:
**Workout Name:** Klepto (General, For Time)

**Description:**  
Klepto is a high-intensity CrossFit workout designed to test your endurance, speed, and power. For time, complete 4 rounds of:  
- 27 Box jumps (24/20 in)  
- 20 Burpees  
- 11 Squat cleans (145/100 lbs)  

Aim to finish all 4 rounds as quickly as possible. Focus on quick transitions, maintaining consistent form, and managing your pacing to complete the workout efficiently. This WOD challenges your lower-body explosiveness, cardiovascular capacity, and strength.
Flavor_Text: Klepto – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Klepto: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Angie
Description: Angie is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout performed for time. The workout consists of completing 100 pull-ups, 100 push-ups, 100 sit-ups, and 100 air squats in order. Athletes must finish all reps of one movement before proceeding to the next. The goal is to complete all 400 reps as quickly as possible, emphasizing endurance, bodyweight strength, and stamina.
Flavor_Text: Angie – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Angie: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: Complete 100 pull-ups, 100 push-ups, 100 sit-ups, and 100 air squats for time. Perform all reps of each movement before moving to the next.
Instructions_Clean: For time, complete 100 pull-ups, then 100 push-ups, followed by 100 sit-ups, and finally 100 air squats.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Tabata Something Else
Description: "Tabata Something Else" is a high-intensity CrossFit benchmark workout designed to improve muscular endurance and overall conditioning. Performed for time, it consists of 8 rounds of 20 seconds of work followed by 10 seconds of rest per exercise (pull-ups, push-ups, sit-ups, air squats), completing all rounds of one movement before moving to the next. The focus is on achieving the maximum number of quality reps in each interval, promoting stamina, fat loss, and cardiovascular fitness. No equipment beyond a pull-up bar is required, making it ideal for varied fitness levels.
Flavor_Text: Tabata Something Else – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Tabata Something Else: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Kalsu
Description:
Kalsu is a high-intensity, for-time workout that combines strength and cardio, challenging both mental toughness and physical endurance. The workout consists of 100 barbell thrusters (135/95 lbs), starting every minute with 5 burpees. Athletes aim to complete all thrusters as quickly as possible, performing 5 burpees at the start of each minute until finished.  

**Schema enrichment suggestions:**  
- Workout Type: For Time  
- Movements: Barbell Thrusters, Burpees  
- Equipment: Barbell, Plates  
- RX Weights: 135 lbs (male) / 95 lbs (female)  
- Target Areas: Total Body, Cardio, Strength  
- Difficulty: Advanced  
- Time Domain: 10-30 minutes  
- Scoring: Total Time to Completion

Name: Death by Burpees
Description: Death by Burpees is an intense, progressive workout challenge designed to test endurance and stamina. Each minute, perform one additional burpee: 1 burpee in minute 1, 2 in minute 2, and so on, continuing until you can no longer complete the required burpees within the minute. Rest for the remainder of each minute after completing the repetitions. The workout ends when you fail to finish all burpees before the next minute starts. This workout is suitable for all fitness levels and provides an effective full-body conditioning session.
Flavor_Text: Death by Burpees – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Death by Burpees: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Coe
Description: "Coe (General, For Time)" is a benchmark CrossFit workout designed to build strength, muscular endurance, and mental toughness. Athletes complete ten rounds for time, each round consisting of 10 shoulder-to-overhead presses (95/65 lb) and 10 ring push-ups. The workout emphasizes upper body pushing strength and stamina, challenging both the shoulders and triceps. "Coe" is scalable for all fitness levels by adjusting weights or push-up variations.

Name: Open Workout 12.1
Description: Open Workout 12.1 is a classic CrossFit challenge completed for maximum reps in 7 minutes. Athletes perform as many burpees as possible within the time cap. A rep is counted each time the chest and thighs touch the floor, and the athlete jumps and touches a target 6 inches above maximum reach. This workout tests conditioning, muscular endurance, and mental toughness.
Flavor_Text: Open Workout 12.1 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Open Workout 12.1: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.

Name: Barbara

Each round consists of 20 pull-ups, 30 push-ups, 40 sit-ups, and 50 air squats, with a 3-minute rest between rounds. Designed to build muscular endurance and aerobic capacity, "Barbara" challenges your stamina, upper and lower body strength, and core stability. The workout is scalable for all fitness levels.

Name: King Kong
Description: King Kong is an iconic CrossFit benchmark workout designed to test maximal strength, technical skill, and power. It’s a “for time” workout featuring heavy lifts and advanced gymnastics, challenging athletes to complete multiple rounds as quickly as possible. Typically, King Kong consists of 3 rounds of: 1 deadlift (455/320 lbs), 2 muscle-ups, 3 squat cleans (250/175 lbs), and 4 handstand push-ups. This workout demands advanced technique and strength across several movements, pushing athletes to their limits while emphasizing speed, efficiency, and safety under heavy loads.

Name: Hidalgo
Description: Hidalgo is a challenging Hero WOD performed for time. The workout includes a 2-mile run, 20 squat cleans (135/95 lb), 20 box jumps (24/20 in), 20 walking lunges with a plate (45/25 lb), 20 push-ups, and ends with another 2-mile run. This high-volume endurance test pushes both strength and stamina, honoring fallen hero U.S. Army First Lieutenant Jorge Hidalgo. Scale as needed for experience and fitness level.
Flavor_Text: Hidalgo – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Hidalgo: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.

Name: Open 19.5

Open 19.5 is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout designed for time, challenging both strength and endurance. The workout consists of 33-27-21-15-9 reps for time of: thrusters and chest-to-bar pull-ups. Athletes alternate between thrusters (95/65 lb) and chest-to-bar pull-ups, completing all reps at each descending rep scheme before moving to the next. Open 18.4 is a CrossFit benchmark workout combining high-repetition deadlifts and handstand push-ups, followed by heavier deadlifts and handstand walks, all performed for time. Open 14.5 is a classic CrossFit workout completed "for time," meaning you perform all prescribed reps as quickly as possible. The workout consists of descending rounds of 21-18-15-12-9-6-3 reps of two movements:  
- Thrusters (95/65 lb)  
- Bar-Facing Burpees  

Athletes alternate between thrusters and bar-facing burpees, completing all reps of both movements in each round before moving to the next. Deegan (General, For Time) is a high-intensity functional workout designed to build strength, endurance, and mental toughness. Complete prescribed rounds or repetitions of varied full-body movements—such as squats, push-ups, and running—as quickly as possible. Prioritize proper form, consistent pacing, and minimal rest to achieve your fastest time. Suitable for all fitness levels with scalable options.
Description.to: Deegan (General, For Time) is a high-intensity functional workout designed to build strength, endurance, and mental toughness. Complete prescribed rounds or repetitions of varied full-body movements—such as squats, push-ups, and running—as quickly as possible. Prioritize proper form, consistent pacing, and minimal rest to achieve your fastest time. Suitable for all fitness levels with scalable options.

Flavor_Text.from: Deegan - An effective CrossFit workout.
Flavor_Text.to: Deegan – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.

Name: Heavy Cindy
Description: Heavy Cindy is a high-intensity, bodyweight-based CrossFit workout performed “for time,” with added weight to make the movements more challenging. The workout consists of multiple rounds of 5 weighted pull-ups, 10 weighted push-ups, and 15 weighted air squats. The goal is to complete the prescribed rounds as quickly as possible, testing strength, muscular endurance, and cardiovascular capacity.
Flavor_Text: Heavy Cindy – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Heavy Cindy: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Helga
Description: Helga is a challenging, full-body "For Time" workout designed to test endurance, strength, and mental toughness. Complete all prescribed rounds and repetitions as quickly as possible, maintaining proper form throughout. This workout targets major muscle groups and builds cardiovascular fitness, helping to improve overall conditioning and stamina. Record your time to track progress and encourage friendly competition.
Flavor_Text: Helga – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.

Name: Open 18.5
Description: Open 18.5 is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout performed for time. It consists of a 7-minute AMRAP (As Many Reps As Possible) of progressively increasing sets of 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and so on, of two movements: thrusters and chest-to-bar pull-ups. The workout challenges both cardiovascular endurance and upper body strength, testing an athlete’s capacity for sustained, high-intensity effort. Suitable for all fitness levels, with scalable options for weights and pull-up variations.
Flavor_Text: Open 18.5 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Open 18.5: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Grock
Description: Grock (General, For Time) is a high-intensity, full-body workout designed to test endurance, strength, and mental toughness. Athletes complete a challenging circuit of functional movements as quickly as possible, emphasizing speed and efficiency while maintaining proper form. This workout pushes cardiovascular capacity, muscular stamina, and willpower, making it ideal for those seeking a comprehensive physical and mental challenge.
Flavor_Text: Grock – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Grock: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: Complete the workout 'Grock' as fast as possible. Maintain good form and pace yourself to avoid burnout.
Instructions_Clean: Perform the 'Grock' workout for time, focusing on technique and steady pacing.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 15.4
Description: Open 15.4 is a CrossFit Open workout performed for time, combining increasing rounds of handstand push-ups and cleans. Athletes alternate between strict handstand push-ups and ascending rep schemes of cleans (men: 185 lb, women: 125 lb), progressing as far as possible within an allotted time cap. This workout tests upper body pushing strength, endurance, and Olympic lifting under fatigue. Scaled options replace handstand push-ups with push presses and use lighter weights for cleans. The goal is to complete the highest number of rounds and reps possible before time expires.
Flavor_Text: Open 15.4 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Open 15.4: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: Complete the workout as fast as possible, following the prescribed movements and reps. Maintain good form throughout to avoid penalties.
Instructions_Clean: Perform the workout for time, ensuring proper technique on all movements to achieve the best score.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 14.2
Description: Open 14.2 is a CrossFit workout for time consisting of ascending rounds of two movements: Overhead Squats and Chest-to-Bar Pull-Ups. Each round increases by 2 reps (starting with 10 reps of each), completed within 3-minute intervals. If you finish the required reps before time expires, you earn another 3 minutes and move on to the next, higher-rep round. This workout tests muscular endurance, cardiovascular conditioning, mobility, and upper body pulling strength.
Flavor_Text: Open 14.2 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Open 14.2: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 17.5
Description: Open 17.5 is a classic CrossFit workout completed "for time." Athletes perform 10 rounds of 9 thrusters and 35 double-unders. The prescribed (Rx) thruster weight is 95 lbs for men and 65 lbs for women. The goal is to finish all rounds as quickly as possible, balancing speed, stamina, and coordination. This workout challenges cardiovascular endurance, full-body strength, and jump rope proficiency. Suitable for both intermediate and advanced athletes; scaling options are available for beginners.
Flavor_Text: Open 17.5 – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Open 17.5: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 11.1
Description:
Open 11.1 is a classic CrossFit benchmark workout designed to test metabolic conditioning, coordination, and endurance. Complete as many rounds and reps as possible (AMRAP) in 10 minutes of:  
- 30 Double-Unders  
- 15 Power Snatches (75/55 lb)  
Athletes focus on efficient transitions and consistent pacing to maximize their score within the time cap. This workout challenges both cardiovascular and muscular systems, rewarding skill in jump rope and barbell cycling.

Name: Collins
Description: Collins (General, For Time) is a benchmark CrossFit workout focused on building cardiovascular endurance, muscular stamina, and grip strength. The workout consists of multiple rounds combining a 400-meter run, hefty deadlifts, power cleans, push presses, and pull-ups, all completed in sequence as quickly as possible. Name: Heavy DT
Description: Heavy DT is a classic CrossFit workout done "for time," meaning you complete the required work as fast as possible. It consists of 5 rounds of the following barbell complex: 12 deadlifts, 9 hang power cleans, and 6 push jerks. The "heavy" version increases the prescribed weight, challenging both strength and conditioning. This workout develops muscular endurance, grip strength, and cardiovascular fitness, requiring strategy and efficient barbell cycling. Adjust the load to maintain good form throughout all movements.

Gruber is a challenging general workout performed "for time," meaning the goal is to complete all prescribed exercises and repetitions as quickly as possible. This format encourages intensity, efficient pacing, and strategic rest, making it effective for building cardiovascular endurance, strength, and mental toughness. Suitable for all fitness levels with scalable options.

This format encourages intensity, efficient pacing, and strategic rest, making it effective for building cardiovascular endurance, strength, and mental toughness. Suitable for all fitness levels with scalable options.

Flavor_Text.from: Gruber - An effective CrossFit workout.
Flavor_Text.to: Gruber – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.

Name: Open 11.2
Description: Open 11.2 is a CrossFit benchmark workout performed for time. It consists of 9 rounds of 9 deadlifts, 12 push-ups, and 15 box jumps. The deadlift weight is moderate, the push-ups are performed to full range of motion, and the box jumps require both explosiveness and coordination. The workout challenges muscular endurance, stamina, and cardiovascular fitness. Aim to complete the work as quickly as possible while maintaining safe, efficient technique throughout.
Flavor_Text: Open 11.2 – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Open 11.2: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Erin
Description: "Erin" is a CrossFit Hero WOD performed “For Time,” challenging athletes to complete five rounds of overhead walking lunges (using two dumbbells), push-ups, and dumbbell split cleans. This workout builds full-body strength, endurance, and stamina while honoring a fallen hero. Maintain steady pacing and proper form throughout each movement. Suitable for experienced athletes familiar with dumbbell work and high-rep conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Erin – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Erin: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 15.3
Description: Open 15.3 is a CrossFit workout performed for time, blending gymnastic skill and metabolic conditioning. The workout begins with 7 rounds of 7 muscle-ups and 50 wall balls (20/14 lb), followed by 100 double-unders. Athletes aim to complete as many repetitions as possible within a 14-minute time cap, testing upper body strength, cardiovascular endurance, and coordination.
Flavor_Text: Open 15.3 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Open 15.3: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 19.2
Description: Open 19.2 is a challenging for-time CrossFit workout that features progressively heavier squat cleans, separated by sets of toes-to-bar and double-unders. Athletes complete as many reps as possible in defined 4-minute windows, unlocking more time by finishing each round before the cutoff. The format tests stamina, grip strength, technical skill, and power under fatigue.
Flavor_Text: Open 19.2 – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Open 19.2: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Bruckenthal
Description: Bruckenthal (General, For Time) is a high-intensity workout designed to test overall strength, endurance, and cardiovascular fitness. Participants complete a set sequence of functional movements—often incorporating exercises like running, rowing, push-ups, pull-ups, and weighted lifts—as quickly as possible. The workout challenges athletes to maintain good form under fatigue while racing against the clock, making it ideal for improving both aerobic and muscular endurance. Suitable for all fitness levels with scalable options.
Flavor_Text: Bruckenthal – Classic for-time intensity: aggressive but controlled from the first rep.
CoachNotes: For Bruckenthal: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: Complete the workout Bruckenthal as fast as possible. Maintain proper form and pacing throughout.
Instructions_Clean: Perform the Bruckenthal workout for time, focusing on technique and steady effort.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Bravo
Description: Workout Bravo is a high-intensity, general fitness session performed "For Time." Complete all prescribed movements and repetitions as quickly as possible. The goal is to maintain a steady pace, minimize rest, and push your cardiovascular and muscular endurance. Track your time to measure progress and encourage maximum effort. Suitable for all levels, with scaling options available.
Flavor_Text: Bravo – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Bravo: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 12.5
Description:
Open 12.5 is a classic CrossFit workout performed for time, featuring a couplet of thrusters and chest-to-bar pull-ups. Athletes complete as many reps as possible in 7 minutes, following an ascending rep ladder: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and so on, increasing by 3 reps each round. This high-intensity workout tests strength, endurance, and gymnastic ability.

Schema (editable example):  
- Type: AMRAP (As Many Rounds as Possible)  
- Time Cap: 7 minutes  
- Movements:  
  - Thrusters (100/65 lbs)  
  - Chest-to-bar pull-ups  
- Rep Scheme: 3-6-9-12-15… (add 3 reps each round)  
- Focus: Full-body strength, cardiovascular conditioning, upper body pulling
Flavor_Text: Open 12.5 – Big sets, big fatigue; smart breaking keeps you moving when it hurts.
CoachNotes: For Open 12.5: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Open 13.1
Description: "Open 13.1" is a classic CrossFit workout combining burpees and snatches, performed for time. Athletes progress through ascending snatch weights—beginning with 40 burpees and light snatches, then 30 burpees and moderate snatches, 30 burpees and heavier snatches, finishing with 20 burpees and the heaviest snatches possible within a 17-minute time cap. This workout tests full-body endurance, strength, pacing, and technique under fatigue, making it a well-rounded challenge for all skill levels.
Flavor_Text: Open 13.1 – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Open 13.1: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Athletes must complete a prescribed sequence of movements and repetitions as quickly as possible. The goal is to efficiently manage pacing and transitions while maintaining good form throughout. Grady is suitable for all fitness levels with scaling options available.
Flavor_Text: Grady – A full-body punch that rewards tidy technique and calm transitions.
CoachNotes: For Grady: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.

Name: Armstrong
Description: The Armstrong workout is a challenging, general fitness routine performed for time. It typically combines bodyweight exercises (such as push-ups, pull-ups, and squats) in a sequence, aiming to improve overall strength, endurance, and speed. Participants complete the assigned repetitions of each movement as quickly as possible, pushing both cardiovascular and muscular capacity. This high-intensity format encourages consistent progress and tracks workout efficiency over repeated sessions.
Flavor_Text: Armstrong – A straightforward suffer-fest; clean mechanics matter more than hero splits.
CoachNotes: For Armstrong: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.

Name: Brian
Description: "Brian" is a CrossFit benchmark workout (WOD) designed to test both muscular endurance and stamina for time. Athletes complete four rounds of burpees and shoulder-to-overhead presses, aiming to finish as fast as possible. This workout challenges cardiovascular fitness, explosive power, and mental toughness in a high-intensity, full-body format. Completing "Brian" is an excellent way to measure progress and improve overall conditioning.
Flavor_Text: Brian – Benchmark-style grit: push the clock without letting form fall apart.
CoachNotes: For Brian: Maintain consistent effort and prioritize movement quality.
Instructions: Complete 3 rounds for time: 21 thrusters (95/65 lbs) and 21 pull-ups.
Instructions_Clean: 3 rounds for time: 21 thrusters (95/65 lbs), 21 pull-ups.
ScalingOptions: Reduce reps, lighten load, or set time cap at 20m 0s.
